texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 2 ) Scope of Application
texts.text: Article ( 2 ) Scope of Application

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The provisions of this  regulation  shall  apply  to  all  civilian  personnel  below  the  executive  management working in government authorities in the Emirate.
texts.text: The provisions of this  regulation  shall  apply  to  all  civilian  personnel  below  the  executive  management working in government authorities in the Emirate.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 3 ) General Provisions
texts.text: Article ( 3 ) General Provisions

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The provisions of the law and this regulation, and all regulations, decisions, and policies issued in implementation thereof, must be strictly adhered to.
texts.text: The provisions of the law and this regulation, and all regulations, decisions, and policies issued in implementation thereof, must be strictly adhered to.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The government authority may issue human resource guides, policies, and procedures in a manner that does not contradict with the provisions of the law, this regulation, and the decisions and guides implementing it.
texts.text: The government authority may issue human resource guides, policies, and procedures in a manner that does not contradict with the provisions of the law, this regulation, and the decisions and guides implementing it.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The  human  resources  guides,  policies,  and  procedures  approved  by  the  government  authority determine the duties, responsibilities, and specializations of the government authority's employees
texts.text: The  human  resources  guides,  policies,  and  procedures  approved  by  the  government  authority determine the duties, responsibilities, and specializations of the government authority's employees

texts.label: text
texts.orig: and all administrative levels with regard to the implementation of the provisions of the law and this regulation.
texts.text: and all administrative levels with regard to the implementation of the provisions of the law and this regulation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. Dates are calculated according to the Gregorian calendar, and the month in the provisions of this regulation is (30) days unless the regulation expressly stipulates otherwise.
texts.text: Dates are calculated according to the Gregorian calendar, and the month in the provisions of this regulation is (30) days unless the regulation expressly stipulates otherwise.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. The following provisions related to rounding shall apply, unless the text expressly stipulates or the context requires otherwise:
texts.text: The following provisions related to rounding shall apply, unless the text expressly stipulates or the context requires otherwise:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. For the purposes of calculating the periods eligible for the employee's entitlement to the end of service benefit, part of the month is rounded to a full month.
texts.text: For the purposes of calculating the periods eligible for the employee's entitlement to the end of service benefit, part of the month is rounded to a full month.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. The amounts owing to the employee for any of the raises, bonuses, allowances, job benefits, end of service benefits are rounded to the nearest monetary unit (25-50-75) fils.
texts.text: The amounts owing to the employee for any of the raises, bonuses, allowances, job benefits, end of service benefits are rounded to the nearest monetary unit (25-50-75) fils.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. The calculation of the degree of kinship for the purposes of applying the provisions of this regulation shall  be  done  in  accordance  with  the  provisions  of  the  Civil  Transactions  Law  of  the  United  Arab Emirates issued by the Federal Law No. (5) of 1985 and its amendments. The following table can be used to determine the degrees of kinship:
texts.text: The calculation of the degree of kinship for the purposes of applying the provisions of this regulation shall  be  done  in  accordance  with  the  provisions  of  the  Civil  Transactions  Law  of  the  United  Arab Emirates issued by the Federal Law No. (5) of 1985 and its amendments. The following table can be used to determine the degrees of kinship:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7. The  government  authority  shall  commit  to  grant  equal  opportunities  to  train  and  qualify  citizens seeking work in coordination with the Authority, in accordance with the rewards controls and system approved by the Executive Council.
texts.text: The  government  authority  shall  commit  to  grant  equal  opportunities  to  train  and  qualify  citizens seeking work in coordination with the Authority, in accordance with the rewards controls and system approved by the Executive Council.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 8. The government authority shall commit to train and qualify the citizen employee in order to replace the job occupied by the non-citizen employee, or to notify the Authority to include the needs of the government authority in terms of educational disciplines required for that job in coordination with concerned authorities - as the case may be.
texts.text: The government authority shall commit to train and qualify the citizen employee in order to replace the job occupied by the non-citizen employee, or to notify the Authority to include the needs of the government authority in terms of educational disciplines required for that job in coordination with concerned authorities - as the case may be.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 4 ) Delegation of Powers
texts.text: Article ( 4 ) Delegation of Powers

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The head of the government authority shall be responsible for the proper application of the provisions of the law, this regulation, systems, decisions, and guides issued in implementation thereof. They may delegate some of their powers as needed and in the interests of the work, provided that the delegation does not violate the law and the delegator is eligible for what they delegate.
texts.text: The head of the government authority shall be responsible for the proper application of the provisions of the law, this regulation, systems, decisions, and guides issued in implementation thereof. They may delegate some of their powers as needed and in the interests of the work, provided that the delegation does not violate the law and the delegator is eligible for what they delegate.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Delegation does not exempt the head of the government authority from the responsibility of their powers and authorities established by virtue of their position, and the delegate must always adhere to consistency and good judgement when exercising what they have been delegated, and in the interests of the work.
texts.text: Delegation does not exempt the head of the government authority from the responsibility of their powers and authorities established by virtue of their position, and the delegate must always adhere to consistency and good judgement when exercising what they have been delegated, and in the interests of the work.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 5 )
texts.text: Article ( 5 )

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Delegation is made by an administrative decision from the  head of the government authority or their equivalent, which includes the delegated authorities and powers, the name of the delegated employee, job title, and the delegation period, provided that this is included in the authorities and powers table of the government authority.
texts.text: Delegation is made by an administrative decision from the  head of the government authority or their equivalent, which includes the delegated authorities and powers, the name of the delegated employee, job title, and the delegation period, provided that this is included in the authorities and powers table of the government authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The delegation decision must determine the name and capacity of the person replacing the delegate, and that in the event of their absence together , they shall be replaced by the higher official of the person who was originally delegated.
texts.text: The delegation decision must determine the name and capacity of the person replacing the delegate, and that in the event of their absence together , they shall be replaced by the higher official of the person who was originally delegated.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The authorities and powers are delegated to the employee in their functional capacity, at the discretion of the head of the government authority, according to the administrative decision issued in this regard, and accordingly the delegate assumes the authorities and powers delegated to them.
texts.text: The authorities and powers are delegated to the employee in their functional capacity, at the discretion of the head of the government authority, according to the administrative decision issued in this regard, and accordingly the delegate assumes the authorities and powers delegated to them.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. No delegate may authorize others except with the approval of the head of the government authority.
texts.text: No delegate may authorize others except with the approval of the head of the government authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. Authorities  and  powers  are  determined  based  on  the  approved  organizational  structure  of  the government authority, provided that the table of authorities and powers is reviewed when making any amendments to the organizational structure or changing the occupants of executive management jobs in the government authority and other levels.
texts.text: Authorities  and  powers  are  determined  based  on  the  approved  organizational  structure  of  the government authority, provided that the table of authorities and powers is reviewed when making any amendments to the organizational structure or changing the occupants of executive management jobs in the government authority and other levels.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. If  an  employee  is  assigned  the  work  of  another  employee,  this  does  not  entail  that  the  assigned employee  exercises  the  powers  delegated  to  the  one  who  used  to  occupy  the  job,  unless  this  is stipulated in the assignment or delegation decision.
texts.text: If  an  employee  is  assigned  the  work  of  another  employee,  this  does  not  entail  that  the  assigned employee  exercises  the  powers  delegated  to  the  one  who  used  to  occupy  the  job,  unless  this  is stipulated in the assignment or delegation decision.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7. The employee may not approve the disbursement of a benefit or allowance that pertains to them personally, unless this is in implementation of the provisions of the laws and regulations in force and the policies approved in this regard.
texts.text: The employee may not approve the disbursement of a benefit or allowance that pertains to them personally, unless this is in implementation of the provisions of the laws and regulations in force and the policies approved in this regard.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 8. Given that the authority vested in the office holder stems primarily from the position they occupy, the power and authority to disburse is in accordance with the powers of the position they occupy and within the limits of the amounts contained in the approved budget of the government authority and in accordance with the provisions in force in this regard.
texts.text: Given that the authority vested in the office holder stems primarily from the position they occupy, the power and authority to disburse is in accordance with the powers of the position they occupy and within the limits of the amounts contained in the approved budget of the government authority and in accordance with the provisions in force in this regard.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 6 )
texts.text: Article ( 6 )

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Delegation shall cease in any of the following cases:
texts.text: Delegation shall cease in any of the following cases:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. End of service of the authorized person.
texts.text: End of service of the authorized person.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Expiry of the authorization period.
texts.text: Expiry of the authorization period.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. End of the purpose for which the authorization was granted.
texts.text: End of the purpose for which the authorization was granted.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. Revocation of the authorization decision.
texts.text: Revocation of the authorization decision.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. Revocation of the position occupied by the authorized person, transferring it from them, or changing its job title.
texts.text: Revocation of the position occupied by the authorized person, transferring it from them, or changing its job title.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. Vacancy in the position of the person to whom the authorities have been delegated, for whatever reason, whether permanently or temporarily.
texts.text: Vacancy in the position of the person to whom the authorities have been delegated, for whatever reason, whether permanently or temporarily.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7. Three  months  have  elapsed  from  the  date  of  appointment  of  another  government authority chairman.
texts.text: Three  months  have  elapsed  from  the  date  of  appointment  of  another  government authority chairman.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Chapter II
texts.text: Chapter II

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Regulating public jobs
texts.text: Regulating public jobs

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 7 ) General Policy
texts.text: Article ( 7 ) General Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The Executive Council shall issue a decision regulating public functions, including the mechanism for analysing, evaluating, classifying and regulating their grades.
texts.text: The Executive Council shall issue a decision regulating public functions, including the mechanism for analysing, evaluating, classifying and regulating their grades.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The Government Authority shall prepare the organizational structure that is commensurate with its strategic objectives and needs in terms of jobs required to accomplish the work and tasks assigned to it, in accordance with the public jobs law issued by the Executive Council.
texts.text: The Government Authority shall prepare the organizational structure that is commensurate with its strategic objectives and needs in terms of jobs required to accomplish the work and tasks assigned to it, in accordance with the public jobs law issued by the Executive Council.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The government authority shall prepare the jobs budget in coordination with the Authority and the Department of Finance in light of the five-year human resources plan in accordance with the financial rules in force in the Emirate.
texts.text: The government authority shall prepare the jobs budget in coordination with the Authority and the Department of Finance in light of the five-year human resources plan in accordance with the financial rules in force in the Emirate.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. The job budget shall be prepared in accordance with the approved organizational structure of the Government Authority and the annual employment plan, and includes the following:
texts.text: The job budget shall be prepared in accordance with the approved organizational structure of the Government Authority and the annual employment plan, and includes the following:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. Types of jobs, their job titles, corresponding job grades, and financial allocations set for them.
texts.text: Types of jobs, their job titles, corresponding job grades, and financial allocations set for them.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Total job positions approved in the organizational structure.
texts.text: Total job positions approved in the organizational structure.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. Part of the job budget should be allocated to recruiting graduate trainees.
texts.text: Part of the job budget should be allocated to recruiting graduate trainees.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. The chairman of the Government Authority may make adjustments to the approved annual job budget by adding, cancelling or transferring financial allocations between said jobs within the limits of the financial appropriations for the annual budget and in accordance with the financial rules in force in the Emirate and the public job regulation issued by the Executive Council.
texts.text: The chairman of the Government Authority may make adjustments to the approved annual job budget by adding, cancelling or transferring financial allocations between said jobs within the limits of the financial appropriations for the annual budget and in accordance with the financial rules in force in the Emirate and the public job regulation issued by the Executive Council.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. The number of employees may not exceed the total number specified in the annual job budget and contained in the approved organizational structure of the Government Authority, regardless of the tool for filling the job, unless there is a special provision for that.
texts.text: The number of employees may not exceed the total number specified in the annual job budget and contained in the approved organizational structure of the Government Authority, regardless of the tool for filling the job, unless there is a special provision for that.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7. The Government Authority shall plan for its future needs in terms of human resources for the next five years and have it approved by the chairman of the Government Authority, provided that a copy of the approved plan is provided to the Authority and it is notified of any amendments to it.
texts.text: The Government Authority shall plan for its future needs in terms of human resources for the next five years and have it approved by the chairman of the Government Authority, provided that a copy of the approved plan is provided to the Authority and it is notified of any amendments to it.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 8. The Government Authority shall nationalize its jobs in accordance with the legislation issued in this regard.
texts.text: The Government Authority shall nationalize its jobs in accordance with the legislation issued in this regard.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 9. The Government Authority shall implement the approved five-year human resources plan through an annual  recruitment  plan  that  is  prepared  according  to  the  approved  job  budget.  The  annual employment plan and any amendments thereto shall be approved by the chairman of the Government Authority.
texts.text: The Government Authority shall implement the approved five-year human resources plan through an annual  recruitment  plan  that  is  prepared  according  to  the  approved  job  budget.  The  annual employment plan and any amendments thereto shall be approved by the chairman of the Government Authority.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 8 ) Human Resources Committee
texts.text: Article ( 8 ) Human Resources Committee

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The  Authority  shall  issue  a  guide  for  the  work  of  the  Human  Resources  Committee  in  government authorities.
texts.text: The  Authority  shall  issue  a  guide  for  the  work  of  the  Human  Resources  Committee  in  government authorities.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Chapter III Appointment
texts.text: Chapter III Appointment

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 9 ) General Policy
texts.text: Article ( 9 ) General Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Appointment  in  the  Government  Authority  shall  be  based  on  vacant  positions  in  the  approved organizational structure, which have an approved job description card and are included in the job budget, according to what is decided in this regulation.
texts.text: Appointment  in  the  Government  Authority  shall  be  based  on  vacant  positions  in  the  approved organizational structure, which have an approved job description card and are included in the job budget, according to what is decided in this regulation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. An employee may not work under the direct supervision of his spouse or any of his relatives up to the fourth degree.
texts.text: An employee may not work under the direct supervision of his spouse or any of his relatives up to the fourth degree.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The employee shall not participate in any decisions related to the appointment of his spouse or any of his  relatives  up  to  the  fourth  degree  or  in-laws  up  to  the  second  degree.  The  employee  shall  be responsible for reporting the relationship in writing and not participating in the decisions.
texts.text: The employee shall not participate in any decisions related to the appointment of his spouse or any of his  relatives  up  to  the  fourth  degree  or  in-laws  up  to  the  second  degree.  The  employee  shall  be responsible for reporting the relationship in writing and not participating in the decisions.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. The  candidate  for  appointment  shall  submit  all  documents  and  supporting  papers  necessary  to complete the appointment procedures, certified and approved by the concerned authorities, and the Government Authority shall keep a copy of them in the personal file of the candidate for appointment upon his appointment and maintain its confidentiality. The candidate is responsible for the validity and integrity of the documents they submitted.
texts.text: The  candidate  for  appointment  shall  submit  all  documents  and  supporting  papers  necessary  to complete the appointment procedures, certified and approved by the concerned authorities, and the Government Authority shall keep a copy of them in the personal file of the candidate for appointment upon his appointment and maintain its confidentiality. The candidate is responsible for the validity and integrity of the documents they submitted.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. The age of the candidate for appointment is recorded in all records and transactions related to them according to the date of birth as evidenced by the birth certificate, Emirates ID card or passport at the time of appointment.
texts.text: The age of the candidate for appointment is recorded in all records and transactions related to them according to the date of birth as evidenced by the birth certificate, Emirates ID card or passport at the time of appointment.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. In the event that the certificate or document mentions the year of birth only, then the thirty-first day of December of that year is the assumed date of birth that is mentioned in everything related to the employee's service.
texts.text: In the event that the certificate or document mentions the year of birth only, then the thirty-first day of December of that year is the assumed date of birth that is mentioned in everything related to the employee's service.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7. The  date  of  birth  of  the  employee  shall  not  be  amended  after  their  appointment  except  in implementation of a decision or judgement issued by the competent authorities, provided that it is duly documented if it was issued from outside the country.
texts.text: The  date  of  birth  of  the  employee  shall  not  be  amended  after  their  appointment  except  in implementation of a decision or judgement issued by the competent authorities, provided that it is duly documented if it was issued from outside the country.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 8. For the effect of amending the date of birth of the national employee after  their appointment, the approval of the Pension Fund shall be required by an official letter for each case separately.
texts.text: For the effect of amending the date of birth of the national employee after  their appointment, the approval of the Pension Fund shall be required by an official letter for each case separately.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 9. Upon their appointment, the candidate shall occupy the lower sub-grade of the approved main grade for the job, and the chairman of the Government Authority may make an exception to this condition
texts.text: Upon their appointment, the candidate shall occupy the lower sub-grade of the approved main grade for the job, and the chairman of the Government Authority may make an exception to this condition

texts.label: text
texts.orig: by appointing a sub-grade higher by not more than 5% of the number of jobs targeted in the approved annual employment plan.
texts.text: by appointing a sub-grade higher by not more than 5% of the number of jobs targeted in the approved annual employment plan.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 10. The appointed employee shall be entitled to the total salary, allowances, benefits and any other rights prescribed by law.
texts.text: The appointed employee shall be entitled to the total salary, allowances, benefits and any other rights prescribed by law.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 10 ) General Conditions for Appointment
texts.text: Article ( 10 ) General Conditions for Appointment

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The candidate for appointment to a public job shall:
texts.text: The candidate for appointment to a public job shall:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. To be a citizen of the country.
texts.text: To be a citizen of the country.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. To be of good conduct.
texts.text: To be of good conduct.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. To be not less than eighteen Gregorian years, and the age shall be proven by the birth certificate or an official extract thereof or by the identity card, with the exception of the holder of the general secondary certificate or its equivalent.
texts.text: To be not less than eighteen Gregorian years, and the age shall be proven by the birth certificate or an official extract thereof or by the identity card, with the exception of the holder of the general secondary certificate or its equivalent.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. To  have  a  national  service  card  by  completing  all  its  stages,  or  submit  a  certificate  showing  their position on it in case the candidate for the job is bound by national service. The priority in appointment shall be for those who have completed national service or been exempted from it.
texts.text: To  have  a  national  service  card  by  completing  all  its  stages,  or  submit  a  certificate  showing  their position on it in case the candidate for the job is bound by national service. The priority in appointment shall be for those who have completed national service or been exempted from it.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. They should not have been previously convicted to a penalty restricting their freedom in a felony or misdemeanour involving breach of honour or trust, unless they have been exonerated in accordance with  the  legislation in  force,  and  this  shall  be  proven  by  submitting  a  criminal  case  investigation certificate  issued  by  the  competent  authorities.  The  Authority  may  exempt  nationals  from  this condition, if necessary, based on the proposal of the Government Authority.
texts.text: They should not have been previously convicted to a penalty restricting their freedom in a felony or misdemeanour involving breach of honour or trust, unless they have been exonerated in accordance with  the  legislation in  force,  and  this  shall  be  proven  by  submitting  a  criminal  case  investigation certificate  issued  by  the  competent  authorities.  The  Authority  may  exempt  nationals  from  this condition, if necessary, based on the proposal of the Government Authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. They  should  not  have  been  previously  dismissed  from  service  by  virtue  of  a  final  disciplinary judgement or decision unless at least two years have elapsed since its issuance. The period may be reduced to one year or they may be exempted from this condition if the appointment authority finds justification for that.
texts.text: They  should  not  have  been  previously  dismissed  from  service  by  virtue  of  a  final  disciplinary judgement or decision unless at least two years have elapsed since its issuance. The period may be reduced to one year or they may be exempted from this condition if the appointment authority finds justification for that.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7. They shall prove their physical fitness for the job. The health fitness conditions shall be determined by virtue  of  a  decision  from  the  Authority  after  agreement  with  the  relevant  health  authorities  in accordance with health regulations and standards.
texts.text: They shall prove their physical fitness for the job. The health fitness conditions shall be determined by virtue  of  a  decision  from  the  Authority  after  agreement  with  the  relevant  health  authorities  in accordance with health regulations and standards.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 8. They shall have the necessary qualification for appointment to the job, and the qualification shall be duly certified and equalized by the competent authorities.
texts.text: They shall have the necessary qualification for appointment to the job, and the qualification shall be duly certified and equalized by the competent authorities.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 9. The candidate shall meet the requirements and conditions for occupying the job according to the approved job description and the schedule of the minimum periods of total experience required for appointment to the jobs.
texts.text: The candidate shall meet the requirements and conditions for occupying the job according to the approved job description and the schedule of the minimum periods of total experience required for appointment to the jobs.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 11 ) Conditions for Appointing Non Nationals
texts.text: Article ( 11 ) Conditions for Appointing Non Nationals

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. As an exception to Clause (1) of the previous article, an expatriate may be appointed, provided that there is no national candidate who meets the conditions and requirements for occupying the position, after the approval of the Authority.
texts.text: As an exception to Clause (1) of the previous article, an expatriate may be appointed, provided that there is no national candidate who meets the conditions and requirements for occupying the position, after the approval of the Authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. In order to appoint an expatriate, they shall not be bound by a contract with another government authority, unless that authority has notified them of its unwillingness to renew the contract.
texts.text: In order to appoint an expatriate, they shall not be bound by a contract with another government authority, unless that authority has notified them of its unwillingness to renew the contract.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The contract of an expatriate employee may not be renewed except after ensuring that there is no national candidate who meets the requirements to fill the position, and after obtaining the approval of the Authority.
texts.text: The contract of an expatriate employee may not be renewed except after ensuring that there is no national candidate who meets the requirements to fill the position, and after obtaining the approval of the Authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. An expatriate may not be appointed in any of the government authorities in the following cases:
texts.text: An expatriate may not be appointed in any of the government authorities in the following cases:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. If  they  previously  worked  in  a  Government  Authority  and  received  a  performance  evaluation report result that is less than (good) compared to their last performance evaluation.
texts.text: If  they  previously  worked  in  a  Government  Authority  and  received  a  performance  evaluation report result that is less than (good) compared to their last performance evaluation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. If their service was terminated by dismissal for the public interest or by reason of interruption of employment. Exception may be made after the approval of the Authority.
texts.text: If their service was terminated by dismissal for the public interest or by reason of interruption of employment. Exception may be made after the approval of the Authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. If  their  service  is  terminated  due  to  their  incapacity  to  carry  out  their  duties  during  the probationary period, or whose service has already been terminated as a result of their dismissal by a disciplinary decision, a court ruling, or a final judgment that restricts their freedom due to a felony or misdemeanour involving breach of honour or trust.
texts.text: If  their  service  is  terminated  due  to  their  incapacity  to  carry  out  their  duties  during  the probationary period, or whose service has already been terminated as a result of their dismissal by a disciplinary decision, a court ruling, or a final judgment that restricts their freedom due to a felony or misdemeanour involving breach of honour or trust.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 12 ) The approved domicile of the non-national employee
texts.text: Article ( 12 ) The approved domicile of the non-national employee

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The approved domicile of a non-national employee shall be determined in the employment contract based on his nationality provided upon appointment.
texts.text: The approved domicile of a non-national employee shall be determined in the employment contract based on his nationality provided upon appointment.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. An employee's approved domicile shall not be automatically changed at the registry of the Government Authority after changing their nationality, acquiring another nationality or changing their residence after appointment, unless approved by the head of the Government Authority.
texts.text: An employee's approved domicile shall not be automatically changed at the registry of the Government Authority after changing their nationality, acquiring another nationality or changing their residence after appointment, unless approved by the head of the Government Authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The approved domicile for eligible non-citizen family members shall be the same domicile approved in the records of the government authority, regardless of their nationalities or actual place of residence.
texts.text: The approved domicile for eligible non-citizen family members shall be the same domicile approved in the records of the government authority, regardless of their nationalities or actual place of residence.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 13 ) Priority for Vacant Positions
texts.text: Article ( 13 ) Priority for Vacant Positions

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The order of priority for vacant positions in the Government Authority shall be as follows:
texts.text: The order of priority for vacant positions in the Government Authority shall be as follows:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. A citizen employee of the same Government Authority who meets the conditions and requirements of the job.
texts.text: A citizen employee of the same Government Authority who meets the conditions and requirements of the job.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. A citizen candidate from outside the Government Authority who has completed national  service or submitted a certificate indicating his relevant status (if the candidate had to enlist in national service or if he has been exempted from it).
texts.text: A citizen candidate from outside the Government Authority who has completed national  service or submitted a certificate indicating his relevant status (if the candidate had to enlist in national service or if he has been exempted from it).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. Citizen candidate from outside the government authority.
texts.text: Citizen candidate from outside the government authority.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 14 ) Appointment procedures
texts.text: Article ( 14 ) Appointment procedures

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 1. Research and Selection
texts.text: 1. Research and Selection

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. The Government Authority shall announce its vacancies in appropriate ways.
texts.text: The Government Authority shall announce its vacancies in appropriate ways.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. The Government Authority shall select applicants who fulfil the conditions set forth in the law and regulations herein, for the vacancy that best meet its requirements.
texts.text: The Government Authority shall select applicants who fulfil the conditions set forth in the law and regulations herein, for the vacancy that best meet its requirements.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Evaluation and preference
texts.text: Evaluation and preference

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Government Authority shall evaluate the candidate in accordance with the nature of the candidate's position, taking into account the following:
texts.text: The Government Authority shall evaluate the candidate in accordance with the nature of the candidate's position, taking into account the following:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. Conducting at least one personal interview with the candidate for the vacant post before taking the decision to appoint them.
texts.text: Conducting at least one personal interview with the candidate for the vacant post before taking the decision to appoint them.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Selecting the most qualified candidate by the Government Authority according to the results of the evaluation, test and personal interview.
texts.text: Selecting the most qualified candidate by the Government Authority according to the results of the evaluation, test and personal interview.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. If the qualifications, skills, competencies, and experiences of the candidates for the job were found equal, the matter shall be referred to the head of the government authority, along with the recommendation of the Human Resources Committee, in order to select the appropriate candidate.
texts.text: If the qualifications, skills, competencies, and experiences of the candidates for the job were found equal, the matter shall be referred to the head of the government authority, along with the recommendation of the Human Resources Committee, in order to select the appropriate candidate.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 3. Fulfilment of job requirements
texts.text: 3. Fulfilment of job requirements

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. After the candidate passes all examinations, obtains all types of approvals for admission from the  competent authorities and meets any requirements related to the job, the Government
texts.text: After the candidate passes all examinations, obtains all types of approvals for admission from the  competent authorities and meets any requirements related to the job, the Government

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Authority  shall  notify  the  candidate  of  their  admission  upon  the  terms,  requirements  and financial and functional allowances prescribed.
texts.text: Authority  shall  notify  the  candidate  of  their  admission  upon  the  terms,  requirements  and financial and functional allowances prescribed.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Candidates  shall  be  rejected  if  they  haven't  passed  the  necessary  tests,  examinations  and obtained relevant approvals or if the conditions and requirements of the appointment set forth in the law and regulations herein are not met. The candidate shall be notified of the result.
texts.text: Candidates  shall  be  rejected  if  they  haven't  passed  the  necessary  tests,  examinations  and obtained relevant approvals or if the conditions and requirements of the appointment set forth in the law and regulations herein are not met. The candidate shall be notified of the result.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Appointment decision The decision to appoint the candidate shall be issued by the head of the Government Authority based on the recommendation of the Human Resources Committee, provided said decision determines the
texts.text: Appointment decision The decision to appoint the candidate shall be issued by the head of the Government Authority based on the recommendation of the Human Resources Committee, provided said decision determines the

texts.label: text
texts.orig: job title, job degree and sub-degree that the employee would occupy, as well as their total salary.
texts.text: job title, job degree and sub-degree that the employee would occupy, as well as their total salary.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 5. Commencement of employment
texts.text: 5. Commencement of employment

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. Employment may not be commenced prior to the appointment decision.
texts.text: Employment may not be commenced prior to the appointment decision.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. The  date  of  commencement  of  employment  at  the  Government  Authority  shall  be determined by agreement with the appointed employee, no later than three months after the date of issuance of the appointment decision.
texts.text: The  date  of  commencement  of  employment  at  the  Government  Authority  shall  be determined by agreement with the appointed employee, no later than three months after the date of issuance of the appointment decision.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. An employment contract shall be concluded with the employee prior to his commencement of  employment  at  the  Government  Authority,  and  after  issuance  of  the  appointment decision. The said contract shall be signed by both the head of the Government Authority and the appointed employee.
texts.text: An employment contract shall be concluded with the employee prior to his commencement of  employment  at  the  Government  Authority,  and  after  issuance  of  the  appointment decision. The said contract shall be signed by both the head of the Government Authority and the appointed employee.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d. The Government Authority shall act in accordance to the forms of employment contracts issued  by  the  Authority  and  may  not  make  any  amendment  thereto  except  with  the Authority's approval.
texts.text: The Government Authority shall act in accordance to the forms of employment contracts issued  by  the  Authority  and  may  not  make  any  amendment  thereto  except  with  the Authority's approval.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e. Before assuming their duties, the employee shall review the Rules of Professional Conduct for Government Entity Employees of and sign a copy thereof.
texts.text: Before assuming their duties, the employee shall review the Rules of Professional Conduct for Government Entity Employees of and sign a copy thereof.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: f. Upon job commencement, the employee shall sign an acknowledgment of receipt of the work,  indicating  the  work  commencement  date,  provided  that  the  acknowledgment  is approved by the head of the department to which the employee is affiliated, and is kept in the employee's service file.
texts.text: Upon job commencement, the employee shall sign an acknowledgment of receipt of the work,  indicating  the  work  commencement  date,  provided  that  the  acknowledgment  is approved by the head of the department to which the employee is affiliated, and is kept in the employee's service file.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: g. Upon job commencement, the employee shall sign a declaration that they do not work for any civil or military government entity and do not receive any pension, provided that the
texts.text: Upon job commencement, the employee shall sign a declaration that they do not work for any civil or military government entity and do not receive any pension, provided that the

texts.label: text
texts.orig: declaration is approved by the head of the department to which the employee is affiliated, and it is kept in the employee's service file.
texts.text: declaration is approved by the head of the department to which the employee is affiliated, and it is kept in the employee's service file.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 15 ) Appointment of Graduate Trainees
texts.text: Article ( 15 ) Appointment of Graduate Trainees

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Fresh graduates who are candidates for appointment shall be given special attention when they are being appointed to work in the government entity during the onboarding and functional development to hold a position in the approved organizational structure of the government entity.
texts.text: Fresh graduates who are candidates for appointment shall be given special attention when they are being appointed to work in the government entity during the onboarding and functional development to hold a position in the approved organizational structure of the government entity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The graduate trainee in government entities shall be granted a stipend according to the duration of the training program and according to the schedule attached to these Regulations.
texts.text: The graduate trainee in government entities shall be granted a stipend according to the duration of the training program and according to the schedule attached to these Regulations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. No candidate shall be appointed in job Grades 4 to 6 except after they successfully pass the training period, except for candidates with previous practical experience.
texts.text: No candidate shall be appointed in job Grades 4 to 6 except after they successfully pass the training period, except for candidates with previous practical experience.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. A training contract shall be concluded between the entity and the graduate trainee directly in the reward system and according to the model (Graduate Trainee Contract) and according to the employment procedures in force, provided there is an open vacancy which the trainee can fill at the end of the program  period,  according  to  which  the  graduate  trainee  will  not  be  included  in  the  approved organizational structure until they pass the relevant program.
texts.text: A training contract shall be concluded between the entity and the graduate trainee directly in the reward system and according to the model (Graduate Trainee Contract) and according to the employment procedures in force, provided there is an open vacancy which the trainee can fill at the end of the program  period,  according  to  which  the  graduate  trainee  will  not  be  included  in  the  approved organizational structure until they pass the relevant program.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. Their job title shall mention 'Graduate Trainee' until they complete the relevant training programme.
texts.text: Their job title shall mention 'Graduate Trainee' until they complete the relevant training programme.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. If the graduate trainee proves their competence during the training period, the head of the government entity may decide to shorten the training period for the purpose of appointment.
texts.text: If the graduate trainee proves their competence during the training period, the head of the government entity may decide to shorten the training period for the purpose of appointment.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7. If the graduate trainee did not pass the training and probation period, the period will be extended. If they pass the extension period, they will be appointed to fill the previously specified job vacancy and the required transfer will be made so that the trainee is appointed as an employee in the government entity.
texts.text: If the graduate trainee did not pass the training and probation period, the period will be extended. If they pass the extension period, they will be appointed to fill the previously specified job vacancy and the required transfer will be made so that the trainee is appointed as an employee in the government entity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 8. If  the  trainee does not  pass the extension period, their data will be included in the  Authority's job seekers database, and they can intern in another government entity.
texts.text: If  the  trainee does not  pass the extension period, their data will be included in the  Authority's job seekers database, and they can intern in another government entity.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 16 ) Appointment of Persons with Disabilities
texts.text: Article ( 16 ) Appointment of Persons with Disabilities

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. All government entity employees shall be considered equal in rights and duties, including people with disabilities.
texts.text: All government entity employees shall be considered equal in rights and duties, including people with disabilities.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. A  citizen  with a  disability shall have  the  right  to  hold  a  public position without any  discrimination between them and others, provided that the specific needs of the job candidate are taken into account when conducting tests related to aptitude for joining work.
texts.text: A  citizen  with a  disability shall have  the  right  to  hold  a  public position without any  discrimination between them and others, provided that the specific needs of the job candidate are taken into account when conducting tests related to aptitude for joining work.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The government entity shall appoint citizens with disabilities at the rate determined by the Authority out of the total number of jobs approved by the government entity.
texts.text: The government entity shall appoint citizens with disabilities at the rate determined by the Authority out of the total number of jobs approved by the government entity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. A candidate with a disability shall prove their status by submitting an official document approved by the competent authority.
texts.text: A candidate with a disability shall prove their status by submitting an official document approved by the competent authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. An employee with a disability shall be assigned to a job with tasks and duties that are in line with the classification of their disability, taking into account the provision of a suitable work environment and the appropriate means to assist them in performing their work tasks in line with the nature of their needs.
texts.text: An employee with a disability shall be assigned to a job with tasks and duties that are in line with the classification of their disability, taking into account the provision of a suitable work environment and the appropriate means to assist them in performing their work tasks in line with the nature of their needs.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. Being disabled does not constitute an obstacle to joining work, employment and career progression, or to receiving the necessary training and qualification to join work or advance in the job. The government entity  shall  coordinate  with  specialized  centres,  institutions  and  institutes  to  provide  training opportunities,  job  rehabilitation  and  scholarships  for  employees  with  disabilities  with  the  aim  of developing their scientific and practical skills and abilities.
texts.text: Being disabled does not constitute an obstacle to joining work, employment and career progression, or to receiving the necessary training and qualification to join work or advance in the job. The government entity  shall  coordinate  with  specialized  centres,  institutions  and  institutes  to  provide  training opportunities,  job  rehabilitation  and  scholarships  for  employees  with  disabilities  with  the  aim  of developing their scientific and practical skills and abilities.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7. An employee with a disability shall be granted a fully-paid leave for a (5) working days per year at most, in addition to the periodic leaves to which they are entitled.
texts.text: An employee with a disability shall be granted a fully-paid leave for a (5) working days per year at most, in addition to the periodic leaves to which they are entitled.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 17 ) Appointment of previous employees of any other government entity
texts.text: Article ( 17 ) Appointment of previous employees of any other government entity

texts.label: text
texts.orig: An employee whose service has been terminated in the same government entity may be reappointed with the same sub-grade or a lower sub-grade lower. They may be appointed to a higher grade if they acquired new experience or qualifications, or if at least one year has passed since the termination of their service at the government entity.
texts.text: An employee whose service has been terminated in the same government entity may be reappointed with the same sub-grade or a lower sub-grade lower. They may be appointed to a higher grade if they acquired new experience or qualifications, or if at least one year has passed since the termination of their service at the government entity.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 18 ) Appointment of Military and Civilian Retiree
texts.text: Article ( 18 ) Appointment of Military and Civilian Retiree

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Subject  to  the  conditions  and  controls  necessary  for  appointment  set  forth  in  the  Law  and  this Regulation, the following is required for the appointment of a military or civilian retiree in a government authority:
texts.text: Subject  to  the  conditions  and  controls  necessary  for  appointment  set  forth  in  the  Law  and  this Regulation, the following is required for the appointment of a military or civilian retiree in a government authority:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. The position for which the candidate is to be appointed shall not be one of the positions designated for trained graduates.
texts.text: The position for which the candidate is to be appointed shall not be one of the positions designated for trained graduates.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. The citizens who are candidates for appointment and are not retirees shall not encompass persons who  meet  the  conditions  of  the  candidate's  job  in  terms  of  qualifications,  competence,  and experience necessary to take the job.
texts.text: The citizens who are candidates for appointment and are not retirees shall not encompass persons who  meet  the  conditions  of  the  candidate's  job  in  terms  of  qualifications,  competence,  and experience necessary to take the job.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. The candidate for appointment who is a retired military or civilian shall not be a person whose services  in  their  previous  employer  were  terminated  by  dismissal,  suspension,  or  referral  to retirement pension by a disciplinary decision or a final court ruling, unless the Authority decides otherwise.
texts.text: The candidate for appointment who is a retired military or civilian shall not be a person whose services  in  their  previous  employer  were  terminated  by  dismissal,  suspension,  or  referral  to retirement pension by a disciplinary decision or a final court ruling, unless the Authority decides otherwise.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The military retiree shall be entitled to a lump sum financial reward according to the table attached to this Regulation, taking into account the following controls:
texts.text: The military retiree shall be entitled to a lump sum financial reward according to the table attached to this Regulation, taking into account the following controls:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. The military retiree shall be appointed with a special fixed-term contract.
texts.text: The military retiree shall be appointed with a special fixed-term contract.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. In the event that the sum of the retirement pension and the lump sum financial reward is less than the total salary determined for the lowest sub-grade of the job to which they are appointed, the remaining amount shall be added to the value of the lump sum financial reward to be equal to the total salary specified for the job grade to which they are appointed.
texts.text: In the event that the sum of the retirement pension and the lump sum financial reward is less than the total salary determined for the lowest sub-grade of the job to which they are appointed, the remaining amount shall be added to the value of the lump sum financial reward to be equal to the total salary specified for the job grade to which they are appointed.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The military retiree shall not be entitled to the end of service gratuity.
texts.text: The military retiree shall not be entitled to the end of service gratuity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. The military and civilian retiree appointed in the government authority shall be granted the allowances and benefits prescribed for the employee according to the terms of their entitlement according to the legislation in force.
texts.text: The military and civilian retiree appointed in the government authority shall be granted the allowances and benefits prescribed for the employee according to the terms of their entitlement according to the legislation in force.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. Unless  specifically  stipulated  in  the  present  Article,  the  other  provisions  and  rules  set  out  in  this Regulation shall apply to the military or civilian retiree appointed in the government authority.
texts.text: Unless  specifically  stipulated  in  the  present  Article,  the  other  provisions  and  rules  set  out  in  this Regulation shall apply to the military or civilian retiree appointed in the government authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. The civil retiree from the local authorities shall be subject to the provisions of Article (42) of Law No. (2) of  2000  regarding  civil  retirement  pensions  and  benefits  for  the  Emirate  of  Abu  Dhabi,  and  its amendments, stipulating that they shall return to service and be entitled to the total salary and financial allowances for the job grade they are appointed to, with the suspension of the disbursement of their retirement pension.
texts.text: The civil retiree from the local authorities shall be subject to the provisions of Article (42) of Law No. (2) of  2000  regarding  civil  retirement  pensions  and  benefits  for  the  Emirate  of  Abu  Dhabi,  and  its amendments, stipulating that they shall return to service and be entitled to the total salary and financial allowances for the job grade they are appointed to, with the suspension of the disbursement of their retirement pension.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7. The status of military or civilian retirees appointed in government authorities shall be rectified prior to the enforcement of the present Regulation in accordance with the provisions applicable thereto and set out in this Regulation.
texts.text: The status of military or civilian retirees appointed in government authorities shall be rectified prior to the enforcement of the present Regulation in accordance with the provisions applicable thereto and set out in this Regulation.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 19 ) Subscription to the Retirement System
texts.text: Article ( 19 ) Subscription to the Retirement System

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The government authority shall commit to register the citizen employee in the retirement system, and to pay the prescribed subscriptions in accordance with the legislation in force in the Emirate.
texts.text: The government authority shall commit to register the citizen employee in the retirement system, and to pay the prescribed subscriptions in accordance with the legislation in force in the Emirate.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 20 ) Probationary Period
texts.text: Article ( 20 ) Probationary Period

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The employee appointed by the government authority shall be subject to a probationary period of three months starting from the date they take over the work, and it may be extended for another similar period from the date they take over the work.
texts.text: The employee appointed by the government authority shall be subject to a probationary period of three months starting from the date they take over the work, and it may be extended for another similar period from the date they take over the work.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The line officer shall carry out accurate followup to evaluate the employee's job performance and behaviour according to clear bases during the probationary period, in accordance with the procedures specified by the government authority, and shall assist and direct the employee to develop their job performance and behaviour. In the light of the evaluation result, the line officer may either recommend the employee for tenure, the extension of the probationary period, or the termination of their services if it is proved that they are unfit for the job, before the expiration of a period of three months from the date of the employee taking over the job.
texts.text: The line officer shall carry out accurate followup to evaluate the employee's job performance and behaviour according to clear bases during the probationary period, in accordance with the procedures specified by the government authority, and shall assist and direct the employee to develop their job performance and behaviour. In the light of the evaluation result, the line officer may either recommend the employee for tenure, the extension of the probationary period, or the termination of their services if it is proved that they are unfit for the job, before the expiration of a period of three months from the date of the employee taking over the job.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. During the probationary period, the service of the employee may be terminated if they do not prove their competence or merit to carry out their job duties, or because of their unsatisfactory performance or behaviour, by a decision of the head of the government authority, in accordance with the approved procedures, provided that they are given a notice period of (5) working days.
texts.text: During the probationary period, the service of the employee may be terminated if they do not prove their competence or merit to carry out their job duties, or because of their unsatisfactory performance or behaviour, by a decision of the head of the government authority, in accordance with the approved procedures, provided that they are given a notice period of (5) working days.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. An employee may resign from their job during the probationary period, provided that they notify their employer of the same through their line officer, and that it be before (5) working days from the date of resignation.
texts.text: An employee may resign from their job during the probationary period, provided that they notify their employer of the same through their line officer, and that it be before (5) working days from the date of resignation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. If  a  period  of  three  months  lapses  from  the  date  of  the  employee  taking  over  their  work  without terminating their service or extending the probationary period, they shall be tenured to the job to which they were appointed.
texts.text: If  a  period  of  three  months  lapses  from  the  date  of  the  employee  taking  over  their  work  without terminating their service or extending the probationary period, they shall be tenured to the job to which they were appointed.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. The probationary period of the employee shall be extended by an equal number of leave days granted to them during the probationary period.
texts.text: The probationary period of the employee shall be extended by an equal number of leave days granted to them during the probationary period.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7. The probationary period shall be calculated as part of the employee's continuous service period with the government authority.
texts.text: The probationary period shall be calculated as part of the employee's continuous service period with the government authority.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 21 ) Table of Minimum Years of Total Experience Required for Job Appointment
texts.text: Article ( 21 ) Table of Minimum Years of Total Experience Required for Job Appointment

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 22 ) Part-Time Appointment
texts.text: Article ( 22 ) Part-Time Appointment

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Parttime appointment aims to support family stability and the social status of the Emirate's citizen employees who find it difficult to carry out the tasks and burdens of a  full-time job, by finding alternatives for Emirati employees to work for fewer hours than the full-time employees.
texts.text: Parttime appointment aims to support family stability and the social status of the Emirate's citizen employees who find it difficult to carry out the tasks and burdens of a  full-time job, by finding alternatives for Emirati employees to work for fewer hours than the full-time employees.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. As an exception to Clause No. (4) of Article (7) of this Regulation, the government authority may apply part-time jobs to some jobs within the limits of the approved job budget, after the approval of the Authority.
texts.text: As an exception to Clause No. (4) of Article (7) of this Regulation, the government authority may apply part-time jobs to some jobs within the limits of the approved job budget, after the approval of the Authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The government authority shall determine the categories of jobs that can be available for part-time work in alignment with its needs and in a manner that does not conflict with the nature of its work and does not affect the requirements of the job, provided that this is limited to jobs below the supervisory level.
texts.text: The government authority shall determine the categories of jobs that can be available for part-time work in alignment with its needs and in a manner that does not conflict with the nature of its work and does not affect the requirements of the job, provided that this is limited to jobs below the supervisory level.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. The government authority may appoint a maximum of two employees on a part-time basis for a vacant job.
texts.text: The government authority may appoint a maximum of two employees on a part-time basis for a vacant job.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. Unless specifically stipulated in this Chapter, the employee appointed on a part-time basis shall be subject to the other provisions stipulated in the present Regulation.
texts.text: Unless specifically stipulated in this Chapter, the employee appointed on a part-time basis shall be subject to the other provisions stipulated in the present Regulation.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 23 ) Part-Time Appointment's Controls and Conditions
texts.text: Article ( 23 ) Part-Time Appointment's Controls and Conditions

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The same conditions and procedures for appointment stipulated in the Law and this Regulation shall apply to the employee appointed on a part-time basis.
texts.text: The same conditions and procedures for appointment stipulated in the Law and this Regulation shall apply to the employee appointed on a part-time basis.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Article ( 24 ) Determining the Official Working Hours for Part-Time
texts.text: Article ( 24 ) Determining the Official Working Hours for Part-Time

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The official working hours for the employee appointed on a part-time basis shall be determined by a decision of the head of the government authority. This determination shall take into account the nature  of  the  government  authority's  work,  the  needs  and  requirements  of  the  job,  and  the distribution of job tasks between them.
texts.text: The official working hours for the employee appointed on a part-time basis shall be determined by a decision of the head of the government authority. This determination shall take into account the nature  of  the  government  authority's  work,  the  needs  and  requirements  of  the  job,  and  the distribution of job tasks between them.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Part-time work shall be in half of the official working hours during the official working days.
texts.text: Part-time work shall be in half of the official working hours during the official working days.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The employee appointed on a part-time basis shall abide by the deadlines set for their working hours and the procedures approved in the Attendance and Leave Regulation of the government authority.
texts.text: The employee appointed on a part-time basis shall abide by the deadlines set for their working hours and the procedures approved in the Attendance and Leave Regulation of the government authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. The employee appointed on a part-time basis may not be assigned to perform additional work after official working hours and during holidays, except within the limits of the hours specified in the decision specifying the employee's working hours.
texts.text: The employee appointed on a part-time basis may not be assigned to perform additional work after official working hours and during holidays, except within the limits of the hours specified in the decision specifying the employee's working hours.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 25 )  Determining  the  Total  Salary  of  the  Employee Appointed on a Part-Time Basis
texts.text: Article ( 25 )  Determining  the  Total  Salary  of  the  Employee Appointed on a Part-Time Basis

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The part-time employee shall be entitled to a total monthly salary, which is calculated from the total monthly salary determined for the job grade according to the approved grades and salaries schedule at the rate of (50%) of the job grade allocations to which they are appointed, with the exception of the allowance for the children  of  citizens  and  the  deployment  allowance,  which  are  paid  in  full  according  to  the  eligibility conditions.
texts.text: The part-time employee shall be entitled to a total monthly salary, which is calculated from the total monthly salary determined for the job grade according to the approved grades and salaries schedule at the rate of (50%) of the job grade allocations to which they are appointed, with the exception of the allowance for the children  of  citizens  and  the  deployment  allowance,  which  are  paid  in  full  according  to  the  eligibility conditions.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 26 ) Delegation and Secondment  of the Employee Appointed on a Part-Time Basis
texts.text: Article ( 26 ) Delegation and Secondment  of the Employee Appointed on a Part-Time Basis

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The employee appointed on a part-time basis shall not be delegated or seconded.
texts.text: The employee appointed on a part-time basis shall not be delegated or seconded.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 27 ) Vacations of the Employee Appointed on a Part-Time Basis
texts.text: Article ( 27 ) Vacations of the Employee Appointed on a Part-Time Basis

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The employee appointed on a part-time basis shall not be entitled to the following:
texts.text: The employee appointed on a part-time basis shall not be entitled to the following:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: aThe permission hours to leave work stipulated in this Regulation.
texts.text: aThe permission hours to leave work stipulated in this Regulation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: bThe two hours of leave for the nursing employee stipulated in this Regulation.
texts.text: bThe two hours of leave for the nursing employee stipulated in this Regulation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The working hours of a part-time employee shall be reduced to one hour per day during the month of Ramadan.
texts.text: The working hours of a part-time employee shall be reduced to one hour per day during the month of Ramadan.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. Unless stipulated in the two preceding clauses, the employee appointed on a part-time basis shall be  entitled  to  all  leaves  stipulated  in  this  Regulation  according  to  the  terms  and  conditions  of entitlement.
texts.text: Unless stipulated in the two preceding clauses, the employee appointed on a part-time basis shall be  entitled  to  all  leaves  stipulated  in  this  Regulation  according  to  the  terms  and  conditions  of entitlement.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 28 ) Transition from Full Time to Part Time or Vice Versa
texts.text: Article ( 28 ) Transition from Full Time to Part Time or Vice Versa

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The head of the government authority may, upon a written request from the employee, transfer them from full time to part time or vice versa.
texts.text: The head of the government authority may, upon a written request from the employee, transfer them from full time to part time or vice versa.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The service of an employee whose work is transferred from part-time to full-time or vice versa shall be  considered  a  continuous  service  since  the  date  of  their  appointment  with  the  government authority.
texts.text: The service of an employee whose work is transferred from part-time to full-time or vice versa shall be  considered  a  continuous  service  since  the  date  of  their  appointment  with  the  government authority.
