texts.orig: Article ( 29 ) General Policy
texts.text: Article ( 29 ) General Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The National Service and Reserve Authority shall select the  employees assigned to the national and reserve service courses by their names and according to the databases available to it, without referring to their employer.
texts.text: The National Service and Reserve Authority shall select the  employees assigned to the national and reserve service courses by their names and according to the databases available to it, without referring to their employer.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The government authority shall commit to allow the employee who meets the conditions for joining the national, reserve and alternative service to join the service in accordance with the legislation in force in this regard.
texts.text: The government authority shall commit to allow the employee who meets the conditions for joining the national, reserve and alternative service to join the service in accordance with the legislation in force in this regard.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The employee of the category targeted to join the national service shall be granted a leave with a total salary for a period of three working days to complete the registration process for the service and conduct medical examinations. This leave may be extended for similar periods based on a statement from the National Service and Reserve Authority.
texts.text: The employee of the category targeted to join the national service shall be granted a leave with a total salary for a period of three working days to complete the registration process for the service and conduct medical examinations. This leave may be extended for similar periods based on a statement from the National Service and Reserve Authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. The  employee  who  meets  the  conditions  for  joining  the  national,  reserve,  and  alternative  service throughout the period of their performance of this service or the period of their call-up shall be paid the salaries, bonuses, allowances, periodic leave, and other rights and privileges arising from the job, as if they were on the job. The period of their service in their job and their original work shall be considered continuous.
texts.text: The  employee  who  meets  the  conditions  for  joining  the  national,  reserve,  and  alternative  service throughout the period of their performance of this service or the period of their call-up shall be paid the salaries, bonuses, allowances, periodic leave, and other rights and privileges arising from the job, as if they were on the job. The period of their service in their job and their original work shall be considered continuous.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. The government authority shall retain its job for any of its employees who joins the national, reserve, or alternative service, or is called to it, until the end of performing this service or the call-up period, provided that the employee is returned to their job upon completion of the national, reserve, or alternative service.
texts.text: The government authority shall retain its job for any of its employees who joins the national, reserve, or alternative service, or is called to it, until the end of performing this service or the call-up period, provided that the employee is returned to their job upon completion of the national, reserve, or alternative service.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. The employee shall commit to start working for their employer within (5) working days from the date of completion of the enrolment period, according to the statement of the National Service and Reserve Authority, with a proof of the same.
texts.text: The employee shall commit to start working for their employer within (5) working days from the date of completion of the enrolment period, according to the statement of the National Service and Reserve Authority, with a proof of the same.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7. The employee called up for resuscitation training must start working for their original employer during the next working day from the date of completion of the training.
texts.text: The employee called up for resuscitation training must start working for their original employer during the next working day from the date of completion of the training.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 8. If the employee is dismissed from the national, reserve, or alternative service for any reason, they must on the next working day from the date of their notification of the dismissal  - start working for their employer, otherwise they will be considered disengaged from work from that date with the resulting consequences  of  that  discontinuance,  unless  they  present  an  acceptable  excuse  to  their  employer justifying this absence.
texts.text: If the employee is dismissed from the national, reserve, or alternative service for any reason, they must on the next working day from the date of their notification of the dismissal  - start working for their employer, otherwise they will be considered disengaged from work from that date with the resulting consequences  of  that  discontinuance,  unless  they  present  an  acceptable  excuse  to  their  employer justifying this absence.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 9. If  the  government  authority  finds  that  the  employee  was  dismissed  from  the  national,  reserve,  or alternative  service  because  they  committed  a  violation  that  requires  a  disciplinary  penalty,  it  must conduct the necessary investigation into the reasons for dismissing the employee from this service and impose the necessary disciplinary penalty.
texts.text: If  the  government  authority  finds  that  the  employee  was  dismissed  from  the  national,  reserve,  or alternative  service  because  they  committed  a  violation  that  requires  a  disciplinary  penalty,  it  must conduct the necessary investigation into the reasons for dismissing the employee from this service and impose the necessary disciplinary penalty.

texts.text: Article ( 30 ) Joining the National, Reserve, and Alternative Service During the Probationary Period

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Without prejudice to the provisions of Article (20) of this Regulation, in the event that the employee is assigned to the national, reserve, or alternative service during the probationary period, this period shall be interrupted immediately after the employee's joining.
texts.text: Without prejudice to the provisions of Article (20) of this Regulation, in the event that the employee is assigned to the national, reserve, or alternative service during the probationary period, this period shall be interrupted immediately after the employee's joining.

texts.orig: 2. The employee's probationary period shall resume after the end of the national, reserve, and alternative service enlistment period .
texts.text: The employee's probationary period shall resume after the end of the national, reserve, and alternative service enlistment period .

texts.text: Article ( 33 ) Controls for Applying the Total Salary

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The employee shall be entitled to the total salary equivalent to the job grade they occupy, in a manner commensurate with their experience and qualifications, without prejudice to what is stated in this Regulation.
texts.text: The employee shall be entitled to the total salary equivalent to the job grade they occupy, in a manner commensurate with their experience and qualifications, without prejudice to what is stated in this Regulation.

In  the  event that the years of practical experience of the candidate for appointment exceed the minimum requirements for the job, they may be granted upon their appointment an increase of 2% of  the  basic  salary  of  their  sub-grade  for  each  additional  year  of  experience  with  a  maximum increase of 20% to be added to their basic salary, based on a recommendation from the Human Resources Committee and the approval of the head of the government authority.
texts.text: In  the  event that the years of practical experience of the candidate for appointment exceed the minimum requirements for the job, they may be granted upon their appointment an increase of 2% of  the  basic  salary  of  their  sub-grade  for  each  additional  year  of  experience  with  a  maximum increase of 20% to be added to their basic salary, based on a recommendation from the Human Resources Committee and the approval of the head of the government authority.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: The employee shall be paid for the overtime work they perform outside the official working hours in a compensation not exceeding (50%) of the employee's basic salary and a maximum of 4,000 dirhams per month in the following cases:

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Conditions of Entitlement

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: The employee is requested to perform  the  additional  work  in writing.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The  tasks  that  the  employee  is assigned  to  accomplish  shall  not be the result of negligence or default from their part.
texts.text: The  tasks  that  the  employee  is assigned  to  accomplish  shall  not be the result of negligence or default from their part.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Method of calculating the value of compensation
texts.text: Method of calculating the value of compensation

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The number of additional hours shall be calculated after the employee performs (40) basic work hours per week as follows:
texts.text: The number of additional hours shall be calculated after the employee performs (40) basic work hours per week as follows:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. An hourly work salary = the employee's basic salary / 160 working hours  per  month,  provided  that  the  number  of  overtime  hours  per month does not exceed (80) working hours, and a maximum of (4) hours per day .
texts.text: An hourly work salary = the employee's basic salary / 160 working hours  per  month,  provided  that  the  number  of  overtime  hours  per month does not exceed (80) working hours, and a maximum of (4) hours per day .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. An employee entitled to overtime compensation may choose between overtime compensation or days equal to the total number of overtime hours they worked at the rate of one day for every (8) working hours.
texts.text: An employee entitled to overtime compensation may choose between overtime compensation or days equal to the total number of overtime hours they worked at the rate of one day for every (8) working hours.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 4. Compensation for Deployment
texts.text: 4. Compensation for Deployment

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. An employee deployed on an official mission shall be entitled to a daily compensation to cover the expenses they incur in order to perform the  mission assigned to them according to the schedule attached to this Regulation.
texts.text: An employee deployed on an official mission shall be entitled to a daily compensation to cover the expenses they incur in order to perform the  mission assigned to them according to the schedule attached to this Regulation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Deployment on official or training missions inside or outside the country shall take place by a decision of the head of the government authority. The head of the government authority may also deploy non-workers in the government authority on official missions outside the country or include them in official delegations - if the need arises - and the deployed person shall be treated according to the category determined by the deployment decision, provided that the decision specifies the party who shall bear the expenses.
texts.text: Deployment on official or training missions inside or outside the country shall take place by a decision of the head of the government authority. The head of the government authority may also deploy non-workers in the government authority on official missions outside the country or include them in official delegations - if the need arises - and the deployed person shall be treated according to the category determined by the deployment decision, provided that the decision specifies the party who shall bear the expenses.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. The delegation decision must include a statement of the nature and objectives of the mission, the  employee  assigned  to  perform  it,  the  authority  to  which  they  are  delegated,  and  the duration of the delegation.
texts.text: The delegation decision must include a statement of the nature and objectives of the mission, the  employee  assigned  to  perform  it,  the  authority  to  which  they  are  delegated,  and  the duration of the delegation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d. The duration of the deployment outside the country shall be determined by the duration of the official or training mission, in addition to one day for travel and one day for return from travel for countries whose travel hours are less than (10) hours, and two days for travel and two days for return from travel for countries whose travel hours are not less than (10) hours, regardless of the actual date of travel and return.
texts.text: The duration of the deployment outside the country shall be determined by the duration of the official or training mission, in addition to one day for travel and one day for return from travel for countries whose travel hours are less than (10) hours, and two days for travel and two days for return from travel for countries whose travel hours are not less than (10) hours, regardless of the actual date of travel and return.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e. The period of deployment within the country shall be determined in actual days for the official or training mission.
texts.text: The period of deployment within the country shall be determined in actual days for the official or training mission.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: f. The employee assigned to an official or training mission inside or outside the country shall be granted, in addition to their total monthly salary, a daily allowance for every day or part of a day spent in the official or training mission. This allowance shall include accommodation, food, petty cash, and transportation expenses.
texts.text: The employee assigned to an official or training mission inside or outside the country shall be granted, in addition to their total monthly salary, a daily allowance for every day or part of a day spent in the official or training mission. This allowance shall include accommodation, food, petty cash, and transportation expenses.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: g. The deployment compensation shall be paid for the period of deployment within the country to another city in the Emirate other than the one in which the concerned employee's workplace is  located,  or  outside  the  country,  and  the  monetary  value  of  the  compensation  shall  be calculated as follows:
texts.text: The deployment compensation shall be paid for the period of deployment within the country to another city in the Emirate other than the one in which the concerned employee's workplace is  located,  or  outside  the  country,  and  the  monetary  value  of  the  compensation  shall  be calculated as follows:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: -100% of the value of the compensation if the duration of the assignment or training course exceeds one day in the event that the employee bears the expenses of accommodation, food, and transportation without the government authority or the authority to which they are delegated.
texts.text: -100% of the value of the compensation if the duration of the assignment or training course exceeds one day in the event that the employee bears the expenses of accommodation, food, and transportation without the government authority or the authority to which they are delegated.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: -30% of the compensation value in case of return on the same day.
texts.text: -30% of the compensation value in case of return on the same day.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: -50% of the allowance value if the employee is hosted by the authority to which they are delegated, and the same value shall be paid to those enrolled in the National Defence College in the event that the official mission is outside the country only.
texts.text: -50% of the allowance value if the employee is hosted by the authority to which they are delegated, and the same value shall be paid to those enrolled in the National Defence College in the event that the official mission is outside the country only.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: h. The government authority may, at the request of the concerned employee, disburse them the full  deployment  compensation  before  the  deployment  date,  and  if  the  deployment  period exceeds (30) days, it will be disbursed on a monthly basis. Should the employee fail to attend the official mission or training course, the previously paid compensation for deployment shall be deducted, along with the entitlement of the first salary following the date of deployment.
texts.text: The government authority may, at the request of the concerned employee, disburse them the full  deployment  compensation  before  the  deployment  date,  and  if  the  deployment  period exceeds (30) days, it will be disbursed on a monthly basis. Should the employee fail to attend the official mission or training course, the previously paid compensation for deployment shall be deducted, along with the entitlement of the first salary following the date of deployment.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: i. The government authority shall allocate a travel ticket for the employee deployed for an official mission  or  a  training  course  outside  the  country  on  the  country's  national  carrier  (Etihad Airways), as long as its services are available.
texts.text: The government authority shall allocate a travel ticket for the employee deployed for an official mission  or  a  training  course  outside  the  country  on  the  country's  national  carrier  (Etihad Airways), as long as its services are available.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: j. The government authority may not disburse a cash compensation for the travel ticket according to the travel class entitled to the employee, and its value shall be calculated according to the system decided by the competent authorities in this regard.
texts.text: The government authority may not disburse a cash compensation for the travel ticket according to the travel class entitled to the employee, and its value shall be calculated according to the system decided by the competent authorities in this regard.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: k. In the event that the deployment is for more than three months, it is permissible to grant travel tickets to the eligible family members of the employee with the same class of travel specified for them back and forth to and from the Emirate, in addition to paying the expenses of medical treatment for the employee and their eligible family members in the country to which they are deployed during the deployment period according to duly certified receipts.
texts.text: In the event that the deployment is for more than three months, it is permissible to grant travel tickets to the eligible family members of the employee with the same class of travel specified for them back and forth to and from the Emirate, in addition to paying the expenses of medical treatment for the employee and their eligible family members in the country to which they are deployed during the deployment period according to duly certified receipts.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: l. The deployed female employee may request the issuance of a travel ticket with the same class of travel allocated to her for a companion whose degree of relationship does not exceed the third degree, provided that she submits the necessary supporting documents.
texts.text: The deployed female employee may request the issuance of a travel ticket with the same class of travel allocated to her for a companion whose degree of relationship does not exceed the third degree, provided that she submits the necessary supporting documents.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: m. The deployed employee shall be compensated for any expenses related to the completion of the  task  entrusted  to  them  according  to  the  invoices  and  documents  supporting  the disbursement.
texts.text: The deployed employee shall be compensated for any expenses related to the completion of the  task  entrusted  to  them  according  to  the  invoices  and  documents  supporting  the disbursement.

texts.text: Article ( 35 ) Annual Bonus for Distinguished Employees

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1The disbursement of annual rewards to distinguished employees in the government authority shall be in accordance with the annual rewards system issued by the Authority according to the following conditions:
texts.text: 1The disbursement of annual rewards to distinguished employees in the government authority shall be in accordance with the annual rewards system issued by the Authority according to the following conditions:

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: aThe total annual remuneration for employees shall not exceed (10%) of the total salaries allocated annually to the employees of the government authority.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: bThe value of the employee's annual remuneration shall not exceed three months' basic salary.

texts.label: list_item

texts.orig: 2Annual remunerations shall be paid by a decision of the Executive Council in accordance with the legislation in force.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 36 ) Medical Insurance
texts.text: Article ( 36 ) Medical Insurance

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Medical care shall be provided to the non-citizen employee in accordance with the health insurance law in the Emirate in force in this regard.
texts.text: Medical care shall be provided to the non-citizen employee in accordance with the health insurance law in the Emirate in force in this regard.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article  ( 37 )  Deduction  on  or  Withholding  of  the  Employee's  Salaries  or Entitlements
texts.text: Article  ( 37 )  Deduction  on  or  Withholding  of  the  Employee's  Salaries  or Entitlements

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The government authority shall not be entitled to make a deduction or withhold the amounts payable to the employee except in the following cases and according to the order of priorities listed below:
texts.text: The government authority shall not be entitled to make a deduction or withhold the amounts payable to the employee except in the following cases and according to the order of priorities listed below:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. To pay an alimony or a court-ruled debt.
texts.text: To pay an alimony or a court-ruled debt.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. To pay what is due from the employee to the government, whether for a reason related to the performance of their job, or to recover what was disbursed to them unjustly.
texts.text: To pay what is due from the employee to the government, whether for a reason related to the performance of their job, or to recover what was disbursed to them unjustly.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Under no circumstances may the deduction or withholding of these amounts exceed (25%) of the employee's total salary. As an exception, the employee may  agree in writing to making a deduction beyond those limits.
texts.text: Under no circumstances may the deduction or withholding of these amounts exceed (25%) of the employee's total salary. As an exception, the employee may  agree in writing to making a deduction beyond those limits.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 38 ) Expenses of Recruiting Non-nationals from Abroad
texts.text: Article ( 38 ) Expenses of Recruiting Non-nationals from Abroad

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The government entity shall provide the non-national employee who is recruited from abroad, upon arrival and return to their home country, with an economy class travel ticket, as well as a ticket for their entitled family members, using the national UAE airline (Etihad Airways) or its partners. If the employee wishes to travel by land or sea at their own expense, they may ask the government entity to reimburse half of the value of the travel tickets due to them. A non-national employee may exchange the travel tickets to which they are entitled upon departure with tickets to any other country, provided that they are at the same costs or at lower costs. In case of an increase in price, the employee shall be required to pay the difference.
texts.text: The government entity shall provide the non-national employee who is recruited from abroad, upon arrival and return to their home country, with an economy class travel ticket, as well as a ticket for their entitled family members, using the national UAE airline (Etihad Airways) or its partners. If the employee wishes to travel by land or sea at their own expense, they may ask the government entity to reimburse half of the value of the travel tickets due to them. A non-national employee may exchange the travel tickets to which they are entitled upon departure with tickets to any other country, provided that they are at the same costs or at lower costs. In case of an increase in price, the employee shall be required to pay the difference.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. In  the  event that the candidate is summoned for a personal interview from outside the country, the government authority shall arrange the issuance of an economy-class air ticket for the candidate only upon  arrival  at  the  beginning  of  the  appointment.  The  authority  shall  also  bear  the  full  residence expenses, with suitable housing, for a maximum of one month.
texts.text: In  the  event that the candidate is summoned for a personal interview from outside the country, the government authority shall arrange the issuance of an economy-class air ticket for the candidate only upon  arrival  at  the  beginning  of  the  appointment.  The  authority  shall  also  bear  the  full  residence expenses, with suitable housing, for a maximum of one month.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The government entity shall provide the non-national employee who is recruited from abroad, at the beginning of the recruitment process, with accommodation at the entity's own expense for a period of one month.
texts.text: The government entity shall provide the non-national employee who is recruited from abroad, at the beginning of the recruitment process, with accommodation at the entity's own expense for a period of one month.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. The government entity shall bear the costs of issuing and renewing work and residence permits for nonnational employees and their eligible family members, as well as the costs of medical examinations.
texts.text: The government entity shall bear the costs of issuing and renewing work and residence permits for nonnational employees and their eligible family members, as well as the costs of medical examinations.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Chapter Six
texts.text: Chapter Six

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Performance Management
texts.text: Performance Management

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 39 ) General Policy
texts.text: Article ( 39 ) General Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The Authority, in coordination with government entities, shall issue a Performance Management System to  measure  employee  performance  based  on  strategic  objectives  and  the  performance  of  its organizational units in accordance with the organizational structures of government entities, with the aim of enhancing individual achievements, promoting teamwork, and providing a basis for achievement rewards and achieving the desired results to realize the emirate's vision.
texts.text: The Authority, in coordination with government entities, shall issue a Performance Management System to  measure  employee  performance  based  on  strategic  objectives  and  the  performance  of  its organizational units in accordance with the organizational structures of government entities, with the aim of enhancing individual achievements, promoting teamwork, and providing a basis for achievement rewards and achieving the desired results to realize the emirate's vision.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The Performance Management System shall include the standards and elements of performance reports and  the  percentages  assigned  to  the  various  evaluation  elements  of  each  government  entity  in proportion to its type of jobs, performance report forms, and the method of calculating the overall rate of performance evaluation.
texts.text: The Performance Management System shall include the standards and elements of performance reports and  the  percentages  assigned  to  the  various  evaluation  elements  of  each  government  entity  in proportion to its type of jobs, performance report forms, and the method of calculating the overall rate of performance evaluation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The annual performance report shall be prepared for all government entity employees.
texts.text: The annual performance report shall be prepared for all government entity employees.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. The  general  framework  for  evaluating  the  performance  of  the  government  entity's  employees  shall depend  mainly  on  the  behaviour  and  performance  of  the  employee  at  work  according  to  the performance reporting form approved by the Authority. The government entity may develop its own competency model after obtaining the approval of the Authority.
texts.text: The  general  framework  for  evaluating  the  performance  of  the  government  entity's  employees  shall depend  mainly  on  the  behaviour  and  performance  of  the  employee  at  work  according  to  the performance reporting form approved by the Authority. The government entity may develop its own competency model after obtaining the approval of the Authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. Performance appraisal shall be linked to the individual goals of employees at different job levels and performance indicators to implement these goals.
texts.text: Performance appraisal shall be linked to the individual goals of employees at different job levels and performance indicators to implement these goals.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. The employee's annual goals shall be linked to the strategic and operational goals of the organizational division to which the employee belongs.
texts.text: The employee's annual goals shall be linked to the strategic and operational goals of the organizational division to which the employee belongs.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Article ( 40 )
texts.text: Article ( 40 )

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The direct manager shall be responsible for communicating with their employees to clarify and define their job duties and responsibilities and the objectives to be achieved, and to evaluate their competence and performance for the purpose of job development and enrichment.
texts.text: The direct manager shall be responsible for communicating with their employees to clarify and define their job duties and responsibilities and the objectives to be achieved, and to evaluate their competence and performance for the purpose of job development and enrichment.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The employee shall propose goals and agree on them with the direct manager according to the duties of the position they hold.
texts.text: The employee shall propose goals and agree on them with the direct manager according to the duties of the position they hold.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The  direct  manager  shall  periodically  and  regularly  review  and  evaluate  the  performance  of  their employees at least twice a year.
texts.text: The  direct  manager  shall  periodically  and  regularly  review  and  evaluate  the  performance  of  their employees at least twice a year.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. The employee in the government entity shall be responsible for performing their job duties in a manner that is favourable to such employee and to the government service. The employee shall do their best to continuously  develop  their  abilities  and  skills  according  to  work  requirements,  goals,  and  selfrequirements, and in accordance with the method of continuous learning.
texts.text: The employee in the government entity shall be responsible for performing their job duties in a manner that is favourable to such employee and to the government service. The employee shall do their best to continuously  develop  their  abilities  and  skills  according  to  work  requirements,  goals,  and  selfrequirements, and in accordance with the method of continuous learning.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. The Human Resources Department in the government entity shall be concerned with all procedures related to the stages of evaluating the performance of the employees of that entity. It shall also organize the preparation of performance reports and keep them in employee files.
texts.text: The Human Resources Department in the government entity shall be concerned with all procedures related to the stages of evaluating the performance of the employees of that entity. It shall also organize the preparation of performance reports and keep them in employee files.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. The Human Resources Department shall follow up the processes of filling out performance reports for employees according to the rules and according to the approved time periods.
texts.text: The Human Resources Department shall follow up the processes of filling out performance reports for employees according to the rules and according to the approved time periods.

texts.text: Article ( 41 )

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The annual employee performance appraisal cycle shall cover the period from the first of January until the end of December of the same year according to the Performance Management System. To evaluate the employee's performance, the employee shall hold their position for a period of not less than six months during the annual evaluation cycle, with the exception of:
texts.text: The annual employee performance appraisal cycle shall cover the period from the first of January until the end of December of the same year according to the Performance Management System. To evaluate the employee's performance, the employee shall hold their position for a period of not less than six months during the annual evaluation cycle, with the exception of:

texts.orig: 1The employee who passes the probationary period and is appointed to hold a position after the first of July, provided that the performance report prepared for the following year includes the remaining part of the year of appointment.
texts.text: 1The employee who passes the probationary period and is appointed to hold a position after the first of July, provided that the performance report prepared for the following year includes the remaining part of the year of appointment.

texts.orig: Article ( 42 )
texts.text: Article ( 42 )

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The performance appraisal system in the government entity shall include five evaluation scores whose different levels are classified in letter, numbers or symbols, as shown in the following table:
texts.text: The performance appraisal system in the government entity shall include five evaluation scores whose different levels are classified in letter, numbers or symbols, as shown in the following table:

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 43 )
texts.text: Article ( 43 )

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1If the employee obtains the highest or lowest evaluation score, it shall be justified and shall mention the specific  elements  of  excellence  or  poor  performance  that  led  to  this  score.  The  report  shall  not  be approved unless such justifications are stated and approved by the official holding a higher position than the direct manager.
texts.text: 1If the employee obtains the highest or lowest evaluation score, it shall be justified and shall mention the specific  elements  of  excellence  or  poor  performance  that  led  to  this  score.  The  report  shall  not  be approved unless such justifications are stated and approved by the official holding a higher position than the direct manager.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2All  disciplinary  penalties imposed on the employee during the performance appraisal cycle shall be taken into consideration.
texts.text: 2All  disciplinary  penalties imposed on the employee during the performance appraisal cycle shall be taken into consideration.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3The  government  entity  shall  abide  by  the  level  of  standard  distribution  of  the  total  estimated percentages of the results of the annual appraisal issued by the Authority.
texts.text: 3The  government  entity  shall  abide  by  the  level  of  standard  distribution  of  the  total  estimated percentages of the results of the annual appraisal issued by the Authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4The employee shall be informed of the results of their annual evaluation after being approved by the head of the government entity within (5) working days following the approval of the Human Resources Department.
texts.text: 4The employee shall be informed of the results of their annual evaluation after being approved by the head of the government entity within (5) working days following the approval of the Human Resources Department.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5It shall not be permissible to change the score of the employee's annual evaluation after being approved, except if the employee has seen it and gave his approval to make that change.
texts.text: 5It shall not be permissible to change the score of the employee's annual evaluation after being approved, except if the employee has seen it and gave his approval to make that change.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6If the employee is not satisfied with the evaluation of his competence, he may complain in writing from this  report  in  accordance  with  the  rules,  procedures  and  deadlines  specified  for  the  grievance mentioned in these regulations.
texts.text: 6If the employee is not satisfied with the evaluation of his competence, he may complain in writing from this  report  in  accordance  with  the  rules,  procedures  and  deadlines  specified  for  the  grievance mentioned in these regulations.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 44 ) Cases of Job Performance Evaluation
texts.text: Article ( 44 ) Cases of Job Performance Evaluation

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1Annual Performance Report:
texts.text: 1Annual Performance Report:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The  annual  performance  report  shall  be  prepared  for  all  employees  who  hold  positions  in  the organizational structure and job budget of the government entity in accordance with the Performance Management System.
texts.text: The  annual  performance  report  shall  be  prepared  for  all  employees  who  hold  positions  in  the organizational structure and job budget of the government entity in accordance with the Performance Management System.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2Employee evaluation during the probationary period:
texts.text: 2Employee evaluation during the probationary period:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The employee's behavioural capabilities and ability to perform the tasks of the assigned job shall be determined and a decision shall be made regarding their appointment to hold such position.
texts.text: The employee's behavioural capabilities and ability to perform the tasks of the assigned job shall be determined and a decision shall be made regarding their appointment to hold such position.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3Employee evaluation during the probationary period: The performance of the employee who was authorized to take any of the leaves provided for by law,
texts.text: 3Employee evaluation during the probationary period: The performance of the employee who was authorized to take any of the leaves provided for by law,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: provided that such leaves do not exceed six months, shall be evaluated during the performance appraisal cycle. If the leaves exceed six months, the performance evaluation for that year shall not be counted for the employee.
texts.text: provided that such leaves do not exceed six months, shall be evaluated during the performance appraisal cycle. If the leaves exceed six months, the performance evaluation for that year shall not be counted for the employee.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4Evaluation of transferred / seconded / delegated employees:
texts.text: 4Evaluation of transferred / seconded / delegated employees:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. If the employee is transferred, seconded, or delegated inside or outside the government entity, the entity where they worked for the longest period shall prepare a performance report. The other entity shall prepare an initial report on their efficiency and performance during the period the employee spent there during the evaluation period and shall share it with the entity responsible for preparing the report. The annual performance shall be used to guide the preparation of the report, as the case may be. In this case, the employee's interest is taken into account during the evaluation.
texts.text: If the employee is transferred, seconded, or delegated inside or outside the government entity, the entity where they worked for the longest period shall prepare a performance report. The other entity shall prepare an initial report on their efficiency and performance during the period the employee spent there during the evaluation period and shall share it with the entity responsible for preparing the report. The annual performance shall be used to guide the preparation of the report, as the case may be. In this case, the employee's interest is taken into account during the evaluation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. The performance of the employee delegated to another job shall be evaluated in addition to their original job duties, by preparing a periodic report on job performance for the job to which they are delegated, provided that the period of assignment is not less than 6 months, without prejudice to the obligation to set goals for the employee for their original position that they hold, provided that the employee's p erformance is evaluated at the end of the year according to the goals approved by the employee's direct manager in their original job and in coordination with the department to which the employee is delegated.
texts.text: The performance of the employee delegated to another job shall be evaluated in addition to their original job duties, by preparing a periodic report on job performance for the job to which they are delegated, provided that the period of assignment is not less than 6 months, without prejudice to the obligation to set goals for the employee for their original position that they hold, provided that the employee's p erformance is evaluated at the end of the year according to the goals approved by the employee's direct manager in their original job and in coordination with the department to which the employee is delegated.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 45 ) Performance Evaluation Authority and Responsibility
texts.text: Article ( 45 ) Performance Evaluation Authority and Responsibility

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The employee shall prepare the annual performance report and submit it to the direct manager for approval, provided that the job grade of the direct manager is not lower than a department head.
texts.text: The employee shall prepare the annual performance report and submit it to the direct manager for approval, provided that the job grade of the direct manager is not lower than a department head.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The Human Resources Department shall prepare a statement of the results of the annual performance reports for all employees, to be approved by the head of the government entity.
texts.text: The Human Resources Department shall prepare a statement of the results of the annual performance reports for all employees, to be approved by the head of the government entity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The  government  entity  shall  submit  reports  to  the  Authority  on  the  employees  who  received  two consecutive reports with the lowest evaluation score.
texts.text: The  government  entity  shall  submit  reports  to  the  Authority  on  the  employees  who  received  two consecutive reports with the lowest evaluation score.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. The Human Resources Department shall notify the employee of the annual performance report once approved, and the employee may file a complaint against it in line with this regulation.
texts.text: The Human Resources Department shall notify the employee of the annual performance report once approved, and the employee may file a complaint against it in line with this regulation.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 46 ) Dealing with the citizen employee who has obtained a performance report with a rating of (weak)
texts.text: Article ( 46 ) Dealing with the citizen employee who has obtained a performance report with a rating of (weak)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. If the citizen employee obtained a performance report with a rating of 'weak', the Human Resources Department shall coordinate with the line manager of the employee to determine the causes of their low job performance; accordingly, one of the following procedures shall be taken:
texts.text: If the citizen employee obtained a performance report with a rating of 'weak', the Human Resources Department shall coordinate with the line manager of the employee to determine the causes of their low job performance; accordingly, one of the following procedures shall be taken:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. Helping the employee to improve and addressing the causes that led to low performance, provided performance is evaluated quarterly.
texts.text: Helping the employee to improve and addressing the causes that led to low performance, provided performance is evaluated quarterly.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Moving  the  employee  to  another  job-if  any-through  which  they  can  prove  their  capability  to perform the relevant tasks as required, provided the line manager supervises the improvement of their performance and conducts evaluation at a quarterly basis.
texts.text: Moving  the  employee  to  another  job-if  any-through  which  they  can  prove  their  capability  to perform the relevant tasks as required, provided the line manager supervises the improvement of their performance and conducts evaluation at a quarterly basis.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. If the citizen employee obtains two consecutive reports with a rating of 'weak', after the depletion of one of the previous items, and in case the complaint is rejected, one of the following procedures shall be adopted:
texts.text: If the citizen employee obtains two consecutive reports with a rating of 'weak', after the depletion of one of the previous items, and in case the complaint is rejected, one of the following procedures shall be adopted:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: First: Moving the employee to another job within or outside the Government Authority (if any) through which they can prove their capability to perform the required tasks.
texts.text: First: Moving the employee to another job within or outside the Government Authority (if any) through which they can prove their capability to perform the required tasks.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Second: Terminating the service of the employee.
texts.text: Second: Terminating the service of the employee.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. In all cases, all of the procedures and steps adopted by the Government Authority in this regard shall be documented.
texts.text: In all cases, all of the procedures and steps adopted by the Government Authority in this regard shall be documented.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Chapter 7
texts.text: Chapter 7

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Job Development and Training
texts.text: Job Development and Training

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 47 ) General Policy
texts.text: Article ( 47 ) General Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The  Government  Authority  shall  be  responsible  for  the  identification  of  annual  training  and  job development  needs  for  its  employees  in  accordance  with  the  results  of  annual  performance  and competency evaluation as per the rules of job development, which are determined by the Academy, and in a way that supports the strategies and objectives of the Government and Government Authority.
texts.text: The  Government  Authority  shall  be  responsible  for  the  identification  of  annual  training  and  job development  needs  for  its  employees  in  accordance  with  the  results  of  annual  performance  and competency evaluation as per the rules of job development, which are determined by the Academy, and in a way that supports the strategies and objectives of the Government and Government Authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The Government Authority is committed to provide training and continuous learning to the employee to grow their individual talents, develop their capabilities and achieve the job interest according to career paths and objectives as per the tasks and needs of the Government Authority.
texts.text: The Government Authority is committed to provide training and continuous learning to the employee to grow their individual talents, develop their capabilities and achieve the job interest according to career paths and objectives as per the tasks and needs of the Government Authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The deployment of employees for training sessions shall be based on the decision of the head of the Government  Authority,  except  for  the  training  programs  that  are  implemented  by  the  Academy,  as attendance is mandatory.
texts.text: The deployment of employees for training sessions shall be based on the decision of the head of the Government  Authority,  except  for  the  training  programs  that  are  implemented  by  the  Academy,  as attendance is mandatory.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. Except for the training programs implemented by the Academy, training sessions within and outside the State  are  limited  to  citizen  employees.  In  case  it  was  required  to  include  a  non-citizen  employee  in training sessions, the Government Authority shall coordinate with the Academy in this regard.
texts.text: Except for the training programs implemented by the Academy, training sessions within and outside the State  are  limited  to  citizen  employees.  In  case  it  was  required  to  include  a  non-citizen  employee  in training sessions, the Government Authority shall coordinate with the Academy in this regard.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. The Government Authority is committed to planning and the provision of the required resources to train and develop the skills and capabilities of its citizen employees and increase the level of specialized and leadership competencies to enable them to perform their current and future job duties in the best way and create continuous learning culture at all levels.
texts.text: The Government Authority is committed to planning and the provision of the required resources to train and develop the skills and capabilities of its citizen employees and increase the level of specialized and leadership competencies to enable them to perform their current and future job duties in the best way and create continuous learning culture at all levels.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. The Government Authority shall benefit from government resources and services provided centrally by specific authorities in the Emirate to ensure the consistency of the general executive framework and the alignment of the unified Kingdom vision.
texts.text: The Government Authority shall benefit from government resources and services provided centrally by specific authorities in the Emirate to ensure the consistency of the general executive framework and the alignment of the unified Kingdom vision.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7. The  Government  Authority  is  committed  to  measure  the  efficiency  and  return  of  training  and development to ensure the best investment of government resources; it shall also provide the Academy with the results of training and development on a yearly basis.
texts.text: The  Government  Authority  is  committed  to  measure  the  efficiency  and  return  of  training  and development to ensure the best investment of government resources; it shall also provide the Academy with the results of training and development on a yearly basis.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 8. The Government Authority shall study and determine the training needs and individual development plans  for  all  of  its  citizen  employees  and  adopt  an  annual  training  plan,  in  light  of  the  results  of performance training, through the areas of improvement and development, which are determined by the line manager in the document of the employee's annual performance evaluation, or as needed.
texts.text: The Government Authority shall study and determine the training needs and individual development plans  for  all  of  its  citizen  employees  and  adopt  an  annual  training  plan,  in  light  of  the  results  of performance training, through the areas of improvement and development, which are determined by the line manager in the document of the employee's annual performance evaluation, or as needed.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 9. The Government Authority shall consider the inclusion of its training needs plans within the approved budget to cover the costs of training implementation and the costs of deployment.
texts.text: The Government Authority shall consider the inclusion of its training needs plans within the approved budget to cover the costs of training implementation and the costs of deployment.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 10. The Government Authority may contract with specialized training authorities and benefit from the best practices  to  implement  the  job  development  and  training  programs,  whether  local  or  international, pursuant to the relevant applicable legislations; it may also prioritise internal human resources that are qualified for specialized training sessions.
texts.text: The Government Authority may contract with specialized training authorities and benefit from the best practices  to  implement  the  job  development  and  training  programs,  whether  local  or  international, pursuant to the relevant applicable legislations; it may also prioritise internal human resources that are qualified for specialized training sessions.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 11. The Government Authority may terminate the participation of the employee in the training program, in case their conditions or the business need or the general interest require so.
texts.text: The Government Authority may terminate the participation of the employee in the training program, in case their conditions or the business need or the general interest require so.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 12. Before placing and deploying the employee to attend the training program, the Government Authority shall agree with the employee on a period during which the employee shall undertake to work therefor. In case they breach this commitment without a valid reason, they shall settle all the costs incurred by the Government Authority for their training and development.
texts.text: Before placing and deploying the employee to attend the training program, the Government Authority shall agree with the employee on a period during which the employee shall undertake to work therefor. In case they breach this commitment without a valid reason, they shall settle all the costs incurred by the Government Authority for their training and development.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 13. The employee shall undertake to attend the whole training program and abide by its requirements. The days of absence from the training program -if they fail to come to their workplace- should be treated as decided within this regulation in this regard.
texts.text: The employee shall undertake to attend the whole training program and abide by its requirements. The days of absence from the training program -if they fail to come to their workplace- should be treated as decided within this regulation in this regard.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 14. The employee shall undertake to settle the actual financial cost incurred by the Government Authority for their deployment to the training program, in case they fail to commit to the attendance requirements and the completion of the training program without a valid reason.
texts.text: The employee shall undertake to settle the actual financial cost incurred by the Government Authority for their deployment to the training program, in case they fail to commit to the attendance requirements and the completion of the training program without a valid reason.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 15. The employee shall benefit from the job development opportunities that are available in the Authority by  undertaking  to  participate  effectively  in  the  development  and  implementation  of  their  own development plan, applying the acquired knowledge and skills in the work environment, and activating learning exchange with their colleagues, which promotes the culture of continuous personal learning.
texts.text: The employee shall benefit from the job development opportunities that are available in the Authority by  undertaking  to  participate  effectively  in  the  development  and  implementation  of  their  own development plan, applying the acquired knowledge and skills in the work environment, and activating learning exchange with their colleagues, which promotes the culture of continuous personal learning.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 48 ) Minimum hours of training per year
texts.text: Article ( 48 ) Minimum hours of training per year

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The training of the graduate trainee shall last for the period prescribed in the applicable legislations.
texts.text: The training of the graduate trainee shall last for the period prescribed in the applicable legislations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The minimum training hours for all the employees that are eligible for training shall be equal to 40 training hours, (5 business days) each year.
texts.text: The minimum training hours for all the employees that are eligible for training shall be equal to 40 training hours, (5 business days) each year.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 49 ) Types of training programs
texts.text: Article ( 49 ) Types of training programs

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Academy shall determine the training topics for leadership and behavioural competencies, institutional support programs, future work skills, as well as the best training patterns, types and methods.
texts.text: The Academy shall determine the training topics for leadership and behavioural competencies, institutional support programs, future work skills, as well as the best training patterns, types and methods.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 50 ) General rules and requirements
texts.text: Article ( 50 ) General rules and requirements

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In order to nominate an employee for training programs, the following shall be required:
texts.text: In order to nominate an employee for training programs, the following shall be required:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The  budget,  approved  to  cover  the  costs  of  training  programs  implementation  and  the  relevant deployment costs, should be available.
texts.text: The  budget,  approved  to  cover  the  costs  of  training  programs  implementation  and  the  relevant deployment costs, should be available.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The program to which the employee is subject should be within the relevant approved annual training plan .
texts.text: The program to which the employee is subject should be within the relevant approved annual training plan .

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Chapter 8 Promotions
texts.text: Chapter 8 Promotions

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 51 ) General Policy
texts.text: Article ( 51 ) General Policy

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The employee is promoted according to the following conditions:
texts.text: The employee is promoted according to the following conditions:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. By virtue of a decision of the head of the Government Authority based on the recommendation of the Human Resources Committee, provided said decision determines the job title and job degree that the employee would occupy, as well as the total salary and the effective date.
texts.text: By virtue of a decision of the head of the Government Authority based on the recommendation of the Human Resources Committee, provided said decision determines the job title and job degree that the employee would occupy, as well as the total salary and the effective date.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The required approvals shall be obtained from the competent authorities before the issuance of the promotion decision.
texts.text: The required approvals shall be obtained from the competent authorities before the issuance of the promotion decision.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. When the employee is promoted before 01/01/2020, according to divisional or functional promotion, and the total  salary  of  the  employee  is  higher  than  the  total  salary  of  the  grade  to  which  they  are promoted:
texts.text: When the employee is promoted before 01/01/2020, according to divisional or functional promotion, and the total  salary  of  the  employee  is  higher  than  the  total  salary  of  the  grade  to  which  they  are promoted:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. The  total  salary  shall  be  distributed  to  the  salary  specifications  that  are  subject  to  pension contributions as a deduction, first from the raise of the Federation, and second from the placement allowance.
texts.text: The  total  salary  shall  be  distributed  to  the  salary  specifications  that  are  subject  to  pension contributions as a deduction, first from the raise of the Federation, and second from the placement allowance.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. The total salary shall be granted to the grade to which the employee is promoted or (5%) of the employee's total salary is added there to (to the basic salary), whichever is greater.
texts.text: The total salary shall be granted to the grade to which the employee is promoted or (5%) of the employee's total salary is added there to (to the basic salary), whichever is greater.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. The raise of the Federation and the placement allowance shall be waived when the reason of their provision is gone.
texts.text: The raise of the Federation and the placement allowance shall be waived when the reason of their provision is gone.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 52 ) Types of promotions
texts.text: Article ( 52 ) Types of promotions

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 1- Divisional promotion
texts.text: 1- Divisional promotion

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The divisional promotion of the employee shall be under the following conditions:
texts.text: The divisional promotion of the employee shall be under the following conditions:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: aThey shall have spent in the divisional grade one year at least.
texts.text: aThey shall have spent in the divisional grade one year at least.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: bThey shall have obtained a performance evaluation with a result of (very good) at least in the latest performance report.
texts.text: bThey shall have obtained a performance evaluation with a result of (very good) at least in the latest performance report.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: cThe necessary financial provision for promotion shall be available .
texts.text: cThe necessary financial provision for promotion shall be available .

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 2- Job promotion
texts.text: 2- Job promotion

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: -The employee's job promotion shall be according to the following conditions:
texts.text: -The employee's job promotion shall be according to the following conditions:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: aThere is a vacancy.
texts.text: aThere is a vacancy.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: bThe candidate for promotion shall have the minimum qualifications, practical experience, and job requirements according to the approved job description card.
texts.text: bThe candidate for promotion shall have the minimum qualifications, practical experience, and job requirements according to the approved job description card.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: cThe necessary financial provision for promotion shall be available.
texts.text: cThe necessary financial provision for promotion shall be available.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: dThe promotion shall be to the lower sub-grade of the main grade following the grade occupied by the employee.
texts.text: dThe promotion shall be to the lower sub-grade of the main grade following the grade occupied by the employee.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: eThey should have spent at least one year in the higher sub-rank.
texts.text: eThey should have spent at least one year in the higher sub-rank.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: fThey  shall  have  obtained  a  performance  evaluation  of  no  less  than  (very  good)  for  the  last performance report submitted for them.
texts.text: fThey  shall  have  obtained  a  performance  evaluation  of  no  less  than  (very  good)  for  the  last performance report submitted for them.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: gWith the exception of supervisory positions, to which promotion is by selection by the chairman of  the  Government  Authority,  priority  in  promotion  when  competing  is  given  to  the  most qualified candidate according to the annual performance evaluation, then the person who spent  who  spent  the  most  time  in  the  current  main  grade,  then  the  highest  academically qualified in  the same field, then the  most experienced in the job field. This order shall be adhered to.
texts.text: gWith the exception of supervisory positions, to which promotion is by selection by the chairman of  the  Government  Authority,  priority  in  promotion  when  competing  is  given  to  the  most qualified candidate according to the annual performance evaluation, then the person who spent  who  spent  the  most  time  in  the  current  main  grade,  then  the  highest  academically qualified in  the same field, then the  most experienced in the job field. This order shall be adhered to.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: -Without prejudice to the terms of promotion and with the exception of Clause (D), in cases where the target job is higher than the current grade of the employee by two main grades, the employee may be promoted to the sub-grade equal to their sub-grade in the next main grade at one time (temporarily) for a  period  ranging  from  (6-12)  months  after  which  they  will  be  promoted  to  the  target  grade  if  their performance is satisfactory. If  the  employee's performance is not temporarily satisfactory during the promotion period, a suitable job shall be found for them and appropriate to their abilities and skills at the same sub-grade that they occupy on a temporary basis.
texts.text: -Without prejudice to the terms of promotion and with the exception of Clause (D), in cases where the target job is higher than the current grade of the employee by two main grades, the employee may be promoted to the sub-grade equal to their sub-grade in the next main grade at one time (temporarily) for a  period  ranging  from  (6-12)  months  after  which  they  will  be  promoted  to  the  target  grade  if  their performance is satisfactory. If  the  employee's performance is not temporarily satisfactory during the promotion period, a suitable job shall be found for them and appropriate to their abilities and skills at the same sub-grade that they occupy on a temporary basis.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 3- Financial promotion
texts.text: 3- Financial promotion

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The employee's financial promotion shall be at the rate of 10% of the basic salary, according to the following conditions:
texts.text: The employee's financial promotion shall be at the rate of 10% of the basic salary, according to the following conditions:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: aThere is no non-supervisory vacancy for which the employee can be promoted to.
texts.text: aThere is no non-supervisory vacancy for which the employee can be promoted to.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: bTwo  years  have  elapsed  in  the  sub-grade  higher  than  the  main  grade  occupied  by  the employee.
texts.text: bTwo  years  have  elapsed  in  the  sub-grade  higher  than  the  main  grade  occupied  by  the employee.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: cThey shall have obtained a performance evaluation of no less than (very good) for the last performance report submitted for them.
texts.text: cThey shall have obtained a performance evaluation of no less than (very good) for the last performance report submitted for them.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 53 ) Effective date of job promotion
texts.text: Article ( 53 ) Effective date of job promotion

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The promoted employee shall be granted all the financial allowances specified for the job grade to which they were promoted, as of the date of issuance of the promotion decision.
texts.text: The promoted employee shall be granted all the financial allowances specified for the job grade to which they were promoted, as of the date of issuance of the promotion decision.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. As an exception to Clause (1) of this Article, the promotion may be returned retroactively to the date the promotion conditions are met in one of the following cases:
texts.text: As an exception to Clause (1) of this Article, the promotion may be returned retroactively to the date the promotion conditions are met in one of the following cases:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. As of the date of approving the minutes of the Human Resources Committee by the chairman of the Government Authority, and not exceeding two months in the case of job promotion.
texts.text: As of the date of approving the minutes of the Human Resources Committee by the chairman of the Government Authority, and not exceeding two months in the case of job promotion.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Once the employee fulfils the financial promotion.
texts.text: Once the employee fulfils the financial promotion.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. If the financial allocation for the job is not available when the employee is entitled to promotion according to the following controls:
texts.text: If the financial allocation for the job is not available when the employee is entitled to promotion according to the following controls:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: -If the employee has obtained an (excellent) rating in the last two performance reports submitted on them.
texts.text: -If the employee has obtained an (excellent) rating in the last two performance reports submitted on them.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: -The return of the promotion shall be with a retroactive effect for a maximum of six months.
texts.text: -The return of the promotion shall be with a retroactive effect for a maximum of six months.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: -The necessary funds for promotion shall be available in the same fiscal year in which the promotion decision was issued and may not be returned for a previous fiscal year.
texts.text: -The necessary funds for promotion shall be available in the same fiscal year in which the promotion decision was issued and may not be returned for a previous fiscal year.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: -The delay in consideration of promotion should not be a result of their criminal trial for a felony or misdemeanour involving breach of honour or trust, or the imposition of a disciplinary penalty on them.
texts.text: -The delay in consideration of promotion should not be a result of their criminal trial for a felony or misdemeanour involving breach of honour or trust, or the imposition of a disciplinary penalty on them.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 54 ) Promotion Impediments
texts.text: Article ( 54 ) Promotion Impediments

texts.label: text
texts.orig: An employee may not be considered for promotion in the following cases:
texts.text: An employee may not be considered for promotion in the following cases:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. During their study leave.
texts.text: During their study leave.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. If they have been subjected to a disciplinary penalty and the period specified for writing it off has not expired, or a decision has not been issued to write off the penalty in accordance with what is stipulated in these regulations.
texts.text: If they have been subjected to a disciplinary penalty and the period specified for writing it off has not expired, or a decision has not been issued to write off the penalty in accordance with what is stipulated in these regulations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. An employee brought to criminal trial for a felony or misdemeanour breaching honour or trust, until the end of their trial.
texts.text: An employee brought to criminal trial for a felony or misdemeanour breaching honour or trust, until the end of their trial.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. If they are a retired military.
texts.text: If they are a retired military.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 55 ) Modification of Status
texts.text: Article ( 55 ) Modification of Status

texts.label: text
texts.orig: I. General Provisions:
texts.text: I. General Provisions:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Modification the status  of an  employee who obtained a  higher  qualification  during  their  service in the Government Authority shall be as follows: -
texts.text: Modification the status  of an  employee who obtained a  higher  qualification  during  their  service in the Government Authority shall be as follows: -

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The extent to which the educational qualification of the employee matches their work and matches the needs of the Government Authority.
texts.text: The extent to which the educational qualification of the employee matches their work and matches the needs of the Government Authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The prior approval of the Government Authority in case the employee desires to obtain a higher qualification after joining the job.
texts.text: The prior approval of the Government Authority in case the employee desires to obtain a higher qualification after joining the job.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: II. General Controls: -
texts.text: II. General Controls: -

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Government Authority shall abide by the following controls when modifying the employee's status:
texts.text: The Government Authority shall abide by the following controls when modifying the employee's status:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The target job shall be according to the job conditions in terms of the required qualification, up to the fourth degree.
texts.text: The target job shall be according to the job conditions in terms of the required qualification, up to the fourth degree.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The employee shall have completed at least one year of service.
texts.text: The employee shall have completed at least one year of service.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The employee whose status has been modified may not be promoted except after the minimum period for staying in the job grade has lapsed.
texts.text: The employee whose status has been modified may not be promoted except after the minimum period for staying in the job grade has lapsed.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. Meeting other promotion conditions mentioned in these regulations.
texts.text: Meeting other promotion conditions mentioned in these regulations.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Three: Cases of modifying employee status:
texts.text: Three: Cases of modifying employee status:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The employment status of an employee who obtained a qualification may be modified prior to his appointment, provided that they adhere to the minimum requirements for filling the position.
texts.text: The employment status of an employee who obtained a qualification may be modified prior to his appointment, provided that they adhere to the minimum requirements for filling the position.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. If  the  employee  has  completed  their  studies  based  on  the  approval  of  their  employer  and  as previously  agreed  upon  in  writing,  the  Government  Authority  shall  amend  their  job  grade  by selecting the job that matches their qualification.
texts.text: If  the  employee  has  completed  their  studies  based  on  the  approval  of  their  employer  and  as previously  agreed  upon  in  writing,  the  Government  Authority  shall  amend  their  job  grade  by selecting the job that matches their qualification.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. If  the  employee  has  completed  their  studies  without  the  approval  of  their  employer  and  the qualification of the employee corresponds to the needs of the Government Authority and the nature of its work, the Government Authority may modify their status according to what the work interest requires, and in accordance with the following controls:
texts.text: If  the  employee  has  completed  their  studies  without  the  approval  of  their  employer  and  the qualification of the employee corresponds to the needs of the Government Authority and the nature of its work, the Government Authority may modify their status according to what the work interest requires, and in accordance with the following controls:

texts.label: list_item
