texts.orig: a. The  employee  shall  have  priority  in  filling  the  vacant  positions  if  they  fulfil  the  conditions required for filling them.
texts.text: The  employee  shall  have  priority  in  filling  the  vacant  positions  if  they  fulfil  the  conditions required for filling them.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. The modification of the employee's status shall be by transferring them to a vacant position.
texts.text: The modification of the employee's status shall be by transferring them to a vacant position.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Chapter IX
texts.text: Chapter IX

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Transfer, Loan and Secondment
texts.text: Transfer, Loan and Secondment

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 56 ) General Policy
texts.text: Article ( 56 ) General Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The objective of the transfer, loan or secondment shall be to achieve the public interest.
texts.text: The objective of the transfer, loan or secondment shall be to achieve the public interest.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The Government Authority may carry out the transfer, loan or secondment based on a request from the employee or the requesting authority, in accordance with what is stipulated in this regulation.
texts.text: The Government Authority may carry out the transfer, loan or secondment based on a request from the employee or the requesting authority, in accordance with what is stipulated in this regulation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The  job  to  which  the  employee  is  transferred  or  loaned  shall  be  vacant  and  approved  within  the organizational structure.
texts.text: The  job  to  which  the  employee  is  transferred  or  loaned  shall  be  vacant  and  approved  within  the organizational structure.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. The transferred or loaned employee shall fulfil the main conditions and requirements for the position they are transferred or loaned to in terms of their academic qualifications and practical experience, and be able to carry out their duties and responsibilities.
texts.text: The transferred or loaned employee shall fulfil the main conditions and requirements for the position they are transferred or loaned to in terms of their academic qualifications and practical experience, and be able to carry out their duties and responsibilities.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. The  process  of  transferring  one  or  more  employees  can  take  place  in  accordance  with  plans  for restructuring and redistribution of human resources.
texts.text: The  process  of  transferring  one  or  more  employees  can  take  place  in  accordance  with  plans  for restructuring and redistribution of human resources.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. An employee may not be transferred, loaned, or seconded outside the Government Authority during the probation period.
texts.text: An employee may not be transferred, loaned, or seconded outside the Government Authority during the probation period.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7. An employee may not be transferred or loaned to a job whose grade is lower than that of their original job.
texts.text: An employee may not be transferred or loaned to a job whose grade is lower than that of their original job.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 8. The  Government  Authority  shall  ensure  avoiding  affecting  its  tasks  in  carrying  out  its  work  in accordance with its plans and programs when carrying out transfers, loan or secondment.
texts.text: The  Government  Authority  shall  ensure  avoiding  affecting  its  tasks  in  carrying  out  its  work  in accordance with its plans and programs when carrying out transfers, loan or secondment.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 9. The Government Authority shall inform the employee of the renewal or expiration of their secondment or loan period, well in advance of issuing the decision.
texts.text: The Government Authority shall inform the employee of the renewal or expiration of their secondment or loan period, well in advance of issuing the decision.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 10. The Government Authority shall carry out the loan or secondment process in accordance with the agreement forms issued by the Authority.
texts.text: The Government Authority shall carry out the loan or secondment process in accordance with the agreement forms issued by the Authority.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 57 ) Internal Transfer
texts.text: Article ( 57 ) Internal Transfer

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Transfer within the Government Authority shall be as follows:
texts.text: Transfer within the Government Authority shall be as follows:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. By virtue of a decision of the chairman of the Government Authority upon the recommendation of the Human Resources Committee, the employee may be transferred from their job to another vacant job equivalent to their sub-grade.
texts.text: By virtue of a decision of the chairman of the Government Authority upon the recommendation of the Human Resources Committee, the employee may be transferred from their job to another vacant job equivalent to their sub-grade.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The transferred employee shall have the desire to work and occupy the position to which they are transferred, whenever possible, and work to achieve compatibility between the employee's desire and the requirements and interest of the work.
texts.text: The transferred employee shall have the desire to work and occupy the position to which they are transferred, whenever possible, and work to achieve compatibility between the employee's desire and the requirements and interest of the work.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. In the event of permanent partial incapacity to perform the job occupied by the employee based on the report of the Medical Committee, the employee shall be transferred to another job appropriate to their capabilities, with the same grade and total salary.
texts.text: In the event of permanent partial incapacity to perform the job occupied by the employee based on the report of the Medical Committee, the employee shall be transferred to another job appropriate to their capabilities, with the same grade and total salary.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 58 ) External Transfer
texts.text: Article ( 58 ) External Transfer

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Transfer outside the Government Authority shall be as follows:
texts.text: Transfer outside the Government Authority shall be as follows:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. An employee may be transferred to any other local or federal government authority, according to the requirements of the work interest, or based on a written request from the concerned employee.
texts.text: An employee may be transferred to any other local or federal government authority, according to the requirements of the work interest, or based on a written request from the concerned employee.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The issue of transfer shall be submitted to the human resources committees of the two authorities for study  and  issuance  of  a  recommendation  for  transfer  to  the  chairmen  of  the  two  government authorities  in  preparation  for  obtaining  their  approval,  and  the  Authority  shall  be  notified  of  the transfer decision.
texts.text: The issue of transfer shall be submitted to the human resources committees of the two authorities for study  and  issuance  of  a  recommendation  for  transfer  to  the  chairmen  of  the  two  government authorities  in  preparation  for  obtaining  their  approval,  and  the  Authority  shall  be  notified  of  the transfer decision.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The transferred employee shall be entitled to their salary and all benefits from the authority to which they are transferred as of the date they start work therein. As of this date, the payment of their salary and all benefits from the authority from which they are transferred shall cease, and that date shall be considered the date of transfer.
texts.text: The transferred employee shall be entitled to their salary and all benefits from the authority to which they are transferred as of the date they start work therein. As of this date, the payment of their salary and all benefits from the authority from which they are transferred shall cease, and that date shall be considered the date of transfer.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. The transfer of the employee shall be without prejudice to their acquired rights, and their basic and total salary in the job they are transferred to shall not be less than what they were earning in the job they were transferred from, unless the transfer is at their request.
texts.text: The transfer of the employee shall be without prejudice to their acquired rights, and their basic and total salary in the job they are transferred to shall not be less than what they were earning in the job they were transferred from, unless the transfer is at their request.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. The employee shall occupy a job that is equivalent to and not less than the job grade they used to occupy, provided that this is done by equalizing that grade in accordance with the matching system approved by the Authority.
texts.text: The employee shall occupy a job that is equivalent to and not less than the job grade they used to occupy, provided that this is done by equalizing that grade in accordance with the matching system approved by the Authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. An employee may be transferred from the job they occupy to a vacant job in another government authority that is equivalent to their job grade, or one job grade higher, provided that they fulfil the period decided to stay in the current job grade from which they were transferred, and provided that they fulfil the conditions for occupying the job they are transferred to. In this case they shall receive the salary of the grade they were transferred to or their total salary that they were receiving from the authority they were transferred from, whichever is higher.
texts.text: An employee may be transferred from the job they occupy to a vacant job in another government authority that is equivalent to their job grade, or one job grade higher, provided that they fulfil the period decided to stay in the current job grade from which they were transferred, and provided that they fulfil the conditions for occupying the job they are transferred to. In this case they shall receive the salary of the grade they were transferred to or their total salary that they were receiving from the authority they were transferred from, whichever is higher.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7. An employee may be transferred to any other government authority with their job grade and financial allocations.  In  the  event  that  the  employee  is  transferred  during  the  fiscal  year,  their  salaries  and financial allocations shall continue to be paid from the authority from which they are transferred, until the  end  of  the  fiscal  year,  provided  that  the  financial  allocations  are  added  to  the  budget  of  the authority  to  which  they  are  transferred,  by  deduction  from  the  authority  from  which  they  are transferred in the budget for the fiscal year following the transfer.
texts.text: An employee may be transferred to any other government authority with their job grade and financial allocations.  In  the  event  that  the  employee  is  transferred  during  the  fiscal  year,  their  salaries  and financial allocations shall continue to be paid from the authority from which they are transferred, until the  end  of  the  fiscal  year,  provided  that  the  financial  allocations  are  added  to  the  budget  of  the authority  to  which  they  are  transferred,  by  deduction  from  the  authority  from  which  they  are transferred in the budget for the fiscal year following the transfer.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 8. The employee's service is considered continuous upon transfer, and the employment contract shall be considered continuous with regard to their service period and entitlements, as if it had been initially concluded between the employee and the authority to which they are transferred. The name of the authority to which the employee is transferred in the contract shall automatically replace the name of the authority from which the employee is transferred.
texts.text: The employee's service is considered continuous upon transfer, and the employment contract shall be considered continuous with regard to their service period and entitlements, as if it had been initially concluded between the employee and the authority to which they are transferred. The name of the authority to which the employee is transferred in the contract shall automatically replace the name of the authority from which the employee is transferred.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Article ( 59 ) Loan
texts.text: Article ( 59 ) Loan

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The employee may be loaned to carry out the tasks of another vacant job or due to the absence of its occupant, provided that the job grade to which they are loaned is equivalent to that of the loaned employee or one job grade higher, and the loan may be in addition to the original work.
texts.text: The employee may be loaned to carry out the tasks of another vacant job or due to the absence of its occupant, provided that the job grade to which they are loaned is equivalent to that of the loaned employee or one job grade higher, and the loan may be in addition to the original work.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. An employee may not be loaned if they have obtained a (poor) evaluation score for the year preceding the loan.
texts.text: An employee may not be loaned if they have obtained a (poor) evaluation score for the year preceding the loan.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The decision to loan the employee shall be issued by the chairman of the Government Authority based on the recommendation of the Human Resources Committee. If the loan is between two government authorities,  the  approval  of  the  chairmen  of  both  authorities  shall  be  obtained,  provided  that  the authority is notified of that.
texts.text: The decision to loan the employee shall be issued by the chairman of the Government Authority based on the recommendation of the Human Resources Committee. If the loan is between two government authorities,  the  approval  of  the  chairmen  of  both  authorities  shall  be  obtained,  provided  that  the authority is notified of that.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. The loan shall be temporary for a period not exceeding one year, renewable for another year only, and the loan may be terminated at any time before the end of its term.
texts.text: The loan shall be temporary for a period not exceeding one year, renewable for another year only, and the loan may be terminated at any time before the end of its term.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. The working conditions in the original job shall allow for loan.
texts.text: The working conditions in the original job shall allow for loan.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. An employee may not be loaned to perform more than one job, in addition to their original work.
texts.text: An employee may not be loaned to perform more than one job, in addition to their original work.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7. The original employer shall bear the total salary of the loaned employee if the loan is between two government  authorities,  and  it  shall  continue  to  pay  contributions  to  the  retirement  fund  for  the national employee in accordance with the legislation in force in this regard.
texts.text: The original employer shall bear the total salary of the loaned employee if the loan is between two government  authorities,  and  it  shall  continue  to  pay  contributions  to  the  retirement  fund  for  the national employee in accordance with the legislation in force in this regard.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 8. The Authority shall issue the amount of loan allowance and the rules for granting it.
texts.text: The Authority shall issue the amount of loan allowance and the rules for granting it.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 9. The loaned employee is subject to the rules in force in their original employer regarding promotion and termination of service, otherwise the rules in force in the authority to which they are loaned shall be applied.
texts.text: The loaned employee is subject to the rules in force in their original employer regarding promotion and termination of service, otherwise the rules in force in the authority to which they are loaned shall be applied.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 60 ) Secondment
texts.text: Article ( 60 ) Secondment

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. By virtue of a decision of the chairman of the Government Authority upon the recommendation of the Human Resources Committee, the employee may be seconded to local government authorities and to public or private legal persons in the Emirate, provided that the Authority is notified of this.
texts.text: By virtue of a decision of the chairman of the Government Authority upon the recommendation of the Human Resources Committee, the employee may be seconded to local government authorities and to public or private legal persons in the Emirate, provided that the Authority is notified of this.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The authority to which the employee is seconded shall bear the total salary and allowances of the seconded employee, including the cost of their retirement contributions, which their original employer continues to pay to the retirement fund. They shall also receive their leaves and other entitlements from it, as of the date of the start of the secondment until the end date.
texts.text: The authority to which the employee is seconded shall bear the total salary and allowances of the seconded employee, including the cost of their retirement contributions, which their original employer continues to pay to the retirement fund. They shall also receive their leaves and other entitlements from it, as of the date of the start of the secondment until the end date.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The secondment period is included in the entitlement to the annual reward and promotion, and the secondment shall be for a period of one year, subject to renewal. The secondment may be terminated before the end of its period, and the other concerned parties shall be notified well in advance of the end date.
texts.text: The secondment period is included in the entitlement to the annual reward and promotion, and the secondment shall be for a period of one year, subject to renewal. The secondment may be terminated before the end of its period, and the other concerned parties shall be notified well in advance of the end date.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. By virtue of a decision of the Executive Council upon the Authority's recommendation, the employee may be seconded to federal government authorities, to local governments in other Emirates, to public or private legal persons in the country, and to Arab, foreign, international and regional governments, bodies and organizations.
texts.text: By virtue of a decision of the Executive Council upon the Authority's recommendation, the employee may be seconded to federal government authorities, to local governments in other Emirates, to public or private legal persons in the country, and to Arab, foreign, international and regional governments, bodies and organizations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. By virtue of a decision of the Executive Council upon the Authority's recommendation, the government may bear the total salary of the seconded employee during their secondment period.
texts.text: By virtue of a decision of the Executive Council upon the Authority's recommendation, the government may bear the total salary of the seconded employee during their secondment period.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. In the event that the employee is seconded outside the country, they shall receive their total salary from their employer, in addition to any financial allowances they receive from the authority to which they are seconded. Those allowances they receive from the authority to which they are seconded are not considered an acquired right for the employee, and their disbursement shall end upon the termination of their secondment.
texts.text: In the event that the employee is seconded outside the country, they shall receive their total salary from their employer, in addition to any financial allowances they receive from the authority to which they are seconded. Those allowances they receive from the authority to which they are seconded are not considered an acquired right for the employee, and their disbursement shall end upon the termination of their secondment.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7. The  job  of  the  seconded  employee  may  be  filled  by  a  decision  of  the  authority  concerned  with appointment therein, and upon the return of the seconded employee, they shall occupy their original job if it is vacant, occupy any vacant job of the type and degree of their job, or remain in their original job in a personal capacity, provided that a job is created for them in the first next budget.
texts.text: The  job  of  the  seconded  employee  may  be  filled  by  a  decision  of  the  authority  concerned  with appointment therein, and upon the return of the seconded employee, they shall occupy their original job if it is vacant, occupy any vacant job of the type and degree of their job, or remain in their original job in a personal capacity, provided that a job is created for them in the first next budget.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 8. The seconded employee may be promoted in the original government authority during the secondment period, in accordance with the provisions stipulated in this regulation.
texts.text: The seconded employee may be promoted in the original government authority during the secondment period, in accordance with the provisions stipulated in this regulation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 9. A seconded employee shall be subject to all policies and procedures applicable in the entity to which they are seconded, and it has the right to take all disciplinary measures against the employee, except those related to termination of service, which is the responsibility of their original employer.
texts.text: A seconded employee shall be subject to all policies and procedures applicable in the entity to which they are seconded, and it has the right to take all disciplinary measures against the employee, except those related to termination of service, which is the responsibility of their original employer.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Chapter Ten
texts.text: Chapter Ten

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Official Working Days and Hours
texts.text: Official Working Days and Hours

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 61 ) General Policy
texts.text: Article ( 61 ) General Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The days and number of official working hours for the government and any amendments thereto shall be determined by a decision of the Executive Council based on the Authority's recommendation.
texts.text: The days and number of official working hours for the government and any amendments thereto shall be determined by a decision of the Executive Council based on the Authority's recommendation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The government entity may submit a request to the Authority to change the days and number of official working hours proportionally to the nature of work and their need of the work. The Authority shall study the request and submit its recommendation to the Executive Council for approval.
texts.text: The government entity may submit a request to the Authority to change the days and number of official working hours proportionally to the nature of work and their need of the work. The Authority shall study the request and submit its recommendation to the Executive Council for approval.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The government entity shall announce by appropriate means its official working days and hours.
texts.text: The government entity shall announce by appropriate means its official working days and hours.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. Subject to the provisions of these Regulations, the official working hours per day for the employee shall not be less than half of the specified working hours.
texts.text: Subject to the provisions of these Regulations, the official working hours per day for the employee shall not be less than half of the specified working hours.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 62 ) Flexible Working System
texts.text: Article ( 62 ) Flexible Working System

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The government entity may allow its employees to work with flexible hours in line with the nature of the work, provided that the number of daily working hours for the employee is not less than the official working hours.
texts.text: The government entity may allow its employees to work with flexible hours in line with the nature of the work, provided that the number of daily working hours for the employee is not less than the official working hours.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 63 ) Remote Working System
texts.text: Article ( 63 ) Remote Working System

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The remote working system is based on the principle of performing work and carrying out job duties for the employee from outside the workplace at the government entity, provided that the employee keeps  their  direct  supervisor  updated  on  their  progress  in  work,  achievements  and  findings,  as determined by the government entity in this regard, according to the following controls:
texts.text: The remote working system is based on the principle of performing work and carrying out job duties for the employee from outside the workplace at the government entity, provided that the employee keeps  their  direct  supervisor  updated  on  their  progress  in  work,  achievements  and  findings,  as determined by the government entity in this regard, according to the following controls:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. The employee's job level should be below the supervisory level.
texts.text: The employee's job level should be below the supervisory level.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. The employee must have spent at least 6 months in the same job.
texts.text: The employee must have spent at least 6 months in the same job.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. The  nature  of  the  work  can  be  performed  through  means  of  communication  and  information technology.
texts.text: The  nature  of  the  work  can  be  performed  through  means  of  communication  and  information technology.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d. The time of remote work may be outside the approved working hours in the entity, provided that the working hours are determined according to the circumstances and nature of the work need, taking into account other provisions related to working times.
texts.text: The time of remote work may be outside the approved working hours in the entity, provided that the working hours are determined according to the circumstances and nature of the work need, taking into account other provisions related to working times.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e. An employee working remotely may not authorize others to perform their work.
texts.text: An employee working remotely may not authorize others to perform their work.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: f. The nature of the employee's work should involve direct dealing with clients.
texts.text: The nature of the employee's work should involve direct dealing with clients.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: g. The application of this system shall not affect the progress and regularity of work in the government entity.
texts.text: The application of this system shall not affect the progress and regularity of work in the government entity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The government entity shall determine the framework of coordination with the employee working remotely, and the manner that ensures that the employee submits all work completion reports in accordance with their job duties.
texts.text: The government entity shall determine the framework of coordination with the employee working remotely, and the manner that ensures that the employee submits all work completion reports in accordance with their job duties.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The government entity must provide effective means of communication with its employees working remotely, and any other commitments that guarantee the quality of work and productivity.
texts.text: The government entity must provide effective means of communication with its employees working remotely, and any other commitments that guarantee the quality of work and productivity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. The government entity may allow any of its current or new employees to perform their work remotely, at  the  request  of  the  employee  or  if  offered  by  the  government  entity,  whether  permanently  or temporarily, provided that the controls stipulated in these Regulations are met.
texts.text: The government entity may allow any of its current or new employees to perform their work remotely, at  the  request  of  the  employee  or  if  offered  by  the  government  entity,  whether  permanently  or temporarily, provided that the controls stipulated in these Regulations are met.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. The government entity may ask the employee working remotely to attend the workplace whenever required by the work conditions.
texts.text: The government entity may ask the employee working remotely to attend the workplace whenever required by the work conditions.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. The  government  entity  wishing  to  implement  the  remote  working  system  shall  establish  its management system and the Procedural Guide that explains and defines the mechanisms and controls for implementing the remote working system, the relevant KPIs, and the percentage of the number of employees who will be working remotely if approved by the Authority.
texts.text: The  government  entity  wishing  to  implement  the  remote  working  system  shall  establish  its management system and the Procedural Guide that explains and defines the mechanisms and controls for implementing the remote working system, the relevant KPIs, and the percentage of the number of employees who will be working remotely if approved by the Authority.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 64 ) Shift System
texts.text: Article ( 64 ) Shift System

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The government entity may apply the shift system to all or some positions or organizational divisions within its structure, according to its work needs, nature of work tasks, and in a manner consistent with the provision of its services and the exercise of its activities, provided that no contradiction is made to the decisions issued in this regard and that the total working hours do not exceed 48 hours per week.
texts.text: The government entity may apply the shift system to all or some positions or organizational divisions within its structure, according to its work needs, nature of work tasks, and in a manner consistent with the provision of its services and the exercise of its activities, provided that no contradiction is made to the decisions issued in this regard and that the total working hours do not exceed 48 hours per week.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The government entity may apply a system of one, two, or three shift(s) per day, according to the conditions and requirements of the work required. It shall determine schedules of working days and hours for employees working in shifts.
texts.text: The government entity may apply a system of one, two, or three shift(s) per day, according to the conditions and requirements of the work required. It shall determine schedules of working days and hours for employees working in shifts.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The  government  entity  shall  notify  the  Authority  of  the  shift  system  in  force  and  the  reasons  for applying it.
texts.text: The  government  entity  shall  notify  the  Authority  of  the  shift  system  in  force  and  the  reasons  for applying it.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 65 ) Absence by Permission Hours
texts.text: Article ( 65 ) Absence by Permission Hours

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The employee may be absent for certain hours during official working hours once approved by their direct supervisor, if the employee had personal reasons justifying their absence.
texts.text: The employee may be absent for certain hours during official working hours once approved by their direct supervisor, if the employee had personal reasons justifying their absence.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The absence by permission hours shall not exceed eight hours per month.
texts.text: The absence by permission hours shall not exceed eight hours per month.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The daily absence hours by permission shall not exceed half of the daily working hours.
texts.text: The daily absence hours by permission shall not exceed half of the daily working hours.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 66 ) Overtime
texts.text: Article ( 66 ) Overtime

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Compensation for work on official holidays:
texts.text: Compensation for work on official holidays:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. The direct manager may ask the employee to work on an official holiday, according to the work requirements and needs, for a maximum of 8 hours per day.
texts.text: The direct manager may ask the employee to work on an official holiday, according to the work requirements and needs, for a maximum of 8 hours per day.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. The employee assigned to work on official holidays shall be granted days equal to the number of days during which they worked. If the employee worked less than a full day during the official holiday, it shall be considered a full day. These days shall be added to their periodic leave with the approval of the direct manager / senior manager, provided that their position is not lower than a department manager.
texts.text: The employee assigned to work on official holidays shall be granted days equal to the number of days during which they worked. If the employee worked less than a full day during the official holiday, it shall be considered a full day. These days shall be added to their periodic leave with the approval of the direct manager / senior manager, provided that their position is not lower than a department manager.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. If an official holiday falls on official work duty days, the employee shall be granted a number of days equal to the number of days they work during the holiday as part of the official work duty.
texts.text: If an official holiday falls on official work duty days, the employee shall be granted a number of days equal to the number of days they work during the holiday as part of the official work duty.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d. If the working day of shift employees coincides with an official holiday - except for the weekend - the employee shall be granted a compensatory periodic leave of equal days to be added to their
texts.text: If the working day of shift employees coincides with an official holiday - except for the weekend - the employee shall be granted a compensatory periodic leave of equal days to be added to their

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: allowed periodic leave.
texts.text: allowed periodic leave.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 2. Compensation for overtime:
texts.text: 2. Compensation for overtime:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The direct  manager  may require the  employee to  work  outside  official  working  hours  according to  the following conditions:
texts.text: The direct  manager  may require the  employee to  work  outside  official  working  hours  according to  the following conditions:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. Overtime work assignment shall be issued in writing by the Director of the Department or their representative, including the nature of the work to be performed by the employee and the number of working required for the completion of the assignment.
texts.text: Overtime work assignment shall be issued in writing by the Director of the Department or their representative, including the nature of the work to be performed by the employee and the number of working required for the completion of the assignment.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. The assigned overtime shall meet the actual work needs and requirements.
texts.text: The assigned overtime shall meet the actual work needs and requirements.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 67 ) Official Holidays
texts.text: Article ( 67 ) Official Holidays

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The Authority shall announce the occasions considered a holiday for government entities, provided that the announcement specifies the dates and number of official holidays, in a manner that takes into account the nature of the work of government entities required to work around the clock.
texts.text: The Authority shall announce the occasions considered a holiday for government entities, provided that the announcement specifies the dates and number of official holidays, in a manner that takes into account the nature of the work of government entities required to work around the clock.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The government entity that is required, by nature, to ensure the continuation of its work during official holidays shall determine its working times and hours according to their work requirements.
texts.text: The government entity that is required, by nature, to ensure the continuation of its work during official holidays shall determine its working times and hours according to their work requirements.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The government entity may not transfer the official holiday or compensate for the holiday if it coincides with a weekly holiday or any other official holiday, except by virtue of a decision issued by the Executive Council.
texts.text: The government entity may not transfer the official holiday or compensate for the holiday if it coincides with a weekly holiday or any other official holiday, except by virtue of a decision issued by the Executive Council.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 68 ) Controls of Commitment to Official Working Hours
texts.text: Article ( 68 ) Controls of Commitment to Official Working Hours

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The  government  entity  shall  establish  an  internal  regulation  that  defines  the  controls  of  workplace attendance and departure, and proof of attendance and departure, in accordance with the nature of its work and requirements.
texts.text: The  government  entity  shall  establish  an  internal  regulation  that  defines  the  controls  of  workplace attendance and departure, and proof of attendance and departure, in accordance with the nature of its work and requirements.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The employee shall commit to attending and leaving work at the specified working hours as announced by the government entity, and shall carry out their job duties during official working hours.
texts.text: The employee shall commit to attending and leaving work at the specified working hours as announced by the government entity, and shall carry out their job duties during official working hours.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. In  the  event  of  an  emergency  preventing  the  employee  from  attending  and  leaving  during  official working hours, they shall inform their direct manager thereof, and the employee may not leave work unless a permission is granted by their direct manager.
texts.text: In  the  event  of  an  emergency  preventing  the  employee  from  attending  and  leaving  during  official working hours, they shall inform their direct manager thereof, and the employee may not leave work unless a permission is granted by their direct manager.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 69 )
texts.text: Article ( 69 )

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The  government  entity  shall  set  the  necessary  systems,  controls,  and  procedures,  to  ensure  flexible attendance and departure systems for employees in bad weather, according to the following explanatory guidelines:
texts.text: The  government  entity  shall  set  the  necessary  systems,  controls,  and  procedures,  to  ensure  flexible attendance and departure systems for employees in bad weather, according to the following explanatory guidelines:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Developing appropriate internal systems, controls and procedures to ensure the safety of employees and maintain business continuity.
texts.text: Developing appropriate internal systems, controls and procedures to ensure the safety of employees and maintain business continuity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Meeting the occupational safety and health requirements and human resources requirements internally to support the application of the systems and procedures proposed in this regard.
texts.text: Meeting the occupational safety and health requirements and human resources requirements internally to support the application of the systems and procedures proposed in this regard.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. Coordinating  with  the  concerned  authorities  to  identify  bad  weather  conditions  that  may  require alerting employees.
texts.text: Coordinating  with  the  concerned  authorities  to  identify  bad  weather  conditions  that  may  require alerting employees.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. Communicating with employees in bad weather using the most appropriate means of communication.
texts.text: Communicating with employees in bad weather using the most appropriate means of communication.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. Spreading  awareness  among  employees  of  the  importance  of  avoiding  being  on  the  roads  in  bad weather and poor visibility.
texts.text: Spreading  awareness  among  employees  of  the  importance  of  avoiding  being  on  the  roads  in  bad weather and poor visibility.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. Giving priority to employees using external roads.
texts.text: Giving priority to employees using external roads.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Chapter Eleven
texts.text: Chapter Eleven

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Leaves
texts.text: Leaves

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 70 ) General Policy
texts.text: Article ( 70 ) General Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. All  types  of  holidays  shall  be  calculated  on  the  basis  of  Calendar  days,  including  the  weekends  and official holidays during which they fall, unless otherwise specified in these Regulations.
texts.text: All  types  of  holidays  shall  be  calculated  on  the  basis  of  Calendar  days,  including  the  weekends  and official holidays during which they fall, unless otherwise specified in these Regulations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Leaves  include:  periodic  (annual)  leave,  sick  leave,  work  injury  leave,  study  leave,  sabbatical  leave, maternity leave, paternity leave, bereavement/mourning leave, Iddah leave, pilgrimage leave, patient accompaniment leave, and unpaid leave.
texts.text: Leaves  include:  periodic  (annual)  leave,  sick  leave,  work  injury  leave,  study  leave,  sabbatical  leave, maternity leave, paternity leave, bereavement/mourning leave, Iddah leave, pilgrimage leave, patient accompaniment leave, and unpaid leave.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The  employee's  period  of  service  shall  be  considered  continuous  even  if  they  take  prescribed  and authorized leaves. The leave period shall be counted within their service period.
texts.text: The  employee's  period  of  service  shall  be  considered  continuous  even  if  they  take  prescribed  and authorized leaves. The leave period shall be counted within their service period.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. It  is  not  permissible  for  the  employee to  be  absent from work except within the limits of the leaves granted  thereto.  Employees  shall  resume  their  work  after  their  leave  ends,  otherwise  they  will  be considered as absent from work and the relevant provisions in these Regulations shall be applied in this regard.
texts.text: It  is  not  permissible  for  the  employee to  be  absent from work except within the limits of the leaves granted  thereto.  Employees  shall  resume  their  work  after  their  leave  ends,  otherwise  they  will  be considered as absent from work and the relevant provisions in these Regulations shall be applied in this regard.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. An  employee  who  has  been  absent  from  work  shall  not  be  entitled  to  any  of  the  types  of  leaves prescribed in these Regulations for the period of their absence.
texts.text: An  employee  who  has  been  absent  from  work  shall  not  be  entitled  to  any  of  the  types  of  leaves prescribed in these Regulations for the period of their absence.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. The  government entity  may  grant  the  employee  continuous  multiple  leaves  in  accordance  with  the provisions and controls specified in these Regulations.
texts.text: The  government entity  may  grant  the  employee  continuous  multiple  leaves  in  accordance  with  the provisions and controls specified in these Regulations.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 71 ) Periodic (Annual) Leave
texts.text: Article ( 71 ) Periodic (Annual) Leave

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The employee shall be entitled to a periodic leave that will be granted to them at their request. An employee shall be authorized to take a leave once approved by their direct manager within a period not exceeding seven working days from the date of submitting the application, otherwise the requested leave shall be considered approved.
texts.text: The employee shall be entitled to a periodic leave that will be granted to them at their request. An employee shall be authorized to take a leave once approved by their direct manager within a period not exceeding seven working days from the date of submitting the application, otherwise the requested leave shall be considered approved.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. An employee shall only be authorized to take periodic leave after successfully passing the probationary period. The head of the government entity may make an exception to this condition if required by the employee's circumstances, provided that the probationary period is extended by the number of days of leave granted to such employee.
texts.text: An employee shall only be authorized to take periodic leave after successfully passing the probationary period. The head of the government entity may make an exception to this condition if required by the employee's circumstances, provided that the probationary period is extended by the number of days of leave granted to such employee.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The employee shall be entitled to a periodic annual leave with a total salary according to the following periods:
texts.text: The employee shall be entitled to a periodic annual leave with a total salary according to the following periods:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. 30 working days per year for officials holding Grade 5 positions and above.
texts.text: 30 working days per year for officials holding Grade 5 positions and above.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. 22 working days per year for officials holding Grade 6 positions and less.
texts.text: 22 working days per year for officials holding Grade 6 positions and less.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. In  case  the  employee  was  promoted,  their  annual  entitlement  from  their  periodic  leave  shall  be modified as of the effective date of the promotion.
texts.text: In  case  the  employee  was  promoted,  their  annual  entitlement  from  their  periodic  leave  shall  be modified as of the effective date of the promotion.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. The employee may request advance payment of the total salary for the periodic leave period, provided that its duration is not less than (15) working days, and that the total salary paid in advance is within the limits of end-of-service benefits.
texts.text: The employee may request advance payment of the total salary for the periodic leave period, provided that its duration is not less than (15) working days, and that the total salary paid in advance is within the limits of end-of-service benefits.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 72 )
texts.text: Article ( 72 )

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The employee shall not be entitled to an annual leave balance for the following periods:
texts.text: The employee shall not be entitled to an annual leave balance for the following periods:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1The duration of the study leave.
texts.text: 1The duration of the study leave.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2The duration of the employee's absence from work.
texts.text: 2The duration of the employee's absence from work.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3The duration of the employee's imprisonment in implementation of a judicial ruling issued against them, in cases where termination of service is not legally decided.
texts.text: 3The duration of the employee's imprisonment in implementation of a judicial ruling issued against them, in cases where termination of service is not legally decided.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4For the period spent by the employee on an authorized leave, whether with or without salary, if the duration of continuous leaves exceeds two months in one year.
texts.text: 4For the period spent by the employee on an authorized leave, whether with or without salary, if the duration of continuous leaves exceeds two months in one year.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5The employee's service period during the probationary period, if it was decided at the end of such period that the employee is not a good fit for the position.
texts.text: 5The employee's service period during the probationary period, if it was decided at the end of such period that the employee is not a good fit for the position.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6The period during which the employee continues to work at the government entity after the end of their service.
texts.text: 6The period during which the employee continues to work at the government entity after the end of their service.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 73 )
texts.text: Article ( 73 )

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. An employee may take their periodic leave once or divide it into several short leaves during the year according to the leave plan and the employee's special circumstances.
texts.text: An employee may take their periodic leave once or divide it into several short leaves during the year according to the leave plan and the employee's special circumstances.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. If the employee's period of service is less than twelve months during the year, they will be entitled to a periodic leave for part of the year in proportion to their service period in that year.
texts.text: If the employee's period of service is less than twelve months during the year, they will be entitled to a periodic leave for part of the year in proportion to their service period in that year.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. With the exception of the employee joining the National and Reserves Service, the employee shall exhaust their periodic leave in the same year of entitlement, or at least half of their leave balance. If work conditions do not allow that, they shall be authorized to take the rest of the leave in the following year.
texts.text: With the exception of the employee joining the National and Reserves Service, the employee shall exhaust their periodic leave in the same year of entitlement, or at least half of their leave balance. If work conditions do not allow that, they shall be authorized to take the rest of the leave in the following year.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. An employee may not be prevented from taking their periodic leave for two consecutive years, unless required by work conditions, subject to the approval of the head of the government entity.
texts.text: An employee may not be prevented from taking their periodic leave for two consecutive years, unless required by work conditions, subject to the approval of the head of the government entity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. The government entity may grant the employee their full leave balance at the beginning of the year after the end of their first year in service. If the employee does not complete one year of service for which the leave is granted, the leave will be deducted from their end-of-service benefits.
texts.text: The government entity may grant the employee their full leave balance at the beginning of the year after the end of their first year in service. If the employee does not complete one year of service for which the leave is granted, the leave will be deducted from their end-of-service benefits.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. Coordination shall take place between employees and their direct manager when setting annual leave programs  in  line  with  work  conditions,  ensuring  their  continuous  work  without  interruption  or
texts.text: Coordination shall take place between employees and their direct manager when setting annual leave programs  in  line  with  work  conditions,  ensuring  their  continuous  work  without  interruption  or

texts.label: text
texts.orig: disruption throughout the year, and ensuring that backups are available to cover the employee's work during their leave period.
texts.text: disruption throughout the year, and ensuring that backups are available to cover the employee's work during their leave period.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 74 )
texts.text: Article ( 74 )

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The  employee  may  be  summoned  to  work  during  their  periodic  leave,  requiring  the  employee  to interrupt their leave and return to work if required by the work needs. In this case, the employee shall be compensated with days equal to the number of days of unused periodic leave. Such days shall be added to the balance of their annual leave entitlement, and the employee shall be compensated for the costs incurred according to the supporting documents deemed acceptable by the government entity.
texts.text: The  employee  may  be  summoned  to  work  during  their  periodic  leave,  requiring  the  employee  to interrupt their leave and return to work if required by the work needs. In this case, the employee shall be compensated with days equal to the number of days of unused periodic leave. Such days shall be added to the balance of their annual leave entitlement, and the employee shall be compensated for the costs incurred according to the supporting documents deemed acceptable by the government entity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The employee may request to cut off their periodic leave and return to work. The number of unused periodic leave days shall be added to the balance of their annual entitlement.
texts.text: The employee may request to cut off their periodic leave and return to work. The number of unused periodic leave days shall be added to the balance of their annual entitlement.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 75 )
texts.text: Article ( 75 )

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The employee shall take their periodic leave during the year in which the leave is due. If this was not possible due to work conditions, their annual entitlement of periodic leave may be carried over by a decision of the head of the government entity.
texts.text: The employee shall take their periodic leave during the year in which the leave is due. If this was not possible due to work conditions, their annual entitlement of periodic leave may be carried over by a decision of the head of the government entity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. In all cases, and other than the employee's entitlement from the periodic leave for the current year, the cumulative periodic leave balance carried over at any time shall not exceed the entitlement of two years, according to their current job grade.
texts.text: In all cases, and other than the employee's entitlement from the periodic leave for the current year, the cumulative periodic leave balance carried over at any time shall not exceed the entitlement of two years, according to their current job grade.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 76 )
texts.text: Article ( 76 )

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The employee may request payment in cash for all or part of their accrued unused leave carried over from the previous Calendar years at any time.
texts.text: The employee may request payment in cash for all or part of their accrued unused leave carried over from the previous Calendar years at any time.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The payment in cash for the periodic leave shall be paid automatically, without a request from the concerned employee, for the number of days exceeding the entitlement of two years.
texts.text: The payment in cash for the periodic leave shall be paid automatically, without a request from the concerned employee, for the number of days exceeding the entitlement of two years.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. Upon termination of service for any reason whatsoever, the employee shall be entitled to receive a payment in cash for the balance of periodic leave due to such employee if they were unused prior to the
texts.text: Upon termination of service for any reason whatsoever, the employee shall be entitled to receive a payment in cash for the balance of periodic leave due to such employee if they were unused prior to the

texts.label: text
texts.orig: date  of  termination  of  service,  including  their  cumulative  balance  of  leaves  from  previous  years,  in accordance with the provisions of these Regulations.
texts.text: date  of  termination  of  service,  including  their  cumulative  balance  of  leaves  from  previous  years,  in accordance with the provisions of these Regulations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. The cash allowance for periodic leave shall be calculated as the equivalent of the employee's salary for one day on the date of disbursement, at the rate of (7) Calendar days for every (5) working days of the periodic leave balance.
texts.text: The cash allowance for periodic leave shall be calculated as the equivalent of the employee's salary for one day on the date of disbursement, at the rate of (7) Calendar days for every (5) working days of the periodic leave balance.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 77 )
texts.text: Article ( 77 )

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Workers in schools and institutes affiliated with the government and the like shall be entitled to periodic leave  during  the  school  holidays  in  accordance  with  the  controls  established  in  this  regard  by  the competent authorities.
texts.text: Workers in schools and institutes affiliated with the government and the like shall be entitled to periodic leave  during  the  school  holidays  in  accordance  with  the  controls  established  in  this  regard  by  the competent authorities.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 78 ) Sick Leave
texts.text: Article ( 78 ) Sick Leave

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The employee shall be entitled, with the approval of their direct manager, to a sick leave, provided that the period of such leave does not exceed two consecutive days and individually, and is not more than (10) days per year unless a medical certificate was submitted. If the employee submits an approved medical certificate for this leave, it shall be considered a sick leave without counting it within the tenday period, and Clause (2) of this Article shall apply in this case.
texts.text: The employee shall be entitled, with the approval of their direct manager, to a sick leave, provided that the period of such leave does not exceed two consecutive days and individually, and is not more than (10) days per year unless a medical certificate was submitted. If the employee submits an approved medical certificate for this leave, it shall be considered a sick leave without counting it within the tenday period, and Clause (2) of this Article shall apply in this case.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The authorization for sick leave shall be based on a certificate issued by a physician and approved by the competent health authority if the period is between (3) to (7) consecutive days at one time.
texts.text: The authorization for sick leave shall be based on a certificate issued by a physician and approved by the competent health authority if the period is between (3) to (7) consecutive days at one time.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 79 )
texts.text: Article ( 79 )

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The authorization of sick leave shall be based on a medical report approved by the medical committee if the period of sick leave exceeds seven consecutive days at one time or if the total number of sick leaves during the year exceeds twenty-one days.
texts.text: The authorization of sick leave shall be based on a medical report approved by the medical committee if the period of sick leave exceeds seven consecutive days at one time or if the total number of sick leaves during the year exceeds twenty-one days.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. In the event that the medical committee does not approve the sick leave, this leave will be deducted from the employee's periodic leave balance or from their total salary if they did not have any leave balance.
texts.text: In the event that the medical committee does not approve the sick leave, this leave will be deducted from the employee's periodic leave balance or from their total salary if they did not have any leave balance.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. If the employee's sick leave exceeds (6) months per year, the government entity shall refer them to the medical committee concerned with retirement to determine their fitness for work, provided that this is done every (6) months.
texts.text: If the employee's sick leave exceeds (6) months per year, the government entity shall refer them to the medical committee concerned with retirement to determine their fitness for work, provided that this is done every (6) months.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. In all cases in which the national employee is proven to be medically unfit as a result of illness, they shall be referred to the medical committee concerned with retirement in the Emirate to consider either their return to work or termination of their service for medical unfitness.
texts.text: In all cases in which the national employee is proven to be medically unfit as a result of illness, they shall be referred to the medical committee concerned with retirement in the Emirate to consider either their return to work or termination of their service for medical unfitness.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. The  employee  shall  report  their  illness  within  the  first  two  days  of  their  leave,  unless  there  is  a compelling excuse preventing them from doing so.
texts.text: The  employee  shall  report  their  illness  within  the  first  two  days  of  their  leave,  unless  there  is  a compelling excuse preventing them from doing so.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. The maximum sick leave is calculated at one time or during the year according to the working days. Weekends and official holidays are not compensated for by other days if they occur during the sick leave.
texts.text: The maximum sick leave is calculated at one time or during the year according to the working days. Weekends and official holidays are not compensated for by other days if they occur during the sick leave.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 80 )
texts.text: Article ( 80 )

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The employee's working hours are reduced for health reasons based on the recommendation of the medical committee, provided that the number of reduced hours does not exceed two hours of daily working hours. Such reduced hours shall be considered part of the official working hours, even if the official working hours are reduced in the month of Ramadan.
texts.text: The employee's working hours are reduced for health reasons based on the recommendation of the medical committee, provided that the number of reduced hours does not exceed two hours of daily working hours. Such reduced hours shall be considered part of the official working hours, even if the official working hours are reduced in the month of Ramadan.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The government entity shall coordinate with the medical committee in this case to review the employee's medical condition every three months and prepare a detailed medical report on their medical condition.
texts.text: The government entity shall coordinate with the medical committee in this case to review the employee's medical condition every three months and prepare a detailed medical report on their medical condition.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 81 )
texts.text: Article ( 81 )

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If an employee is infected with a contagious disease that does not prevent them from performing their job or if they were required to come into contact with a patient with a contagious disease and the medical committee decides to prevent them from performing their job, such employee shall be authorized not to work during the period decided by the medical committee. This period shall not be deducted from their sick leave  entitlement  and  they  should  receive  their  total  salary  during  it.  The  medical  committee  and  the employee shall notify the government entity for which the employee works that the employee is not allowed to perform their job.
texts.text: If an employee is infected with a contagious disease that does not prevent them from performing their job or if they were required to come into contact with a patient with a contagious disease and the medical committee decides to prevent them from performing their job, such employee shall be authorized not to work during the period decided by the medical committee. This period shall not be deducted from their sick leave  entitlement  and  they  should  receive  their  total  salary  during  it.  The  medical  committee  and  the employee shall notify the government entity for which the employee works that the employee is not allowed to perform their job.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 82 ) Work Injury Leave
texts.text: Article ( 82 ) Work Injury Leave

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. 1. In the application of the provisions of these Regulations, 'work injury' means any injury that occurs as a result of an accident that occurred during the performance of work or because of such accident, or an occupational disease determined by the competent medical committee. Any accident/incident that occurs while the employee is commuting to and from work using ordinary means shall be considered a work injury, in accordance with occupational health and safety procedures.
texts.text: 1. In the application of the provisions of these Regulations, 'work injury' means any injury that occurs as a result of an accident that occurred during the performance of work or because of such accident, or an occupational disease determined by the competent medical committee. Any accident/incident that occurs while the employee is commuting to and from work using ordinary means shall be considered a work injury, in accordance with occupational health and safety procedures.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. If the illness is a result of a work injury, the sick leave shall be for a continuous period not exceeding twelve months with an entitlement to receive a gross salary, based on the report  of the competent medical committee.
texts.text: If the illness is a result of a work injury, the sick leave shall be for a continuous period not exceeding twelve months with an entitlement to receive a gross salary, based on the report  of the competent medical committee.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. If  the  duration  of  the  illness  resulting  from  a  work  injury  exceeds  twelve  consecutive  months,  the employee shall be referred to the medical committee to decide on extending the sick leave related while receiving total salary for the period it deems appropriate, or to recommend that such employee is unfit for work, as the case may be. The government entity may also, if the abovementioned leave period was exceeded, to refer the national employee to the medical committee concerned with retirement in the Emirate to take the appropriate decision in this regard if the employee's injury prevents them from completing their period of service.
texts.text: If  the  duration  of  the  illness  resulting  from  a  work  injury  exceeds  twelve  consecutive  months,  the employee shall be referred to the medical committee to decide on extending the sick leave related while receiving total salary for the period it deems appropriate, or to recommend that such employee is unfit for work, as the case may be. The government entity may also, if the abovementioned leave period was exceeded, to refer the national employee to the medical committee concerned with retirement in the Emirate to take the appropriate decision in this regard if the employee's injury prevents them from completing their period of service.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 83 ) Study Leave
texts.text: Article ( 83 ) Study Leave

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The plans of government entities include their estimates of study leaves, according to future needs and goals,  human  resource  plans  and  job  replacement  in  the  government  entity,  provided  that  the equivalent jobs and grades of those expected to be granted study leaves are included in the job budget of those entities.
texts.text: The plans of government entities include their estimates of study leaves, according to future needs and goals,  human  resource  plans  and  job  replacement  in  the  government  entity,  provided  that  the equivalent jobs and grades of those expected to be granted study leaves are included in the job budget of those entities.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The  head  of  the  government  entity  may,  based  on  the  recommendation  of  the  Human  Resources Committee, authorize the national employee to take a study leave with total salary for the prescribed period of study within the limits of the approved annual budget, in coordination with the authorities concerned with authorizing study leaves.
texts.text: The  head  of  the  government  entity  may,  based  on  the  recommendation  of  the  Human  Resources Committee, authorize the national employee to take a study leave with total salary for the prescribed period of study within the limits of the approved annual budget, in coordination with the authorities concerned with authorizing study leaves.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. 3. The decided study period includes any periods prescribed for the necessary preliminary studies, including the period of study of the foreign language if studying will take place in a foreign country, provided that it does not exceed one year. The study leave may be extended if required by the study reports received from the employee.
texts.text: 3. The decided study period includes any periods prescribed for the necessary preliminary studies, including the period of study of the foreign language if studying will take place in a foreign country, provided that it does not exceed one year. The study leave may be extended if required by the study reports received from the employee.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. After graduation, the employee shall be required to work for the government for a period equivalent to the study period.
texts.text: After graduation, the employee shall be required to work for the government for a period equivalent to the study period.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 84 )
texts.text: Article ( 84 )

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The study leave shall be considered an actual period of service for the employee. As such, it shall be included in their end of service benefits or retirement pension entitlement, as the case  may be. The employee shall be subject to the laws and procedures in force with regard to periodic leaves and others in the educational institution throughout the period of the study leave.
texts.text: The study leave shall be considered an actual period of service for the employee. As such, it shall be included in their end of service benefits or retirement pension entitlement, as the case  may be. The employee shall be subject to the laws and procedures in force with regard to periodic leaves and others in the educational institution throughout the period of the study leave.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The employee shall start their work within (5) working days from the end of their study leave if their studies took place inside the country, and within a period of (15) working days at most if their studies
texts.text: The employee shall start their work within (5) working days from the end of their study leave if their studies took place inside the country, and within a period of (15) working days at most if their studies

texts.label: text
texts.orig: took place abroad, otherwise they shall be considered as discontinued from work and shall be subject to the provisions related to discontinuation of work provided for by law and in these Regulations.
texts.text: took place abroad, otherwise they shall be considered as discontinued from work and shall be subject to the provisions related to discontinuation of work provided for by law and in these Regulations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. An employee may be granted a leave with total salary for a period not exceeding one month before starting their studies abroad.
texts.text: An employee may be granted a leave with total salary for a period not exceeding one month before starting their studies abroad.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 85 )
texts.text: Article ( 85 )

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Conditions for granting study leave:
texts.text: Conditions for granting study leave:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The employee should have spent at least three years working for the government entity from the  date  of  appointment,  with  the  exception of those whose studies are among the rare or important specializations that meet the needs of the government entity.
texts.text: The employee should have spent at least three years working for the government entity from the  date  of  appointment,  with  the  exception of those whose studies are among the rare or important specializations that meet the needs of the government entity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The employee should have received a performance evaluation of at least 'very good' in the last annual performance report.
texts.text: The employee should have received a performance evaluation of at least 'very good' in the last annual performance report.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The  employee  should  have  obtained  academic  approval  from  a  recognized  educational institution.
texts.text: The  employee  should  have  obtained  academic  approval  from  a  recognized  educational institution.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. The nature of the study and specialization should be consistent with the employee's career path and the nature of work performed in the government entity.
texts.text: The nature of the study and specialization should be consistent with the employee's career path and the nature of work performed in the government entity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. An approved budget should be available to cover the employee's total salary costs during the study leave period.
texts.text: An approved budget should be available to cover the employee's total salary costs during the study leave period.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. Any other requirements specified by the authorities concerned with authorizing study leaves.
texts.text: Any other requirements specified by the authorities concerned with authorizing study leaves.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 86 )
texts.text: Article ( 86 )

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The study leave shall end in any of the following cases:
texts.text: The study leave shall end in any of the following cases:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The reasons specified by the authorities concerned with authorizing study leaves.
texts.text: The reasons specified by the authorities concerned with authorizing study leaves.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. If  required  by  the  need for work or  the  public interest.  In  all  cases,  coordination  shall  be  made between the employee's employer and the authorities concerned with authorizing study leaves.
texts.text: If  required  by  the  need for work or  the  public interest.  In  all  cases,  coordination  shall  be  made between the employee's employer and the authorities concerned with authorizing study leaves.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 87 )
texts.text: Article ( 87 )

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. A national employee may be granted a short study permit for two hours per day to attend lectures, seminars or scientific discussions in any accredited study program until the end of such program. This permission shall not be required if the official working hours do not conflict with the study hours.
texts.text: A national employee may be granted a short study permit for two hours per day to attend lectures, seminars or scientific discussions in any accredited study program until the end of such program. This permission shall not be required if the official working hours do not conflict with the study hours.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2.
