The head of the government entity may grant the citizen employee who attends regular evening studies  within  the  country  in  a  recognized  university  or  college,  a  leave  with  a  gross  salary  to perform  the  semester  and  annual  exams  and  debate  postgraduate  theses,  provided  that  the duration of leave is determined according to the actual days of the exams. This shall not apply to the monthly exams or any admission exams, registration or discussion of study projects during the semester.
texts.text: The head of the government entity may grant the citizen employee who attends regular evening studies  within  the  country  in  a  recognized  university  or  college,  a  leave  with  a  gross  salary  to perform  the  semester  and  annual  exams  and  debate  postgraduate  theses,  provided  that  the duration of leave is determined according to the actual days of the exams. This shall not apply to the monthly exams or any admission exams, registration or discussion of study projects during the semester.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The national employee may be granted additional leave prior to the commencement of the exams referred to in the previous clause by a period not exceeding one day if the exams are performed within the country and not exceeding three days if the exams are performed abroad, provided that the total leave does not exceed (15) days per year, without including the actual exam days.
texts.text: The national employee may be granted additional leave prior to the commencement of the exams referred to in the previous clause by a period not exceeding one day if the exams are performed within the country and not exceeding three days if the exams are performed abroad, provided that the total leave does not exceed (15) days per year, without including the actual exam days.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. Subject to the provisions of the above clauses, granting the employee absence hours by permission (permission  hours)  to  participate  in  lectures,  seminars,  exams  or  scientific  discussions  shall  be according to the needs of the government entity and shall be relevant to its work and specialization.
texts.text: Subject to the provisions of the above clauses, granting the employee absence hours by permission (permission  hours)  to  participate  in  lectures,  seminars,  exams  or  scientific  discussions  shall  be according to the needs of the government entity and shall be relevant to its work and specialization.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 88 ) Sabbatical Leave
texts.text: Article ( 88 ) Sabbatical Leave

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The head of the government entity may authorize the national employee to take a sabbatical leave with entitlement to a total salary  - at the request of the requesting entity -in  order to  conduct research, studies, voluntary work, or tasks and works in any of the fields of culture, arts, exhibitions, literature, science, and sports, even if they are not related to the work of the government entity. This authorization does  not  require  the  employee  to  obtain  an  educational  or  training  qualification,  provided  that  the Authority is notified thereof.
texts.text: The head of the government entity may authorize the national employee to take a sabbatical leave with entitlement to a total salary  - at the request of the requesting entity -in  order to  conduct research, studies, voluntary work, or tasks and works in any of the fields of culture, arts, exhibitions, literature, science, and sports, even if they are not related to the work of the government entity. This authorization does  not  require  the  employee  to  obtain  an  educational  or  training  qualification,  provided  that  the Authority is notified thereof.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. It is required that the works to be accomplished aim at achieving public interest, community service, or national excellence, and that the employee possesses the skills, competencies, and experience required to accomplish them.
texts.text: It is required that the works to be accomplished aim at achieving public interest, community service, or national excellence, and that the employee possesses the skills, competencies, and experience required to accomplish them.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The authorization for this leave shall be for a period not exceeding one month per year. This leave may be extended by one month each time.
texts.text: The authorization for this leave shall be for a period not exceeding one month per year. This leave may be extended by one month each time.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. The leave period shall be included within the employee's service period. The employee may obtain any rewards or incentives offered to them by the other entity.
texts.text: The leave period shall be included within the employee's service period. The employee may obtain any rewards or incentives offered to them by the other entity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. The requesting entity shall, at the end of the leave, submit a report to the employee's employer showing the employee's accomplishments during that period and the level of efficiency of their performance of the tasks assigned thereto.
texts.text: The requesting entity shall, at the end of the leave, submit a report to the employee's employer showing the employee's accomplishments during that period and the level of efficiency of their performance of the tasks assigned thereto.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. An employee shall not be authorized to take a sabbatical leave, except after successfully passing the probationary period, unless the sabbatical is for the purpose of representing the country.
texts.text: An employee shall not be authorized to take a sabbatical leave, except after successfully passing the probationary period, unless the sabbatical is for the purpose of representing the country.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7. The employee shall obtain their periodic and sick leave from the requesting entity - during the sabbatical leave period - according to the applicable laws of such entity.
texts.text: The employee shall obtain their periodic and sick leave from the requesting entity - during the sabbatical leave period - according to the applicable laws of such entity.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 89 ) Maternity Leave
texts.text: Article ( 89 ) Maternity Leave

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The female employee shall be granted maternity leave with total salary for a period of three months based on a certificate issued by a doctor and approved by the competent health authority.
texts.text: The female employee shall be granted maternity leave with total salary for a period of three months based on a certificate issued by a doctor and approved by the competent health authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The employee's service during maternity leave shall be considered continuous. Therefore, it shall be included in her entitlement to the end-of-service benefits or retirement pension, as the case may be.
texts.text: The employee's service during maternity leave shall be considered continuous. Therefore, it shall be included in her entitlement to the end-of-service benefits or retirement pension, as the case may be.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The period of maternity leave shall be calculated on the basis of Calendar days. The weekly and official holidays occurring during such leave shall be considered a part of the leave.
texts.text: The period of maternity leave shall be calculated on the basis of Calendar days. The weekly and official holidays occurring during such leave shall be considered a part of the leave.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. The maternity leave shall not be considered part of the sick leave, as it is considered separately.
texts.text: The maternity leave shall not be considered part of the sick leave, as it is considered separately.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. Subject to the provisions of these Regulations, any non-exhausted maternity leave period shall not be considered an acquired right for the female employee. As such, such employee shall not ask to carry it out to the next year, postpone it or ask for a cash allowance in lieu thereof.
texts.text: Subject to the provisions of these Regulations, any non-exhausted maternity leave period shall not be considered an acquired right for the female employee. As such, such employee shall not ask to carry it out to the next year, postpone it or ask for a cash allowance in lieu thereof.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 90 )
texts.text: Article ( 90 )

texts.label: text
texts.orig: A breastfeeding employee shall be entitled to two hours of daily leave (if she desired), after the end of the maternity leave and for a period of one year from the date of delivery to take care of her new-born. These departure hours are considered part of the official working hours, even if the official working hours are reduced in the month of Ramadan.
texts.text: A breastfeeding employee shall be entitled to two hours of daily leave (if she desired), after the end of the maternity leave and for a period of one year from the date of delivery to take care of her new-born. These departure hours are considered part of the official working hours, even if the official working hours are reduced in the month of Ramadan.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 91 ) Paternity Leave
texts.text: Article ( 91 ) Paternity Leave

texts.label: text
texts.orig: An employee who gives has a new-born shall be granted paternity leave with a total salary for a period of three consecutive or intermittent working days during the first six months of the birth of his child.
texts.text: An employee who gives has a new-born shall be granted paternity leave with a total salary for a period of three consecutive or intermittent working days during the first six months of the birth of his child.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 92 ) Bereavement/Mourning Leave
texts.text: Article ( 92 ) Bereavement/Mourning Leave

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The  employee  shall  report  the  death  according  to  their  circumstances,  provided  that  they  submit acceptable proof after returning from leave.
texts.text: The  employee  shall  report  the  death  according  to  their  circumstances,  provided  that  they  submit acceptable proof after returning from leave.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. This leave shall not apply to the Muslim female employee whose husband has passed away, as she shall be subject to the provisions of the Iddah period leave.
texts.text: This leave shall not apply to the Muslim female employee whose husband has passed away, as she shall be subject to the provisions of the Iddah period leave.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The employee shall be granted a mourning leave as follows:
texts.text: The employee shall be granted a mourning leave as follows:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. For a period of (5) working days in the event of the death of his spouse, an ascendant, descendant, relative or in-law of the first degree.
texts.text: For a period of (5) working days in the event of the death of his spouse, an ascendant, descendant, relative or in-law of the first degree.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. For a period of (3) working days for second degree relatives.
texts.text: For a period of (3) working days for second degree relatives.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. For a period of one working day for third degree relatives.
texts.text: For a period of one working day for third degree relatives.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 93 )
texts.text: Article ( 93 )

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The mourning leave shall be calculated according to the following:
texts.text: The mourning leave shall be calculated according to the following:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Starting from the date of burial of the deceased inside the country.
texts.text: Starting from the date of burial of the deceased inside the country.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Within a month from the date of death, if the deceased was buried abroad.
texts.text: Within a month from the date of death, if the deceased was buried abroad.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 94 ) Iddah Leave
texts.text: Article ( 94 ) Iddah Leave

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. A Muslim female employee whose husband dies shall be granted a paid Iddah leave of four months and ten days from the date of the husband's death.
texts.text: A Muslim female employee whose husband dies shall be granted a paid Iddah leave of four months and ten days from the date of the husband's death.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The female employee shall report the death according to her circumstances, provided that she submits acceptable evidence.
texts.text: The female employee shall report the death according to her circumstances, provided that she submits acceptable evidence.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 95 ) Hajj Leave
texts.text: Article ( 95 ) Hajj Leave

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. A Muslim employee shall be granted a Hajj leave with a total salary to perform the Hajj pilgrimage once during their service in the government.
texts.text: A Muslim employee shall be granted a Hajj leave with a total salary to perform the Hajj pilgrimage once during their service in the government.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The Hajj leave shall be authorized for a period of (15) working days.
texts.text: The Hajj leave shall be authorized for a period of (15) working days.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. This leave shall be counted within the employee's service period and granting it does not affect their annual periodic leave entitlement.
texts.text: This leave shall be counted within the employee's service period and granting it does not affect their annual periodic leave entitlement.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. If the employee decided not to take a Hajj leave, such leave shall not be considered an acquired right for them, and shall not be included in calculating the accrual periodic leave balance at the end of their service.
texts.text: If the employee decided not to take a Hajj leave, such leave shall not be considered an acquired right for them, and shall not be included in calculating the accrual periodic leave balance at the end of their service.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. Upon their return, the employee shall submit documents proving his performance of the Hajj during the leave period.
texts.text: Upon their return, the employee shall submit documents proving his performance of the Hajj during the leave period.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. The total salary of the employee for this leave may be paid in advance at their request, provided that the request is made (15) days before the start date of their leave.
texts.text: The total salary of the employee for this leave may be paid in advance at their request, provided that the request is made (15) days before the start date of their leave.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 96 ) Patient Accompaniment Leave
texts.text: Article ( 96 ) Patient Accompaniment Leave

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The head of the government entity, based on the recommendation of the Human Resources Committee, shall grant the employee leave to accompany any of the following persons to receive treatment inside the country or abroad: their spouse, a first-degree or second-degree relative, a dependent, or other persons as decided in a ruling issued by a competent court regardless of the degree of kinship.
texts.text: The head of the government entity, based on the recommendation of the Human Resources Committee, shall grant the employee leave to accompany any of the following persons to receive treatment inside the country or abroad: their spouse, a first-degree or second-degree relative, a dependent, or other persons as decided in a ruling issued by a competent court regardless of the degree of kinship.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 97 )
texts.text: Article ( 97 )

texts.label: text
texts.orig: During the patient accompaniment leave, the following shall apply:
texts.text: During the patient accompaniment leave, the following shall apply:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Payment of total salary for a period not exceeding two months in one calendar year.
texts.text: Payment of total salary for a period not exceeding two months in one calendar year.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Possibility of extending the paid leave for a month.
texts.text: Possibility of extending the paid leave for a month.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. Possibility of extending the patient accompaniment leave for longer periods without pay, by two months each time, if required by the circumstances, provided that documents supporting entitlement are submitted.
texts.text: Possibility of extending the patient accompaniment leave for longer periods without pay, by two months each time, if required by the circumstances, provided that documents supporting entitlement are submitted.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 98 )
texts.text: Article ( 98 )

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. As a condition to granting a patient accompaniment leave within the country, the patient should be staying in the hospital - with the exception of a patient with a disability - and a document should be submitted proving that the employee is accompanying the patient during the treatment period, with a maximum number of (2) companions per case, in accordance with the controls set by the Department of Health.
texts.text: As a condition to granting a patient accompaniment leave within the country, the patient should be staying in the hospital - with the exception of a patient with a disability - and a document should be submitted proving that the employee is accompanying the patient during the treatment period, with a maximum number of (2) companions per case, in accordance with the controls set by the Department of Health.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. In order to grant a patient accompaniment leave outside the country, a letter shall be provided by the entity responsible for the treatment or the health attaché of the country's embassy in the country of treatment, proving that the employee accompanied the patient during the treatment period.
texts.text: In order to grant a patient accompaniment leave outside the country, a letter shall be provided by the entity responsible for the treatment or the health attaché of the country's embassy in the country of treatment, proving that the employee accompanied the patient during the treatment period.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 99 )
texts.text: Article ( 99 )

texts.label: text
texts.orig: An accompaniment leave may be granted to the wife or husband to take care of the children, one of whom is less than ten years old, in one of the following two cases:
texts.text: An accompaniment leave may be granted to the wife or husband to take care of the children, one of whom is less than ten years old, in one of the following two cases:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. When a parent is absent to attend a course, an official mission, or treatment abroad.
texts.text: When a parent is absent to attend a course, an official mission, or treatment abroad.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. When a parent is absent to attend a course or an official mission or for treatment within the country, provided that the location of the training course or official mission is more than one
texts.text: When a parent is absent to attend a course or an official mission or for treatment within the country, provided that the location of the training course or official mission is more than one

texts.label: text
texts.orig: hundred kilometres away from the employee's permanent workplace. This does not apply to the parent attending a national or reserve service course.
texts.text: hundred kilometres away from the employee's permanent workplace. This does not apply to the parent attending a national or reserve service course.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 100 ) Unpaid Leave
texts.text: Article ( 100 ) Unpaid Leave

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. By  a  decision  of  the  head  of  the  government  entity  based  on  the  recommendation  of  the  Human Resources Committee, the husband or wife may be granted unpaid leave if either of them is authorized to travel abroad by their employer, provided that this leave does not exceed the period of stay of the authorized spouse abroad.
texts.text: By  a  decision  of  the  head  of  the  government  entity  based  on  the  recommendation  of  the  Human Resources Committee, the husband or wife may be granted unpaid leave if either of them is authorized to travel abroad by their employer, provided that this leave does not exceed the period of stay of the authorized spouse abroad.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The head of the government entity, based on the recommendation of the Human Resources Committee, may grant the employee an unpaid leave in addition to the periodic leaves to which they are entitled for a period of one month per year, if the employee had serious reasons that require granting them this leave.
texts.text: The head of the government entity, based on the recommendation of the Human Resources Committee, may grant the employee an unpaid leave in addition to the periodic leaves to which they are entitled for a period of one month per year, if the employee had serious reasons that require granting them this leave.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The employee's period of service shall be considered continuous during the periods of unpaid leave, and shall be included in the end-of-service benefits or retirement pension, provided that the employee pays retirement fund contributions in accordance with the legislation in force in this regard.
texts.text: The employee's period of service shall be considered continuous during the periods of unpaid leave, and shall be included in the end-of-service benefits or retirement pension, provided that the employee pays retirement fund contributions in accordance with the legislation in force in this regard.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. The weekly and official holidays occurring during the period of the unpaid leave shall be considered part of the leave.
texts.text: The weekly and official holidays occurring during the period of the unpaid leave shall be considered part of the leave.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article (101) Absence from Work
texts.text: Article (101) Absence from Work

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. An employee who is absent from work or does not return to work immediately after the end of their leave for a period not exceeding (15) days shall not receive their total salary for the days of absence. If the employee presents an acceptable excuse, the period of absence shall be deducted from the balance of their periodic leave or it shall be calculated as an unpaid leave. If the employee does not provide an acceptable excuse and justification for their absence, the government entity shall apply the disciplinary measures provided for in the law and these Regulations.
texts.text: An employee who is absent from work or does not return to work immediately after the end of their leave for a period not exceeding (15) days shall not receive their total salary for the days of absence. If the employee presents an acceptable excuse, the period of absence shall be deducted from the balance of their periodic leave or it shall be calculated as an unpaid leave. If the employee does not provide an acceptable excuse and justification for their absence, the government entity shall apply the disciplinary measures provided for in the law and these Regulations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Unless they present acceptable reasons justifying their absence, the employee shall be considered to have submitted their resignation if they stay absent from work or do not return to it immediately after the end of their leave for a period exceeding (15) consecutive days. The date of resignation shall be calculated from the day following their absence from work or following the end of their leave, as the case may be.
texts.text: Unless they present acceptable reasons justifying their absence, the employee shall be considered to have submitted their resignation if they stay absent from work or do not return to it immediately after the end of their leave for a period exceeding (15) consecutive days. The date of resignation shall be calculated from the day following their absence from work or following the end of their leave, as the case may be.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The  periods  of  absence  from  work  shall  not  be  included  in  the  employee's  service  period  when calculating the end-of-service benefits or retirement pension. In this case, the employee shall not be entitled to any leave or other entitlements prescribed by law.
texts.text: The  periods  of  absence  from  work  shall  not  be  included  in  the  employee's  service  period  when calculating the end-of-service benefits or retirement pension. In this case, the employee shall not be entitled to any leave or other entitlements prescribed by law.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 102 )
texts.text: Article ( 102 )

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The head of the government entity may not consider the employee de facto resigned if they prove that acceptable reasons justify their absence from work, in accordance with the following controls:
texts.text: The head of the government entity may not consider the employee de facto resigned if they prove that acceptable reasons justify their absence from work, in accordance with the following controls:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The employee submits reasons and justifications for their absence from work, supported by documents.
texts.text: The employee submits reasons and justifications for their absence from work, supported by documents.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The employee submits a request to the government entity within one month from the date of their knowledge of the decision to terminate their service.
texts.text: The employee submits a request to the government entity within one month from the date of their knowledge of the decision to terminate their service.

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Chapter Twelve
texts.text: Chapter Twelve

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Administrative Measures
texts.text: Administrative Measures

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 103 ) General Policy
texts.text: Article ( 103 ) General Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The government entity shall adopt an Administrative Measures Procedures Manual in line with its nature and activity to ensure proper implementation of the provisions of these Regulations, and shall notify the Authority thereof.
texts.text: The government entity shall adopt an Administrative Measures Procedures Manual in line with its nature and activity to ensure proper implementation of the provisions of these Regulations, and shall notify the Authority thereof.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The  direct  supervisor  may  take  any  administrative  measures  against  the  employee  who  commits  any unacceptable behaviour.
texts.text: The  direct  supervisor  may  take  any  administrative  measures  against  the  employee  who  commits  any unacceptable behaviour.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The direct supervisor shall notify the employee of the administrative measure taken against them. If the employee refuses to acknowledge based on the form dedicated for this purpose and refuses to implement the administrative measure, this shall be considered a violation for which disciplinary action must be taken.
texts.text: The direct supervisor shall notify the employee of the administrative measure taken against them. If the employee refuses to acknowledge based on the form dedicated for this purpose and refuses to implement the administrative measure, this shall be considered a violation for which disciplinary action must be taken.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. Abuse of the authority entrusted to take administrative measures shall be considered inconsistent with the required  behaviour  and  applicable  regulations,  and  shall  be  considered  an  administrative  violation requiring the imposition of an administrative penalty in accordance with the law and these Regulations.
texts.text: Abuse of the authority entrusted to take administrative measures shall be considered inconsistent with the required  behaviour  and  applicable  regulations,  and  shall  be  considered  an  administrative  violation requiring the imposition of an administrative penalty in accordance with the law and these Regulations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. The administrative measure shall not have any impact when considering granting any of the employee's rights provided for by the law and these Regulations.
texts.text: The administrative measure shall not have any impact when considering granting any of the employee's rights provided for by the law and these Regulations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. Taking any administrative measure against the undisciplined employee shall not in any way prejudice the right to follow the appropriate disciplinary procedures and does not replace such procedures.
texts.text: Taking any administrative measure against the undisciplined employee shall not in any way prejudice the right to follow the appropriate disciplinary procedures and does not replace such procedures.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article (104) Types of Administrative Measures
texts.text: Article (104) Types of Administrative Measures

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Warning and reprimanding: by warning the employee verbally and instructing them not to repeat such behaviour.
texts.text: Warning and reprimanding: by warning the employee verbally and instructing them not to repeat such behaviour.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Withdrawal from a work/project: by withdrawing an employee from a work/project management, or preventing them from being involved in such project.
texts.text: Withdrawal from a work/project: by withdrawing an employee from a work/project management, or preventing them from being involved in such project.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. Non-representation of the government entity: which is by preventing the employee from representing or  continuing  to  represent  the  government  entity  in  meetings,  forums,  delegations  or  official assignments for a period not exceeding three months.
texts.text: Non-representation of the government entity: which is by preventing the employee from representing or  continuing  to  represent  the  government  entity  in  meetings,  forums,  delegations  or  official assignments for a period not exceeding three months.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 105 )
texts.text: Article ( 105 )

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The direct supervisor may take administrative measures against the violating employee within the next day, at most, after becoming aware of the unacceptable behaviour.
texts.text: The direct supervisor may take administrative measures against the violating employee within the next day, at most, after becoming aware of the unacceptable behaviour.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. With the exception of warning and reprimanding, the administrative measure taken against the employee shall be recorded. The employee shall be notified of such measures in writing within a period not exceeding (5) working days from the date on which the measures were taken. The employee shall undertake to follow and abide by such measures.
texts.text: With the exception of warning and reprimanding, the administrative measure taken against the employee shall be recorded. The employee shall be notified of such measures in writing within a period not exceeding (5) working days from the date on which the measures were taken. The employee shall undertake to follow and abide by such measures.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The direct supervisor shall take administrative measures against the employee who violates their job obligations and duties, or the rules and ethics of work and job behaviour.
texts.text: The direct supervisor shall take administrative measures against the employee who violates their job obligations and duties, or the rules and ethics of work and job behaviour.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Chapter Thirteen
texts.text: Chapter Thirteen

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Job Violations and Disciplinary Penalties
texts.text: Job Violations and Disciplinary Penalties

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 106 ) General Policy
texts.text: Article ( 106 ) General Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Every employee who violates the obligations provided for by law or relevant legislation, goes beyond the limits of their job requirements, or does not adhere to the rules and ethics of work and job behaviour, shall be disciplined in accordance with the provisions of these Regulations and the relevant rules, without prejudice to civil or penal liability when appropriate.
texts.text: Every employee who violates the obligations provided for by law or relevant legislation, goes beyond the limits of their job requirements, or does not adhere to the rules and ethics of work and job behaviour, shall be disciplined in accordance with the provisions of these Regulations and the relevant rules, without prejudice to civil or penal liability when appropriate.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The  penalty  shall  be  imposed  on  the  violating  employee  according  to  the  Table  of  Offenses  and Disciplinary Penalties attached to these Regulations.
texts.text: The  penalty  shall  be  imposed  on  the  violating  employee  according  to  the  Table  of  Offenses  and Disciplinary Penalties attached to these Regulations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. No penalty shall be imposed on the employee unless a written investigation is conducted with them first, in which their statements are heard in a way that allows them to defend themselves. The decision to impose the penalty shall be justified.
texts.text: No penalty shall be imposed on the employee unless a written investigation is conducted with them first, in which their statements are heard in a way that allows them to defend themselves. The decision to impose the penalty shall be justified.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. If the employee commits any of the acts mentioned in the Table of Offenses and Disciplinary Penalties, they shall be subject to the appropriate disciplinary penalty for the violation, without prejudice to civil or penal liability in accordance with the provisions of the relevant legislation in force.
texts.text: If the employee commits any of the acts mentioned in the Table of Offenses and Disciplinary Penalties, they shall be subject to the appropriate disciplinary penalty for the violation, without prejudice to civil or penal liability in accordance with the provisions of the relevant legislation in force.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. The authority  with  the  competency to  impose  the  penalty  may  exercise  its  discretion  in  determining which penalties, as prescribed in these Regulations, should be imposed on the violating employee if they commit any violation that is not specified in the Table of Offenses and Disciplinary Penalties.
texts.text: The authority  with  the  competency to  impose  the  penalty  may  exercise  its  discretion  in  determining which penalties, as prescribed in these Regulations, should be imposed on the violating employee if they commit any violation that is not specified in the Table of Offenses and Disciplinary Penalties.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. The  employee  shall  not  be  exempted  from  the  disciplinary  penalty,  unless  it  is  proved  that  their commission of the job-related violation was in implementation of a written order issued by their manager despite alerting their manager of the violation in writing, in which case the person who issued the order shall be held responsible.
texts.text: The  employee  shall  not  be  exempted  from  the  disciplinary  penalty,  unless  it  is  proved  that  their commission of the job-related violation was in implementation of a written order issued by their manager despite alerting their manager of the violation in writing, in which case the person who issued the order shall be held responsible.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7. The government entity or the Disciplinary Board, as the case may be, shall inform the competent criminal authorities  if  they  become  aware  that  the  violation  committed  by  the  employee  involves  a  criminal offense.
texts.text: The government entity or the Disciplinary Board, as the case may be, shall inform the competent criminal authorities  if  they  become  aware  that  the  violation  committed  by  the  employee  involves  a  criminal offense.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 107 )
texts.text: Article ( 107 )

texts.label: text
texts.orig: When  applying  the  provisions  of  job  violations  and  penalties,  the  government  entity  shall  adhere  to  the following principles:
texts.text: When  applying  the  provisions  of  job  violations  and  penalties,  the  government  entity  shall  adhere  to  the following principles:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The application of the provisions is fair, ensuring that all facts are carefully examined, taking into account the circumstances of each individual case as well as the mitigating circumstances.
texts.text: The application of the provisions is fair, ensuring that all facts are carefully examined, taking into account the circumstances of each individual case as well as the mitigating circumstances.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Violations should be recognized in a timely manner, with an attempt to correct them by giving the employee an opportunity to correct their behaviour before resorting to the imposition of disciplinary penalties.
texts.text: Violations should be recognized in a timely manner, with an attempt to correct them by giving the employee an opportunity to correct their behaviour before resorting to the imposition of disciplinary penalties.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 108 )
texts.text: Article ( 108 )

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. When imposing disciplinary penalties, the following considerations shall be taken into account:
texts.text: When imposing disciplinary penalties, the following considerations shall be taken into account:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. The nature of the employee's work, duties and responsibilities.
texts.text: The nature of the employee's work, duties and responsibilities.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. The  impact  of  the  employee's  violating  behaviour  on  the  work  or  other  employees  of  the government entity.
texts.text: The  impact  of  the  employee's  violating  behaviour  on  the  work  or  other  employees  of  the government entity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. The circumstances in which the violating behaviour occurred.
texts.text: The circumstances in which the violating behaviour occurred.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d. Percentage of employees repeating all kinds of violations.
texts.text: Percentage of employees repeating all kinds of violations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. All information and data contained in the investigations, whether about the employee's behaviour or performance, shall be confidential and may only be viewed by the concerned employee and the authorities concerned with administrative and criminal investigations.
texts.text: All information and data contained in the investigations, whether about the employee's behaviour or performance, shall be confidential and may only be viewed by the concerned employee and the authorities concerned with administrative and criminal investigations.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 109 )
texts.text: Article ( 109 )

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The violations including but not limited to those mentioned in the Table of Offenses and Disciplinary Penalties, and as a general principle, the employee's performance or refusal to perform an obligation or imposed work without justified reason, shall be considered a disciplinary violation even if no reference is made thereto in this Table, at the discretion of the investigating authority.
texts.text: The violations including but not limited to those mentioned in the Table of Offenses and Disciplinary Penalties, and as a general principle, the employee's performance or refusal to perform an obligation or imposed work without justified reason, shall be considered a disciplinary violation even if no reference is made thereto in this Table, at the discretion of the investigating authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Violations for arriving late to work or leaving work early shall be calculated on the basis of one month, without prejudice to the validity periods of the penalty, as applicable.
texts.text: Violations for arriving late to work or leaving work early shall be calculated on the basis of one month, without prejudice to the validity periods of the penalty, as applicable.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. If  the  employee  commits  a  violation  that  is  not  included  in  the  Table  of  Offenses  and  Disciplinary Penalties, a penalty shall be imposed on them based on the most similar violation of the same nature.
texts.text: If  the  employee  commits  a  violation  that  is  not  included  in  the  Table  of  Offenses  and  Disciplinary Penalties, a penalty shall be imposed on them based on the most similar violation of the same nature.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. A basic salary deduction imposed on the employee as a penalty shall be calculated based on the basic salary. Such deduction shall be made from the total salary.
texts.text: A basic salary deduction imposed on the employee as a penalty shall be calculated based on the basic salary. Such deduction shall be made from the total salary.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. If  the  violation  is  repeated  after  the  expiration  of  the  prescribed  validity  period  from  the  date  of committing the previous violation, it shall be treated as the first violation.
texts.text: If  the  violation  is  repeated  after  the  expiration  of  the  prescribed  validity  period  from  the  date  of committing the previous violation, it shall be treated as the first violation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. If  the  same  violation  is  repeated  during  the  validity  period  of  the  previously  imposed  penalty,  the following penalty shall be imposed, regardless of the maximum limit set for the violation. If the same violation is repeated after the expiration of the prescribed validity period from the date of committing the previous violation, it shall be considered as if it was committed for the first time.
texts.text: If  the  same  violation  is  repeated  during  the  validity  period  of  the  previously  imposed  penalty,  the following penalty shall be imposed, regardless of the maximum limit set for the violation. If the same violation is repeated after the expiration of the prescribed validity period from the date of committing the previous violation, it shall be considered as if it was committed for the first time.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7. If the employee has exhausted all stages of penalties mentioned in the Table of Offenses and Disciplinary Penalties and commits the same violation during the period of validity of the previous penalty, they shall be referred to the Disciplinary Board.
texts.text: If the employee has exhausted all stages of penalties mentioned in the Table of Offenses and Disciplinary Penalties and commits the same violation during the period of validity of the previous penalty, they shall be referred to the Disciplinary Board.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 8. When imposing the penalty of dismissal from a job, it is taken into account that it is in line with the level and  severity  of  the  violation,  taking  into  account  the  precedents  and  the  mitigating  or  aggravating circumstances that accompanied the violation.
texts.text: When imposing the penalty of dismissal from a job, it is taken into account that it is in line with the level and  severity  of  the  violation,  taking  into  account  the  precedents  and  the  mitigating  or  aggravating circumstances that accompanied the violation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 9. In cases of intermittent absence without excuse, the disciplinary penalty may be sequentially imposed for each case of absence from work within one year from the date of committing the violations, provided that this is clarified in the decision issued to impose the disciplinary penalty on the employee.
texts.text: In cases of intermittent absence without excuse, the disciplinary penalty may be sequentially imposed for each case of absence from work within one year from the date of committing the violations, provided that this is clarified in the decision issued to impose the disciplinary penalty on the employee.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 110 ) Penalties that may be imposed on employees
texts.text: Article ( 110 ) Penalties that may be imposed on employees

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Notice.
texts.text: Notice.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Written warning.
texts.text: Written warning.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. Deduction from the basic salary for a period not exceeding (15) days at a time and not exceeding sixty days during one year.
texts.text: Deduction from the basic salary for a period not exceeding (15) days at a time and not exceeding sixty days during one year.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. Deprivation of the annual bonus.
texts.text: Deprivation of the annual bonus.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. Suspension from work without a gross salary, except for housing allowance, for a period not exceeding one month.
texts.text: Suspension from work without a gross salary, except for housing allowance, for a period not exceeding one month.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. Suspension from work without a gross salary, except for housing allowance, for a period not less than one month and not more than three months.
texts.text: Suspension from work without a gross salary, except for housing allowance, for a period not less than one month and not more than three months.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7. Dismissal from job while preserving the right to a pension or bonus.
texts.text: Dismissal from job while preserving the right to a pension or bonus.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 111 ) The Authority imposing the penalty
texts.text: Article ( 111 ) The Authority imposing the penalty

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The Head of the Government Authority exercises the following powers:
texts.text: The Head of the Government Authority exercises the following powers:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. Imposing one of the penalties stipulated in Clauses (1, 2, 3) of Article (110) of these regulations, and he may authorize the employee's Immediate Supervisor or higher officials to impose one of the penalties stipulated in the Schedule of Violations and Disciplinary Penalties appended to these regulations, so that the deduction from the basic salary does not exceed three days.
texts.text: Imposing one of the penalties stipulated in Clauses (1, 2, 3) of Article (110) of these regulations, and he may authorize the employee's Immediate Supervisor or higher officials to impose one of the penalties stipulated in the Schedule of Violations and Disciplinary Penalties appended to these regulations, so that the deduction from the basic salary does not exceed three days.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Issuing a decision to refer the employee to the Disciplinary Board.
texts.text: Issuing a decision to refer the employee to the Disciplinary Board.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The Disciplinary  Board  exercises  the  authority  to  impose  penalties  mentioned  in  Clauses  (4,  5,  6,  7) stipulated in Article (110) of these regulations on employees.
texts.text: The Disciplinary  Board  exercises  the  authority  to  impose  penalties  mentioned  in  Clauses  (4,  5,  6,  7) stipulated in Article (110) of these regulations on employees.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The authority to impose the penalty on the seconded or delegated employee:
texts.text: The authority to impose the penalty on the seconded or delegated employee:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. If  the  seconded  or  delegated  employee  commits  a  violation  during  the  secondment  or  delegation period, the Authority to which they are seconded or delegated shall be responsible for imposing the penalty.
texts.text: If  the  seconded  or  delegated  employee  commits  a  violation  during  the  secondment  or  delegation period, the Authority to which they are seconded or delegated shall be responsible for imposing the penalty.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. The entity to which the employee is seconded or delegated must inform their original Authority of the disciplinary violations and penalties imposed on the employee.
texts.text: The entity to which the employee is seconded or delegated must inform their original Authority of the disciplinary violations and penalties imposed on the employee.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 112 ) Investigation of violations
texts.text: Article ( 112 ) Investigation of violations

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The  Human  Resources  Department  is  responsible  for  ascertaining  the  facts,  actions  or  complaints  it receives  against  the  employee  that  may  constitute  or  result  in  a  job  violation,  and  that  require  the imposition of a disciplinary penalty. It shall submit its recommendations to the Head of the Government Authority.
texts.text: The  Human  Resources  Department  is  responsible  for  ascertaining  the  facts,  actions  or  complaints  it receives  against  the  employee  that  may  constitute  or  result  in  a  job  violation,  and  that  require  the imposition of a disciplinary penalty. It shall submit its recommendations to the Head of the Government Authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The Head of the Government Authority may authorize the employ ee's Immediate Supervisor or higher officials, or form a committee of at least two employees to investigate into the violation attributed to the employee.
texts.text: The Head of the Government Authority may authorize the employ ee's Immediate Supervisor or higher officials, or form a committee of at least two employees to investigate into the violation attributed to the employee.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 113 ) Investigation Procedures of Violations
texts.text: Article ( 113 ) Investigation Procedures of Violations

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The investigation commissioner the violating employee may set a date to consider the violation attributed thereto and notify the employee in writing, provided that the following is observed:
texts.text: The investigation commissioner the violating employee may set a date to consider the violation attributed thereto and notify the employee in writing, provided that the following is observed:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. Deliver the notice to the employee in person, at their workplace, by e-mail, or by registered mail at his last known address.
texts.text: Deliver the notice to the employee in person, at their workplace, by e-mail, or by registered mail at his last known address.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. The notification shall be made at least three working days prior to the date set for the investigation.
texts.text: The notification shall be made at least three working days prior to the date set for the investigation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. In  the  event that the employee refuses to receive the notice or does not appear, he shall be renotified of the same procedure and an appointment shall be set for him to appear, provided that the appointment is served at least one day prior to the date set for the session.
texts.text: In  the  event that the employee refuses to receive the notice or does not appear, he shall be renotified of the same procedure and an appointment shall be set for him to appear, provided that the appointment is served at least one day prior to the date set for the session.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d. If the employee does not appear after the second notification, the investigation may be disposed of in his absence.
texts.text: If the employee does not appear after the second notification, the investigation may be disposed of in his absence.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e. The investigation may be conducted to hear and take statements during the leave period granted to  the  employee, whereby the employee can be summoned from his leave, when necessary, to conduct or complete the investigation process.
texts.text: The investigation may be conducted to hear and take statements during the leave period granted to  the  employee, whereby the employee can be summoned from his leave, when necessary, to conduct or complete the investigation process.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 2. Initiating the investigation procedures:
texts.text: 2. Initiating the investigation procedures:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. The investigation  commissioner shall  prepare  a  comprehensive summary  of the  content  of  the violation under investigation after studying and examining it, and shall specify the earliest date for the investigation.
texts.text: The investigation  commissioner shall  prepare  a  comprehensive summary  of the  content  of  the violation under investigation after studying and examining it, and shall specify the earliest date for the investigation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. The  investigation  shall  be  in  writing  and  in  a  confidential  manner,  and  all  statements  shall  be recorded in the investigation record.
texts.text: The  investigation  shall  be  in  writing  and  in  a  confidential  manner,  and  all  statements  shall  be recorded in the investigation record.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. The investigation deals with any violations that are discovered, even if they are not included in the notification.
texts.text: The investigation deals with any violations that are discovered, even if they are not included in the notification.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d. The violator must be confronted with what is attributed thereto in an accurate manner, without confusion, ambiguity, or a general description. If they acknowledge what is attributed thereto, the investigation commissioner must prove this by questioning them in detail.
texts.text: The violator must be confronted with what is attributed thereto in an accurate manner, without confusion, ambiguity, or a general description. If they acknowledge what is attributed thereto, the investigation commissioner must prove this by questioning them in detail.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e. Should the violator deny what is attributed thereto, the investigation commissioner must confront them with evidence, and verify their defence, evidence and defence witnesses.
texts.text: Should the violator deny what is attributed thereto, the investigation commissioner must confront them with evidence, and verify their defence, evidence and defence witnesses.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: f. The employee referred for investigation has the right to take notice of all the investigation papers and to submit documents that support their defence.
texts.text: The employee referred for investigation has the right to take notice of all the investigation papers and to submit documents that support their defence.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: g. The investigation commissioner shall conduct an inspection of the location of the incident and record everything they find precisely in the report or a separate report if necessary.
texts.text: The investigation commissioner shall conduct an inspection of the location of the incident and record everything they find precisely in the report or a separate report if necessary.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: h. The investigation commissioner may refer to any other party if the investigation so requires to review the papers or question any person who was unable to appear due to illness or the like.
texts.text: The investigation commissioner may refer to any other party if the investigation so requires to review the papers or question any person who was unable to appear due to illness or the like.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: i. Hearing witnesses:
texts.text: Hearing witnesses:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: -  The  investigator  may,  on  their  own  or  at  the  request  of  those  being  interrogated,  listen  to witnesses, and each of the employees who is called to hear their testimony must take the initiative to do so. If they refuse or fail to appear without an excuse accepted by the investigator, such conduct shall be considered a disciplinary violation.
texts.text: The  investigator  may,  on  their  own  or  at  the  request  of  those  being  interrogated,  listen  to witnesses, and each of the employees who is called to hear their testimony must take the initiative to do so. If they refuse or fail to appear without an excuse accepted by the investigator, such conduct shall be considered a disciplinary violation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: - The witness' connection to the employee to whom the violation is attributed must be established.
texts.text: The witness' connection to the employee to whom the violation is attributed must be established.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: - When the witness refuses to sign, this shall be documented in the minutes as well as the reason behind it.
texts.text: When the witness refuses to sign, this shall be documented in the minutes as well as the reason behind it.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: - If it is not possible to hear one of the witnesses, the investigator may ask them for a memorandum of their information on the facts subject of the investigation. The memorandum shall stipulate, after being endorsed, that it should be considered as well as attached and its content shall be recorded in the investigation record.
texts.text: If it is not possible to hear one of the witnesses, the investigator may ask them for a memorandum of their information on the facts subject of the investigation. The memorandum shall stipulate, after being endorsed, that it should be considered as well as attached and its content shall be recorded in the investigation record.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: j. The investigator may confront the witnesses with each other or with the employee to whom the violation is attributed, and this shall be established in a note documented in the minutes, provided that he signs each note. In the event of perusal of the records and papers, this must be recorded in the minutes with an adequate summary. It is also possible to include such papers or records or any papers that the investigation requires to be kept.
texts.text: The investigator may confront the witnesses with each other or with the employee to whom the violation is attributed, and this shall be established in a note documented in the minutes, provided that he signs each note. In the event of perusal of the records and papers, this must be recorded in the minutes with an adequate summary. It is also possible to include such papers or records or any papers that the investigation requires to be kept.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: k. If the investigation commissioner discovers a suspicion of forgery in one of the papers or one of the records or files which he has taken notice of, a reservation shall be made in this regard until an action is taken throughout the investigation.
texts.text: If the investigation commissioner discovers a suspicion of forgery in one of the papers or one of the records or files which he has taken notice of, a reservation shall be made in this regard until an action is taken throughout the investigation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: l. An investigation memorandum shall be prepared upon completion of the investigation, including the following:
texts.text: An investigation memorandum shall be prepared upon completion of the investigation, including the following:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: -A full statement of the subject of the violation, and what the investigation included in terms of discussing facts, evidence and relevant laws, with an indication of the validity of each incident and the extent of its attribution to an employee.
texts.text: -A full statement of the subject of the violation, and what the investigation included in terms of discussing facts, evidence and relevant laws, with an indication of the validity of each incident and the extent of its attribution to an employee.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: -The opinion reached by the commissioner of the investigation in terms of determining responsibility and recommendation or imposing the appropriate penalty - as the case may be - or preservation, or referral to the Disciplinary Council.
texts.text: -The opinion reached by the commissioner of the investigation in terms of determining responsibility and recommendation or imposing the appropriate penalty - as the case may be - or preservation, or referral to the Disciplinary Council.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: m. The Head of the Government Authority may return the papers to complete the investigation, and the  investigation  commissioner  must  implement  this  as  soon  as  possible  and  re-submit  a  new memorandum in which they prove what they deem appropriate in light of the completion of the investigation.
texts.text: The Head of the Government Authority may return the papers to complete the investigation, and the  investigation  commissioner  must  implement  this  as  soon  as  possible  and  re-submit  a  new memorandum in which they prove what they deem appropriate in light of the completion of the investigation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: n. The Human Resources Department at the Government Authority shall, within (5) working days, notify the employee concerned of the penalties decided to be taken against him.
texts.text: The Human Resources Department at the Government Authority shall, within (5) working days, notify the employee concerned of the penalties decided to be taken against him.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 114 ) Formation of a Disciplinary Board
texts.text: Article ( 114 ) Formation of a Disciplinary Board

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. A  Disciplinary  Board  or  more  shall  be  formed  by  a  decision  of  the  Authority,  at  the  request  of  the Government Authority, to hold the employees referred to it accountable, according to what is decided in this  Chapter,  to  investigate  with  them  regarding  the  job  violations  committed  by  them  that  require imposing the penalties mentioned in Clauses (4, 5, 6, 7) of the disciplinary penalties according to the text of Article (110) of these regulations.
texts.text: A  Disciplinary  Board  or  more  shall  be  formed  by  a  decision  of  the  Authority,  at  the  request  of  the Government Authority, to hold the employees referred to it accountable, according to what is decided in this  Chapter,  to  investigate  with  them  regarding  the  job  violations  committed  by  them  that  require imposing the penalties mentioned in Clauses (4, 5, 6, 7) of the disciplinary penalties according to the text of Article (110) of these regulations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The number of members of the Disciplinary Board, including the Head of the Disciplinary Board, must not be less than three members of the first degree or above, and their number must be odd, taking into account that the degree of any of them shall not be less than the degree of the employee referred to the Disciplinary Board.
texts.text: The number of members of the Disciplinary Board, including the Head of the Disciplinary Board, must not be less than three members of the first degree or above, and their number must be odd, taking into account that the degree of any of them shall not be less than the degree of the employee referred to the Disciplinary Board.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. It  should  be  taken  into  consideration  that  the  Head  of  the  Disciplinary  Board  is  not  from  the  same Government  Authority  requesting  the  formation  of  the  Board,  provided  that  they  are  from  another Government Authority and their job position is not less than that of an Executive Director.
texts.text: It  should  be  taken  into  consideration  that  the  Head  of  the  Disciplinary  Board  is  not  from  the  same Government  Authority  requesting  the  formation  of  the  Board,  provided  that  they  are  from  another Government Authority and their job position is not less than that of an Executive Director.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. A member of the Disciplinary Board must not have previously expressed an opinion on the subject of the investigation in any capacity whatsoever.
texts.text: A member of the Disciplinary Board must not have previously expressed an opinion on the subject of the investigation in any capacity whatsoever.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. The employee may not be referred to the Disciplinary Board except after the Government Authority forms a committee of at least two employees to investigate into the violation attributed to the employee.
texts.text: The employee may not be referred to the Disciplinary Board except after the Government Authority forms a committee of at least two employees to investigate into the violation attributed to the employee.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. The employee shall be referred to the Disciplinary Board by virtue of a decision of the chairman of the Government Authority, including a statement of the violations attributed to the employee.
texts.text: The employee shall be referred to the Disciplinary Board by virtue of a decision of the chairman of the Government Authority, including a statement of the violations attributed to the employee.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 115 ) Disciplinary Board Convening Procedures:
texts.text: Article ( 115 ) Disciplinary Board Convening Procedures:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The employee referred to the Disciplinary Board has the right to review the documents related to the accusation attributed to them, and they may obtain a copy of these documents if they so request. They also have the right to appear before the Disciplinary Board by themselves or their attorney delegated by him to present their defence.
texts.text: The employee referred to the Disciplinary Board has the right to review the documents related to the accusation attributed to them, and they may obtain a copy of these documents if they so request. They also have the right to appear before the Disciplinary Board by themselves or their attorney delegated by him to present their defence.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The employee's resignation does not prevent proceeding with disciplinary accountability procedures, and it is prohibited to accept the resignation if the employee has been referred to the Disciplinary Board.
texts.text: The employee's resignation does not prevent proceeding with disciplinary accountability procedures, and it is prohibited to accept the resignation if the employee has been referred to the Disciplinary Board.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The Disciplinary Board may complete the investigation by itself, and it shall have the powers granted to the investigation authorities in terms of verifying evidence, including hearing witnesses after taking the oath.
texts.text: The Disciplinary Board may complete the investigation by itself, and it shall have the powers granted to the investigation authorities in terms of verifying evidence, including hearing witnesses after taking the oath.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. The meeting of the Disciplinary Board shall not be valid unless all its members are present, and its decisions shall be issued by the majority of opinions. The Disciplinary Board may not convene before the lapse of at least one week from the date of notifying the employee in writing of the statement of the violations attributed to them, including copies of the documents related to the violation attributed to them.
texts.text: The meeting of the Disciplinary Board shall not be valid unless all its members are present, and its decisions shall be issued by the majority of opinions. The Disciplinary Board may not convene before the lapse of at least one week from the date of notifying the employee in writing of the statement of the violations attributed to them, including copies of the documents related to the violation attributed to them.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. The resolution of the Disciplinary Board shall be issued based on the reasons under which it was relied, and it shall be pronounced in the hearing scheduled for that purpose. The employee shall be notified of the resolution and its reasons in writing within two weeks of its issuance, and a copy of it shall be sent to their employer and the Authority.
texts.text: The resolution of the Disciplinary Board shall be issued based on the reasons under which it was relied, and it shall be pronounced in the hearing scheduled for that purpose. The employee shall be notified of the resolution and its reasons in writing within two weeks of its issuance, and a copy of it shall be sent to their employer and the Authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. The Disciplinary Board shall issue a separate decision for each case with the approval of its chairman.
texts.text: The Disciplinary Board shall issue a separate decision for each case with the approval of its chairman.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7. The Disciplinary Board may interpret the disciplinary decision and correct any material errors it may make.
texts.text: The Disciplinary Board may interpret the disciplinary decision and correct any material errors it may make.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Article ( 116 ) Implementing the Decision of the Disciplinary Board The Government Authority may not implement the decision of the Disciplinary Board before the end of the deadline for grievance or the deadline for deciding on it, as the case may be .
texts.text: Article ( 116 ) Implementing the Decision of the Disciplinary Board The Government Authority may not implement the decision of the Disciplinary Board before the end of the deadline for grievance or the deadline for deciding on it, as the case may be .

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 117 ) Suspension from Work
texts.text: Article ( 117 ) Suspension from Work

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Suspension from work for investigation:
texts.text: Suspension from work for investigation:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. The chairman of the Government Authority may issue a decision suspending the employee from work as a precaution in the interest of the investigation for a period not exceeding one month, and this period may not be extended except by a decision of the Disciplinary Board .
texts.text: The chairman of the Government Authority may issue a decision suspending the employee from work as a precaution in the interest of the investigation for a period not exceeding one month, and this period may not be extended except by a decision of the Disciplinary Board .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. The party who issued the suspension decision may reconsider it at any time, whether on its own initiative or at the request of the employee.
texts.text: The party who issued the suspension decision may reconsider it at any time, whether on its own initiative or at the request of the employee.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. The precautionary suspension of the employee from work pending investigation shall not affect their total salary.
texts.text: The precautionary suspension of the employee from work pending investigation shall not affect their total salary.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Suspension from work as a result of preventive detention or serving a sentence restricting freedom:
texts.text: Suspension from work as a result of preventive detention or serving a sentence restricting freedom:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. If a decision is issued by the competent authorities to remand the employee provisionally pending a case, they shall be suspended from work during the period of their imprisonment, without prejudice to their total salary.
texts.text: If a decision is issued by the competent authorities to remand the employee provisionally pending a case, they shall be suspended from work during the period of their imprisonment, without prejudice to their total salary.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Every  employee  who  serves  a  penalty  restricting  their  freedom  in  execution  of  a  civil  or  criminal judicial ruling in a felony or misdemeanour that is not breaching honour or trust shall be suspended from work by force of law, and deprived of their total salary for the period of their imprisonment. It is not permissible to consider their promotion or granting them any allowances or increases during this period. This period shall not be included in the period of their service.
texts.text: Every  employee  who  serves  a  penalty  restricting  their  freedom  in  execution  of  a  civil  or  criminal judicial ruling in a felony or misdemeanour that is not breaching honour or trust shall be suspended from work by force of law, and deprived of their total salary for the period of their imprisonment. It is not permissible to consider their promotion or granting them any allowances or increases during this period. This period shall not be included in the period of their service.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. After the termination of the penalty restricting freedom and the release of the employee, they shall resume work within a maximum period of five working days, otherwise they will be considered absent from work and in this case the provisions relating to absence from work contained in these regulations shall be applied to them.
texts.text: After the termination of the penalty restricting freedom and the release of the employee, they shall resume work within a maximum period of five working days, otherwise they will be considered absent from work and in this case the provisions relating to absence from work contained in these regulations shall be applied to them.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d. If  the  Government  Authority  considers,  based  on  the  study  of  the  reasons  for  the  judgement  of conviction issued against the employee, and the circumstances of the incident, that the acts committed by them constitute a disciplinary violation against them that requires a disciplinary penalty, they may be referred to the investigation to determine their disciplinary responsibility in accordance with the provisions of this regulation.
texts.text: If  the  Government  Authority  considers,  based  on  the  study  of  the  reasons  for  the  judgement  of conviction issued against the employee, and the circumstances of the incident, that the acts committed by them constitute a disciplinary violation against them that requires a disciplinary penalty, they may be referred to the investigation to determine their disciplinary responsibility in accordance with the provisions of this regulation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The period of suspension from work as a disciplinary penalty shall not be included in the employee's service period .
texts.text: The period of suspension from work as a disciplinary penalty shall not be included in the employee's service period .

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article  ( 118 )  Controls  and  Conditions  for  Imposing  Disciplinary Penalties
texts.text: Article  ( 118 )  Controls  and  Conditions  for  Imposing  Disciplinary Penalties

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. No disciplinary penalty may be combined with deduction of part of the employee's salary unless:
texts.text: No disciplinary penalty may be combined with deduction of part of the employee's salary unless:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. The  deduction  relates  to  the  days  of  absence  from  work  that  were  not  calculated  from  the balance of the periodic leave.
texts.text: The  deduction  relates  to  the  days  of  absence  from  work  that  were  not  calculated  from  the balance of the periodic leave.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. To  collect  the  value  of  material  damages  incurred  by  the  Government  Authority  as  a  result  of committing the violating act based on a judicial ruling.
texts.text: To  collect  the  value  of  material  damages  incurred  by  the  Government  Authority  as  a  result  of committing the violating act based on a judicial ruling.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. To fulfil an expense or a debt adjudicated by the court, or to pay what they owe to the government, whether for a reason related to the performance of their job, or to recover what was unjustly spent to them.
texts.text: To fulfil an expense or a debt adjudicated by the court, or to pay what they owe to the government, whether for a reason related to the performance of their job, or to recover what was unjustly spent to them.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. It is not permissible to impose more than one penalty on the employee for one violation.
texts.text: It is not permissible to impose more than one penalty on the employee for one violation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. In the event that several interrelated indivisible violations occur, the employee may be subject to the penalty prescribed for the most serious violations.
texts.text: In the event that several interrelated indivisible violations occur, the employee may be subject to the penalty prescribed for the most serious violations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. The service of the employee shall not be terminated or notified of that while they are enjoying any of the authorized  leaves,  unless  the  dismissal  from  the  job  is  made  by  virtue  of  a  disciplinary  decision  or dismissal by a judicial ruling without warning.
