texts.text: The service of the employee shall not be terminated or notified of that while they are enjoying any of the authorized  leaves,  unless  the  dismissal  from  the  job  is  made  by  virtue  of  a  disciplinary  decision  or dismissal by a judicial ruling without warning.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 119 ) Rules for Calculating the Deduction Penalty
texts.text: Article ( 119 ) Rules for Calculating the Deduction Penalty

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The deduction penalty shall be calculated from the basic salary.
texts.text: The deduction penalty shall be calculated from the basic salary.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The deduction penalty shall be implemented within the legally permissible limits of the  employee's monthly  salary  due  to  them  for  the  month  following  the  month  in  which  the  imposed  penalty  is announced, according to the prioritization of deduction and seizure established by the legislation in force.
texts.text: The deduction penalty shall be implemented within the legally permissible limits of the  employee's monthly  salary  due  to  them  for  the  month  following  the  month  in  which  the  imposed  penalty  is announced, according to the prioritization of deduction and seizure established by the legislation in force.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 120 ) Financial Violations
texts.text: Article ( 120 ) Financial Violations

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In the event that the Government Authority discovers any facts that constitute a financial violation, it shall:
texts.text: In the event that the Government Authority discovers any facts that constitute a financial violation, it shall:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Investigate financial violations committed by its employees, in accordance with the provisions of these regulations.
texts.text: Investigate financial violations committed by its employees, in accordance with the provisions of these regulations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Inform  the  Abu  Dhabi  Accountability  Authority  immediately  upon  discovering  the  violation  that constitutes a financial violation.
texts.text: Inform  the  Abu  Dhabi  Accountability  Authority  immediately  upon  discovering  the  violation  that constitutes a financial violation.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 121 ) Suspension of the Investigation
texts.text: Article ( 121 ) Suspension of the Investigation

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Suspension of the investigation  is  either implicit  or  definitive  for  the  reasons  described  in  each  case  as follows:
texts.text: Suspension of the investigation  is  either implicit  or  definitive  for  the  reasons  described  in  each  case  as follows:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Temporary suspension:
texts.text: Temporary suspension:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. For not knowing the perpetrator.
texts.text: For not knowing the perpetrator.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. For failure to prove the violation or for lack of sufficient evidence .
texts.text: For failure to prove the violation or for lack of sufficient evidence .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Final suspension:
texts.text: Final suspension:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. For invalidity of the complaint.
texts.text: For invalidity of the complaint.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. For lack of importance in the event that what was attributed to the employee does not deserve a penalty.
texts.text: For lack of importance in the event that what was attributed to the employee does not deserve a penalty.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. For the previous adjudication of the subject of the violation.
texts.text: For the previous adjudication of the subject of the violation.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 122 ) Cancellation of the Disciplinary Penalties
texts.text: Article ( 122 ) Cancellation of the Disciplinary Penalties

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Disciplinary penalties against the employee shall be cancelled and considered non-existent upon the expiry of the following periods:
texts.text: Disciplinary penalties against the employee shall be cancelled and considered non-existent upon the expiry of the following periods:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. Three months in case of drawing the attention.
texts.text: Three months in case of drawing the attention.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Six months in case of a written warning.
texts.text: Six months in case of a written warning.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. Nine months in case of deduction from the basic salary.
texts.text: Nine months in case of deduction from the basic salary.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d. One year in case of deprivation of the annual bonus.
texts.text: One year in case of deprivation of the annual bonus.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e. One year and six months in case of suspension from work.
texts.text: One year and six months in case of suspension from work.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The  chairman  of  the  Government  Authority  may,  without  the  need  to  request  that  from  the employee,  cancel  the  disciplinary  penalty  whenever  the  performance  reports  submitted  on  the employee during the periods specified for cancellation have the highest evaluation score, provided
texts.text: The  chairman  of  the  Government  Authority  may,  without  the  need  to  request  that  from  the employee,  cancel  the  disciplinary  penalty  whenever  the  performance  reports  submitted  on  the employee during the periods specified for cancellation have the highest evaluation score, provided

texts.label: text
texts.orig: that  this  cancellation  is  for  one  time  throughout  the  employee's  service  in  the  Government Authority.
texts.text: that  this  cancellation  is  for  one  time  throughout  the  employee's  service  in  the  Government Authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. As  a  result  of  cancellation,  the  penalty  is  considered  as  if  it  did  not  exist  with  regard  to  the employee's career future, and this does not affect the rights and compensations that were accrued to them.
texts.text: As  a  result  of  cancellation,  the  penalty  is  considered  as  if  it  did  not  exist  with  regard  to  the employee's career future, and this does not affect the rights and compensations that were accrued to them.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 123 ) Expiration and Lapse of the Disciplinary Action
texts.text: Article ( 123 ) Expiration and Lapse of the Disciplinary Action

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The disciplinary action for the employee who is still in service shall be lapsed after three years from the date of the violation.
texts.text: The disciplinary action for the employee who is still in service shall be lapsed after three years from the date of the violation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The  period  referred  to  in  the  previous  clause  shall  be  interrupted  by  taking  any  measure  of investigation,  accusation  or  trial,  and  the  period  shall  apply  again  from  the  date  of  the  last procedure.
texts.text: The  period  referred  to  in  the  previous  clause  shall  be  interrupted  by  taking  any  measure  of investigation,  accusation  or  trial,  and  the  period  shall  apply  again  from  the  date  of  the  last procedure.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. If there are several employee, the interruption of the period with respect to one of them will result in its interruption to others, even if no conclusive measures have been taken against them for the period.
texts.text: If there are several employee, the interruption of the period with respect to one of them will result in its interruption to others, even if no conclusive measures have been taken against them for the period.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. If the violating act constitutes a criminal offence, the disciplinary action shall not lapse unless the criminal action is lapsed.
texts.text: If the violating act constitutes a criminal offence, the disciplinary action shall not lapse unless the criminal action is lapsed.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. The termination of the employee's service for any reason does not prevent them from being held disciplinary accountable if the investigation has been initiated before the termination of service.
texts.text: The termination of the employee's service for any reason does not prevent them from being held disciplinary accountable if the investigation has been initiated before the termination of service.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. The disciplinary action expires if the employee dies.
texts.text: The disciplinary action expires if the employee dies.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Chapter XIV Complaints, Grievances and Objections
texts.text: Chapter XIV Complaints, Grievances and Objections

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 124 ) Complaints and Grievances Committee
texts.text: Article ( 124 ) Complaints and Grievances Committee

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Upon a decision by the Chairman of the Government Authority, a committee called (Grievance & Complaints Committee) shall be set up to consider and examine complaints and grievances raised by its employees.
texts.text: Upon a decision by the Chairman of the Government Authority, a committee called (Grievance & Complaints Committee) shall be set up to consider and examine complaints and grievances raised by its employees.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The committee shall be formed of no fewer than three members, including a representative of the legal affairs department in the government authority or the like, provided that the job of the committee members is not less than that of a Director of Department, and that one of its members is not from the Human Resources Department.
texts.text: The committee shall be formed of no fewer than three members, including a representative of the legal affairs department in the government authority or the like, provided that the job of the committee members is not less than that of a Director of Department, and that one of its members is not from the Human Resources Department.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The Complaints and Grievances Committee shall hold its sessions upon the invitation of its chairman - whenever needed - and its quorum shall be achieved in the presence of its chairman and the majority of its members. The chairman shall authorize one of the committee's members to replace them in the Chair of the Committee and the committee shall issue its recommendations by a majority of views.
texts.text: The Complaints and Grievances Committee shall hold its sessions upon the invitation of its chairman - whenever needed - and its quorum shall be achieved in the presence of its chairman and the majority of its members. The chairman shall authorize one of the committee's members to replace them in the Chair of the Committee and the committee shall issue its recommendations by a majority of views.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. The Complaints and Grievances Committee shall submit its recommendation regarding the complaint or grievance before it to the government authority chairman to issue their decision in this regard .
texts.text: The Complaints and Grievances Committee shall submit its recommendation regarding the complaint or grievance before it to the government authority chairman to issue their decision in this regard .

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article  ( 125 )  Rules  and  Procedures  for  Considering  Complaints and Grievances
texts.text: Article  ( 125 )  Rules  and  Procedures  for  Considering  Complaints and Grievances

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The  employee  may  submit  in  writing  to  the  Complaints  and  Grievances  Committee  their dissatisfaction with a procedure taken or refrained from being taken by the government authority in relation to their interest or with any complaint related to the work environment or employees.
texts.text: The  employee  may  submit  in  writing  to  the  Complaints  and  Grievances  Committee  their dissatisfaction with a procedure taken or refrained from being taken by the government authority in relation to their interest or with any complaint related to the work environment or employees.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The  employee  may  appeal  in  writing  any  administrative  decision  related  to  their  employment affairs issued in application of the provisions of the Law and this regulation to the head of the government authority, within (15) working days from the date of ascertainment of the decision.
texts.text: The  employee  may  appeal  in  writing  any  administrative  decision  related  to  their  employment affairs issued in application of the provisions of the Law and this regulation to the head of the government authority, within (15) working days from the date of ascertainment of the decision.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The  government  authority  shall  refer  the  complaint  or  grievance  submitted  thereto  by  the employee to the Complaints and Grievances Committee to study and examine the complaint or grievance.
texts.text: The  government  authority  shall  refer  the  complaint  or  grievance  submitted  thereto  by  the employee to the Complaints and Grievances Committee to study and examine the complaint or grievance.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. The Complaints and Grievances Committee exert its efforts and endeavours to try to resolve the complaint or grievance amicably (whenever possible) before beginning to consider the complaint or grievance.
texts.text: The Complaints and Grievances Committee exert its efforts and endeavours to try to resolve the complaint or grievance amicably (whenever possible) before beginning to consider the complaint or grievance.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. The Complaints and Grievances Committee must consider the complaint or grievance and issue its recommendation within a period not exceeding (15) working days from the date of receiving the complaint or grievance, and its recommendations shall be justified.
texts.text: The Complaints and Grievances Committee must consider the complaint or grievance and issue its recommendation within a period not exceeding (15) working days from the date of receiving the complaint or grievance, and its recommendations shall be justified.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. The  head  of  the  government  authority,  based  on  the  recommendation  of  the  Complaints  and Grievances Committee, shall issue their decision regarding the employee's complaint or grievance within a maximum period of (20) working days from the date of the employee's submission of their complaint or grievance. If that period lapses without a decision on the complaint or grievance, it is considered rejected.
texts.text: The  head  of  the  government  authority,  based  on  the  recommendation  of  the  Complaints  and Grievances Committee, shall issue their decision regarding the employee's complaint or grievance within a maximum period of (20) working days from the date of the employee's submission of their complaint or grievance. If that period lapses without a decision on the complaint or grievance, it is considered rejected.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 126 ) Grievance before the Objections Committee
texts.text: Article ( 126 ) Grievance before the Objections Committee

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. An employee may appeal to the Objections Committee in the following cases:
texts.text: An employee may appeal to the Objections Committee in the following cases:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. Grievance  against  the  decision  of  the  head  of  the  government  authority  to  impose disciplinary penalties, with the exception of penalties (drawing attention, written warning, deduction from the basic salary for a period not exceeding three days), and the employee must complain to their employer before referring to the Objections Committee within (15) working days from the date of deciding on the complaint or grievance.
texts.text: Grievance  against  the  decision  of  the  head  of  the  government  authority  to  impose disciplinary penalties, with the exception of penalties (drawing attention, written warning, deduction from the basic salary for a period not exceeding three days), and the employee must complain to their employer before referring to the Objections Committee within (15) working days from the date of deciding on the complaint or grievance.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Grievance against the decision of the Disciplinary Council, within (15) working days from the date of notifying the employee of the penalty.
texts.text: Grievance against the decision of the Disciplinary Council, within (15) working days from the date of notifying the employee of the penalty.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The employee and their employer shall be officially notified of the reasoned decision issued by the Objections Committee immediately upon its issuance.
texts.text: The employee and their employer shall be officially notified of the reasoned decision issued by the Objections Committee immediately upon its issuance.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The employee may appeal before the Court of First Instance within (30) days from the date of issuance of the Objections Committee's decision.
texts.text: The employee may appeal before the Court of First Instance within (30) days from the date of issuance of the Objections Committee's decision.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 127 )
texts.text: Article ( 127 )

texts.label: text
texts.orig: While initiating grievance procedures in accordance with the provisions of this chapter, the employee may be absent from work with a gross salary to attend grievance sessions held by the Objections Committee or court sessions, provided that they notify their direct supervisor in writing and submit proof of their attendance at those sessions.
texts.text: While initiating grievance procedures in accordance with the provisions of this chapter, the employee may be absent from work with a gross salary to attend grievance sessions held by the Objections Committee or court sessions, provided that they notify their direct supervisor in writing and submit proof of their attendance at those sessions.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Chapter 15
texts.text: Chapter 15

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: End of Service
texts.text: End of Service

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 128 ) General Policy
texts.text: Article ( 128 ) General Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The  relationship  between  the  employee  and  the  government  authority  is  considered  an organizational  relationship  that  ends  when  certain  reasons  are  fulfilled  or  available,  and  the termination of service shall be either obligatory because the staff member is not eligible for public office by virtue of an explicit decision of the appointing authority, or by choice and consent of the employee.
texts.text: The  relationship  between  the  employee  and  the  government  authority  is  considered  an organizational  relationship  that  ends  when  certain  reasons  are  fulfilled  or  available,  and  the termination of service shall be either obligatory because the staff member is not eligible for public office by virtue of an explicit decision of the appointing authority, or by choice and consent of the employee.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The employee's service may not be terminated except in accordance with the reasons stated in the law and after confirmation and verification and taking all the procedures stipulated and taking into account compliance with the terms of the employment contract and the provisions of the relevant legislation in force.
texts.text: The employee's service may not be terminated except in accordance with the reasons stated in the law and after confirmation and verification and taking all the procedures stipulated and taking into account compliance with the terms of the employment contract and the provisions of the relevant legislation in force.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 129 ) Cases of End of Service
texts.text: Article ( 129 ) Cases of End of Service

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 1. Reaching Retirement Age:
texts.text: 1. Reaching Retirement Age:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. The service of a citizen employee shall be terminated upon reaching the legal age for retirement in accordance with the legislation in force in the Emirate, by virtue of a decision issued by the head of the government authority.
texts.text: The service of a citizen employee shall be terminated upon reaching the legal age for retirement in accordance with the legislation in force in the Emirate, by virtue of a decision issued by the head of the government authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. The service of a non-citizen employee shall be terminated upon reaching the age of (60) sixty for males and (55) fifty-five for females in accordance with a decision issued by the head of the government authority.
texts.text: The service of a non-citizen employee shall be terminated upon reaching the age of (60) sixty for males and (55) fifty-five for females in accordance with a decision issued by the head of the government authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. The Human Resources Department shall notify the employees in writing at least three months prior to the date specified for their retirement or termination of service.
texts.text: The Human Resources Department shall notify the employees in writing at least three months prior to the date specified for their retirement or termination of service.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d. The employee's service shall be extended after reaching the retirement age for one year or more in accordance with the following provisions:
texts.text: The employee's service shall be extended after reaching the retirement age for one year or more in accordance with the following provisions:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: -The service of a citizen employee may be extended after reaching the age of retirement in cases required by the work interest until they reach the age of seventy for males and the age of sixtyfive for females, as a maximum, by virtue of a decision of the head of the government authority, provided that a report is available from the health authority stating their fitness for work, and that they submit a performance report of no less than -Good- for each year during which the service is extended.
texts.text: -The service of a citizen employee may be extended after reaching the age of retirement in cases required by the work interest until they reach the age of seventy for males and the age of sixtyfive for females, as a maximum, by virtue of a decision of the head of the government authority, provided that a report is available from the health authority stating their fitness for work, and that they submit a performance report of no less than -Good- for each year during which the service is extended.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: -The service of a non-citizen employee may be extended after reaching the age specified in Clause (1-b) of this article in cases required by the work interest until they reach the age of sixty-five for males and the age of sixty for females, as a maximum, by virtue of a decision of the head of the government authority, provided that this is limited to those who occupy the positions of experts and consultants, provided that a report from the medical committee is available stating that they are fit for work, and that they submit a performance report of - no less than Good- for each year during which the service is extended.
texts.text: -The service of a non-citizen employee may be extended after reaching the age specified in Clause (1-b) of this article in cases required by the work interest until they reach the age of sixty-five for males and the age of sixty for females, as a maximum, by virtue of a decision of the head of the government authority, provided that this is limited to those who occupy the positions of experts and consultants, provided that a report from the medical committee is available stating that they are fit for work, and that they submit a performance report of - no less than Good- for each year during which the service is extended.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: -The appointing authority may terminate the employee's service at any time during the service extension period, without mentioning the reasons, by virtue of a two-month written warning or the remaining period of the end of the service extension period, whichever is less.
texts.text: -The appointing authority may terminate the employee's service at any time during the service extension period, without mentioning the reasons, by virtue of a two-month written warning or the remaining period of the end of the service extension period, whichever is less.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e. Retirement of the Suspended Employee:
texts.text: Retirement of the Suspended Employee:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: -If the employee reaches the age of retirement while serving the period of pre-trial detention or suspension from work as a disciplinary penalty, they shall be retired during that period.
texts.text: -If the employee reaches the age of retirement while serving the period of pre-trial detention or suspension from work as a disciplinary penalty, they shall be retired during that period.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: -The citizen employee's pension rights shall be settled and disbursed thereto in accordance with what is decided in the Retirement Pensions and Benefits Law in force in the Emirate.
texts.text: -The citizen employee's pension rights shall be settled and disbursed thereto in accordance with what is decided in the Retirement Pensions and Benefits Law in force in the Emirate.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 2.  Total Disability or Unfitness for Service:
texts.text: 2.  Total Disability or Unfitness for Service:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. Subject to the relevant provisions of the Retirement Pensions and Benefits Law in force in the Emirate, the employee's service shall end if their total disability or unfitness for service is proven, in accordance with a report issued by the competent medical committee.
texts.text: Subject to the relevant provisions of the Retirement Pensions and Benefits Law in force in the Emirate, the employee's service shall end if their total disability or unfitness for service is proven, in accordance with a report issued by the competent medical committee.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. The date of the employee's termination of service shall be determined as of the date of issuance of the report of the competent medical committee.
texts.text: The date of the employee's termination of service shall be determined as of the date of issuance of the report of the competent medical committee.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. The period spent by the employee who continues to serve during the period from the date of issuance of the report of the competent medical committee until the date of  issuance of the decision to terminate their service by the competent authority shall not be counted within their actual  service  for  the  purposes  of  retirement  for  citizens  or  end-of-service  benefits  for  noncitizens. The employee's salaries during this period are considered wages for work, and for the citizen employee, the contributions deducted from their salary for the benefit of the retirement fund shall be returned to them.
texts.text: The period spent by the employee who continues to serve during the period from the date of issuance of the report of the competent medical committee until the date of  issuance of the decision to terminate their service by the competent authority shall not be counted within their actual  service  for  the  purposes  of  retirement  for  citizens  or  end-of-service  benefits  for  noncitizens. The employee's salaries during this period are considered wages for work, and for the citizen employee, the contributions deducted from their salary for the benefit of the retirement fund shall be returned to them.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d. The government authority may not terminate the service of an employee with a disability for unfitness for service due to their stable health condition when they were appointed.
texts.text: The government authority may not terminate the service of an employee with a disability for unfitness for service due to their stable health condition when they were appointed.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 3. Resignation:
texts.text: 3. Resignation:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. The employee may submit a written request to resign from their job - without the obligation to give reasons - with at least two months' written warning.
texts.text: The employee may submit a written request to resign from their job - without the obligation to give reasons - with at least two months' written warning.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. The government authority must reply to the resignation request within (30) days from the date of its submission, otherwise the resignation will be considered accepted subject to a statute of limitations.
texts.text: The government authority must reply to the resignation request within (30) days from the date of its submission, otherwise the resignation will be considered accepted subject to a statute of limitations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. The  government  authority  shall  discuss  the  employee's  resignation  request  to  find  out  the reasons that led them to do so and try to settle their situation to retain them if it has an interest in that.
texts.text: The  government  authority  shall  discuss  the  employee's  resignation  request  to  find  out  the reasons that led them to do so and try to settle their situation to retain them if it has an interest in that.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d. The employee shall not leave work before the date specified in the resignation, or before thirty days from the date of submitting the resignation without a reply from the government authority. If  they  cease  to  work  during  this  period  without  a  legitimate  excuse,  the  provisions  of  the discontinuance provisions set forth in these regulations shall apply.
texts.text: The employee shall not leave work before the date specified in the resignation, or before thirty days from the date of submitting the resignation without a reply from the government authority. If  they  cease  to  work  during  this  period  without  a  legitimate  excuse,  the  provisions  of  the discontinuance provisions set forth in these regulations shall apply.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e. The employee may withdraw his resignation, provided that this is before the issuance of the decision of the head of the government authority to accept the resignation, or before (30) days from the date of its submission, as soon as the employee submits a written notification to their direct supervisor.
texts.text: The employee may withdraw his resignation, provided that this is before the issuance of the decision of the head of the government authority to accept the resignation, or before (30) days from the date of its submission, as soon as the employee submits a written notification to their direct supervisor.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: f. In order to clarify the reasons, the government authority shall conduct an interview with the employee who submits his resignation or request for transfer.
texts.text: In order to clarify the reasons, the government authority shall conduct an interview with the employee who submits his resignation or request for transfer.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 4. Public interest:
texts.text: 4. Public interest:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. The employee's service ends upon a decision from the authority, whenever the public interest so requires.
texts.text: The employee's service ends upon a decision from the authority, whenever the public interest so requires.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. The service of the employee for the public interest shall be terminated as of the date of issuance of the decision, or the date specified in that decision.
texts.text: The service of the employee for the public interest shall be terminated as of the date of issuance of the decision, or the date specified in that decision.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 5. In Accordance with the Terms of the Employment Contract:
texts.text: 5. In Accordance with the Terms of the Employment Contract:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. In case the government authority does not wish to renew or terminate the contract of a citizen employee before the expiration of its term, the government authority must coordinate with the authority and make every possible effort to rehabilitate them for another suitable post and cause its unwillingness to renew the contract. The Authority shall examine the extent to which the employee may hold an appropriate position in any other authority. If such endeavours
texts.text: In case the government authority does not wish to renew or terminate the contract of a citizen employee before the expiration of its term, the government authority must coordinate with the authority and make every possible effort to rehabilitate them for another suitable post and cause its unwillingness to renew the contract. The Authority shall examine the extent to which the employee may hold an appropriate position in any other authority. If such endeavours

texts.label: text
texts.orig: were unsuccessful, the authority may grant its approval to terminate the employment contract based on the government entity's unwillingness to renew. In all cases,  all these steps  and efforts must be fully documented, and the government authority's deci sion must be reasoned in accordance with the requirements of the job interest.
texts.text: were unsuccessful, the authority may grant its approval to terminate the employment contract based on the government entity's unwillingness to renew. In all cases,  all these steps  and efforts must be fully documented, and the government authority's deci sion must be reasoned in accordance with the requirements of the job interest.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. The government authority may terminate the employment contract for a non-citizen at any time after  the  end  of  the  probationary  period,  for  non-disciplinary  or  legal  reasons,  and  without mentioning  the  reasons,  if  it  no  longer  needs  their  services,  by  virtue  of  a  written  warning addressed to the employee for a period of two months prior to the date specified for termination of service.
texts.text: The government authority may terminate the employment contract for a non-citizen at any time after  the  end  of  the  probationary  period,  for  non-disciplinary  or  legal  reasons,  and  without mentioning  the  reasons,  if  it  no  longer  needs  their  services,  by  virtue  of  a  written  warning addressed to the employee for a period of two months prior to the date specified for termination of service.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. Termination of service in accordance with the terms of the employment contract shall not be considered a disciplinary sanction.
texts.text: Termination of service in accordance with the terms of the employment contract shall not be considered a disciplinary sanction.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 6. Functional Incompetence:
texts.text: 6. Functional Incompetence:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. By virtue of a decision of the head of the government authority based on the recommendation of the Human Resources Committee, the service of a citizen employee who has obtained two consecutive  performance  reports  with  a  rating  of  (weak)  may  be  terminated,  taking  into account the procedures stipulated in this regulation.
texts.text: By virtue of a decision of the head of the government authority based on the recommendation of the Human Resources Committee, the service of a citizen employee who has obtained two consecutive  performance  reports  with  a  rating  of  (weak)  may  be  terminated,  taking  into account the procedures stipulated in this regulation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. By virtue of a decision of the head of the government authority, the service of a non-citizen employee who has obtained a performance report with a rating of (weak) shall be terminated.
texts.text: By virtue of a decision of the head of the government authority, the service of a non-citizen employee who has obtained a performance report with a rating of (weak) shall be terminated.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. Termination of service for job incompetence is not considered a disciplinary penalty, nor is it required to conduct an investigation with the employee before issuing the decision to terminate service for incompetence..
texts.text: Termination of service for job incompetence is not considered a disciplinary penalty, nor is it required to conduct an investigation with the employee before issuing the decision to terminate service for incompetence..

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 7 Deprivation or Withdrawal of the Country's Nationality:
texts.text: 7 Deprivation or Withdrawal of the Country's Nationality:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The service of the citizen employee shall end if the country's nationality is deprived or withdraw n from him, as of the date of issuance of the decree so decided.
texts.text: The service of the citizen employee shall end if the country's nationality is deprived or withdraw n from him, as of the date of issuance of the decree so decided.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 8 Final judgement with a penalty restricting freedom in a felony or misdemeanour involving breach of honour or honesty
texts.text: 8 Final judgement with a penalty restricting freedom in a felony or misdemeanour involving breach of honour or honesty

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. The  employee's  service  ends  if  a  final  judgement  is  issued  against  them  with  a  penalty restricting  his  freedom  in  a  felony  or  misdemeanour  breaching  honour  or  honesty  in accordance  with  the  legislation  in  force  and  subject  to  enforcement.  Dismissal  shall  be permissible to the head of the government authority if the sentence is with a stay of execution of the penalty.
texts.text: The  employee's  service  ends  if  a  final  judgement  is  issued  against  them  with  a  penalty restricting  his  freedom  in  a  felony  or  misdemeanour  breaching  honour  or  honesty  in accordance  with  the  legislation  in  force  and  subject  to  enforcement.  Dismissal  shall  be permissible to the head of the government authority if the sentence is with a stay of execution of the penalty.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. The date of the employee's termination of service shall be determined as of the date of the final judgement.
texts.text: The date of the employee's termination of service shall be determined as of the date of the final judgement.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. The period spent by the employee who continues to serve during the period from the date of issuance of the final judgement on penalty until the date of issuance of the decision to terminate their service by the competent authority shall not be counted within their actual service for the purposes of retirement for citizens or end-of-service benefits for non-citizens. The employee's salaries  during  this  period  are  considered  wages for  work,  and for  the  citizen  employee, the contributions deducted from their salary for the benefit of the retirement fund shall be returned to them.
texts.text: The period spent by the employee who continues to serve during the period from the date of issuance of the final judgement on penalty until the date of issuance of the decision to terminate their service by the competent authority shall not be counted within their actual service for the purposes of retirement for citizens or end-of-service benefits for non-citizens. The employee's salaries  during  this  period  are  considered  wages for  work,  and for  the  citizen  employee, the contributions deducted from their salary for the benefit of the retirement fund shall be returned to them.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 9. Dismissal from the job by a disciplinary decision or dismissal by a court ruling:
texts.text: 9. Dismissal from the job by a disciplinary decision or dismissal by a court ruling:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. The employee's service ends for disciplinary reasons based on the decision of the Disciplinary Council, and the date of termination of the employee's service is determined as of the date of issuance of the decision to dismiss from service by the Disciplinary Council.
texts.text: The employee's service ends for disciplinary reasons based on the decision of the Disciplinary Council, and the date of termination of the employee's service is determined as of the date of issuance of the decision to dismiss from service by the Disciplinary Council.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. The employee's service ends if a final judgement is issued against him to dismiss him from the job, and the date of issuance of the final judgement is the date of termination of service.
texts.text: The employee's service ends if a final judgement is issued against him to dismiss him from the job, and the date of issuance of the final judgement is the date of termination of service.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. The period spent by the employee who continues to serve during the period from the date of the disciplinary decision to dismiss from the job or the dismissal judgement until the date of issuance of the decision to terminate their service by the competent authority shall not be counted within their actual service for the purposes of retirement for citizens or end-of-service benefits for noncitizens. The employee's salaries during this period are considered wages for work, and for the citizen employee, the contributions deducted from their salary for the benefit of the retirement fund shall be returned to them.
texts.text: The period spent by the employee who continues to serve during the period from the date of the disciplinary decision to dismiss from the job or the dismissal judgement until the date of issuance of the decision to terminate their service by the competent authority shall not be counted within their actual service for the purposes of retirement for citizens or end-of-service benefits for noncitizens. The employee's salaries during this period are considered wages for work, and for the citizen employee, the contributions deducted from their salary for the benefit of the retirement fund shall be returned to them.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 10. Death:
texts.text: 10. Death:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. The  employee's  service  ends  as  of  the  day  following  his  death  specified  in  the  official  death certificate.
texts.text: The  employee's  service  ends  as  of  the  day  following  his  death  specified  in  the  official  death certificate.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. In addition to end-of-service benefits calculated in accordance with the provisions of this chapter, the following additional benefits shall be payable:
texts.text: In addition to end-of-service benefits calculated in accordance with the provisions of this chapter, the following additional benefits shall be payable:

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 1. Death grant
texts.text: 1. Death grant

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: -The government authority shall disburse a grant equivalent to the gross salary that was paid to the deceased employee who was working for it for the month of death and the following three months in one payment, and the amount shall be delivered to the person specified by the  employee  before  his  death  according  to  the  human  resources  records.  If  they  do  not specify a specific person, the amount shall be disbursed to the person or persons whom the employee  was  dependent  on  -  by  virtue  of  a  letter  from  the  competent  court  to  prove dependency. If it was not proven that they were supporting someone, the amount will be distributed among their legal heirs according to their legal shares determined by a hereditary notification issued by the competent court.
texts.text: -The government authority shall disburse a grant equivalent to the gross salary that was paid to the deceased employee who was working for it for the month of death and the following three months in one payment, and the amount shall be delivered to the person specified by the  employee  before  his  death  according  to  the  human  resources  records.  If  they  do  not specify a specific person, the amount shall be disbursed to the person or persons whom the employee  was  dependent  on  -  by  virtue  of  a  letter  from  the  competent  court  to  prove dependency. If it was not proven that they were supporting someone, the amount will be distributed among their legal heirs according to their legal shares determined by a hereditary notification issued by the competent court.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: -Under no circumstances shall the value of the death grant be deducted or withheld to fulfil any debt whatsoever and to any authority under any other laws or systems, and this grant shall be exempt from taxes and fees of all kinds.
texts.text: -Under no circumstances shall the value of the death grant be deducted or withheld to fulfil any debt whatsoever and to any authority under any other laws or systems, and this grant shall be exempt from taxes and fees of all kinds.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Compensation for death or permanent disability as a result of an injury during the performance of their job or because of it
texts.text: Compensation for death or permanent disability as a result of an injury during the performance of their job or because of it

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: -Upon the death of the employee or their permanent total/partial disability while performing their  job  or  because  of  it,  the  government  authority  shall  disburse  the  legal  heirs  of  the deceased employee or them - as the case may be - compensation for death or work injury and the compensation shall be determined according to the following:
texts.text: -Upon the death of the employee or their permanent total/partial disability while performing their  job  or  because  of  it,  the  government  authority  shall  disburse  the  legal  heirs  of  the deceased employee or them - as the case may be - compensation for death or work injury and the compensation shall be determined according to the following:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: .أ In the event of death or permanent total disability, the amount of compensation shall be the sum of the employee's gross salary for a period of six months, or the amount of legal Diyah, whichever is higher.
texts.text: .أ In the event of death or permanent total disability, the amount of compensation shall be the sum of the employee's gross salary for a period of six months, or the amount of legal Diyah, whichever is higher.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: .ب In the event of permanent partial disability, the amount of compensation shall be estimated at a percentage of the total permanent disability compensation as decided by the medical committee.
texts.text: .ب In the event of permanent partial disability, the amount of compensation shall be estimated at a percentage of the total permanent disability compensation as decided by the medical committee.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: -Compensation for death and the legal Diyah may not be combined if the government bears the legal Diyah.
texts.text: -Compensation for death and the legal Diyah may not be combined if the government bears the legal Diyah.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. Combining death grant and compensation
texts.text: Combining death grant and compensation

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The death grant and its compensation set out in this section of these regulations may be combined as the case may be.
texts.text: The death grant and its compensation set out in this section of these regulations may be combined as the case may be.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d. Returning the body to the country of the deceased
texts.text: Returning the body to the country of the deceased

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: -The government authority shall bear the cost of transporting the body of the deceased employee to their approved home, as well as the cost of a travel ticket for the companion.
texts.text: -The government authority shall bear the cost of transporting the body of the deceased employee to their approved home, as well as the cost of a travel ticket for the companion.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: -The  government  authority  shall  bear  the  value  of  travel  tickets  for  the  deceased employee's wife and their residing children to the employee's approved home, as well as the  costs  of  transporting  luggage  within  the  limits  established  in  accordance  with  the legislation in force.
texts.text: -The  government  authority  shall  bear  the  value  of  travel  tickets  for  the  deceased employee's wife and their residing children to the employee's approved home, as well as the  costs  of  transporting  luggage  within  the  limits  established  in  accordance  with  the legislation in force.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 130 ) Termination of Service Notice -Notice Allowance
texts.text: Article ( 130 ) Termination of Service Notice -Notice Allowance

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. In cases of expiration or termination of the service that is subject to notice, both parties shall be committed to issue a two-month written warning to the other party.
texts.text: In cases of expiration or termination of the service that is subject to notice, both parties shall be committed to issue a two-month written warning to the other party.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The government authority may not issue a notice of termination of the employee's service while they are enjoying any of the legally authorized leave.
texts.text: The government authority may not issue a notice of termination of the employee's service while they are enjoying any of the legally authorized leave.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. If one of the parties fails to warn the other party of termination of service, or did not consider the notice period, they shall pay to the other party a compensation equivalent to the gross salary for the notice period or the missing part thereof, without prejudice to the government authority's right to terminate the employee's service for lack of validity before the completion of the probation period,  or  at  any  time  after  the  probationary  period  for  disciplinary  or  legal  reasons  without a written warning, in accordance with the laws and regulations in force in this regard.
texts.text: If one of the parties fails to warn the other party of termination of service, or did not consider the notice period, they shall pay to the other party a compensation equivalent to the gross salary for the notice period or the missing part thereof, without prejudice to the government authority's right to terminate the employee's service for lack of validity before the completion of the probation period,  or  at  any  time  after  the  probationary  period  for  disciplinary  or  legal  reasons  without a written warning, in accordance with the laws and regulations in force in this regard.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. The employee must continue to work during the notice period, and the government authority may agree to reduce the employee's work period during the notice period while exempting them from paying compensation for that period or the remaining part of it. It may also exempt them from work during the notice period in return for paying them their gross salary for that period or the remaining part thereof.
texts.text: The employee must continue to work during the notice period, and the government authority may agree to reduce the employee's work period during the notice period while exempting them from paying compensation for that period or the remaining part of it. It may also exempt them from work during the notice period in return for paying them their gross salary for that period or the remaining part thereof.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 131 ) Date of End of Service
texts.text: Article ( 131 ) Date of End of Service

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. In  cases  of  a  obligatory  end  of  service,  the  decision  of  the  government  authority  shall  be  to terminate the employee's service as of the day following the day in which his eligibility or validity, which are necessary to carry out the job burdens, are gone, and the government authority shall not determine any other date.
texts.text: In  cases  of  a  obligatory  end  of  service,  the  decision  of  the  government  authority  shall  be  to terminate the employee's service as of the day following the day in which his eligibility or validity, which are necessary to carry out the job burdens, are gone, and the government authority shall not determine any other date.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. In  cases  of  termination  of  the  service  by  the  government  authority or upon the  request  of the employee, the government authority may determine the date of the end of the service by virtue of the decision issued in this regard, provided that it is included in the calculation of the service period of the notice period, whether the employee worked during it, or was exempted from work during it,  or  paid a notice allowance for all or part thereof. Cases of end of service by the government authority and/or upon the request of the employee, shall include the following:
texts.text: In  cases  of  termination  of  the  service  by  the  government  authority or upon the  request  of the employee, the government authority may determine the date of the end of the service by virtue of the decision issued in this regard, provided that it is included in the calculation of the service period of the notice period, whether the employee worked during it, or was exempted from work during it,  or  paid a notice allowance for all or part thereof. Cases of end of service by the government authority and/or upon the request of the employee, shall include the following:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: AFailing the test period successfully.
texts.text: AFailing the test period successfully.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: BThe explicit resignation submitted by the employee.
texts.text: BThe explicit resignation submitted by the employee.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: CThe  final  ruling  on  the  employee  with  a  sanction  restricted  to  freedom  in  a  felony  or misdemeanour that violates honour or honesty with a stay of execution.
texts.text: CThe  final  ruling  on  the  employee  with  a  sanction  restricted  to  freedom  in  a  felony  or misdemeanour that violates honour or honesty with a stay of execution.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: DIn Accordance with the Terms of the Employment Contract.
texts.text: DIn Accordance with the Terms of the Employment Contract.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 132 ) Termination  of the Service  of  the  Seconded Employee or Delegated to Another Authority
texts.text: Article ( 132 ) Termination  of the Service  of  the  Seconded Employee or Delegated to Another Authority

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The right to adopt the decision to terminate the service is limited to the original government authority to which the employee belongs before seconding or delegating them to another authority, and the original government authority shall be responsible for all procedures and transactions to end their service, including procedures related to dismissal cases by a disciplinary decision or removal by judicial ruling .
texts.text: The right to adopt the decision to terminate the service is limited to the original government authority to which the employee belongs before seconding or delegating them to another authority, and the original government authority shall be responsible for all procedures and transactions to end their service, including procedures related to dismissal cases by a disciplinary decision or removal by judicial ruling .

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 133 ) Medical Examination at the End of Service
texts.text: Article ( 133 ) Medical Examination at the End of Service

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. A comprehensive medical examination shall be carried out for all employees before the end of their service,  except  in  the  event  of  death  or  when  the  employee  is  not  willing  to  undergo  the examination.  The  employee  shall  proceed  within  (30)  days  from  the  date  on  which  they  are informed  of  the  medical  examination  at  the  appointed  authority,  after  being  notified  of  a recommended letter on their registered address.
texts.text: A comprehensive medical examination shall be carried out for all employees before the end of their service,  except  in  the  event  of  death  or  when  the  employee  is  not  willing  to  undergo  the examination.  The  employee  shall  proceed  within  (30)  days  from  the  date  on  which  they  are informed  of  the  medical  examination  at  the  appointed  authority,  after  being  notified  of  a recommended letter on their registered address.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. In  the  event  that  the  employee  who  has  ended  their  service  is  unwilling  to  undergo  the examination, they shall sign an acknowledgement not to be responsible for any medical incapacity or  to  develop  any  of  the  profession  diseases  during  and  because  working  at  the  government authority.
texts.text: In  the  event  that  the  employee  who  has  ended  their  service  is  unwilling  to  undergo  the examination, they shall sign an acknowledgement not to be responsible for any medical incapacity or  to  develop  any  of  the  profession  diseases  during  and  because  working  at  the  government authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. At the end of the service, the medical examination aims to indicate any medical incapacity or any of the profession diseases during and because of working at the government authority, or absence thereof. .
texts.text: At the end of the service, the medical examination aims to indicate any medical incapacity or any of the profession diseases during and because of working at the government authority, or absence thereof. .

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article  ( 134 )  Retention  of  the  Employee  after  Termination  of Service
texts.text: Article  ( 134 )  Retention  of  the  Employee  after  Termination  of Service

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The government authority may keep the employee after termination of his service, if necessary, for no longer than two months to hand over what is in their custody. The employee whose services have been terminated shall be paid for this period a lump sum monthly bonus equal to their total monthly salary, and this period shall not be included in their service period.
texts.text: The government authority may keep the employee after termination of his service, if necessary, for no longer than two months to hand over what is in their custody. The employee whose services have been terminated shall be paid for this period a lump sum monthly bonus equal to their total monthly salary, and this period shall not be included in their service period.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 135 ) Experience Certificate
texts.text: Article ( 135 ) Experience Certificate

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The government authority shall be obligated to hand over the employee, after the end of their service and upon their request, an experience certificate indicating the date of commencement of service, the date of its end, their service period, the title and degree of their job, their job grade, the work they were carrying out, and the last salary they were receiving, including bonuses, allowances and benefits during service .
texts.text: The government authority shall be obligated to hand over the employee, after the end of their service and upon their request, an experience certificate indicating the date of commencement of service, the date of its end, their service period, the title and degree of their job, their job grade, the work they were carrying out, and the last salary they were receiving, including bonuses, allowances and benefits during service .

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article  ( 136 )  Grievance  Against  the  Decision  to  Terminate  the Service
texts.text: Article  ( 136 )  Grievance  Against  the  Decision  to  Terminate  the Service

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The employee may complain about the decision issued by the government authority to terminate their service in accordance with the provisions set forth in this regulation.
texts.text: The employee may complain about the decision issued by the government authority to terminate their service in accordance with the provisions set forth in this regulation.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article ( 137 ) Final Settlement of the Employee's Entitlements at the End of their Service
texts.text: Article ( 137 ) Final Settlement of the Employee's Entitlements at the End of their Service

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Upon the end of the employee's service or upon their death, they or their legal heirs, as the case may be, shall be paid the amount of the final settlement, as shown below:
texts.text: Upon the end of the employee's service or upon their death, they or their legal heirs, as the case may be, shall be paid the amount of the final settlement, as shown below:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. Gross salary, allowances and bonuses up to the end of the last working day.
texts.text: Gross salary, allowances and bonuses up to the end of the last working day.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. The reward due to the employee whose service is ended in the event of their retention after the end of their service to hand over what is in their custody, in accordance with the provisions of the law.
texts.text: The reward due to the employee whose service is ended in the event of their retention after the end of their service to hand over what is in their custody, in accordance with the provisions of the law.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. Cash allowance for the employee's balance of the periodic leaves due to them, which they did not fulfil until the end of the day preceding the date of termination of service in accordance with the provisions regulating that.
texts.text: Cash allowance for the employee's balance of the periodic leaves due to them, which they did not fulfil until the end of the day preceding the date of termination of service in accordance with the provisions regulating that.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d. Notice allowance in accordance with the relevant clause of these regulations, where applicable.
texts.text: Notice allowance in accordance with the relevant clause of these regulations, where applicable.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e. End of service benefits for non-citizen employees and other benefits specified in these regulations, where applicable.
texts.text: End of service benefits for non-citizen employees and other benefits specified in these regulations, where applicable.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: f. Any additional compensation or benefits, which the employee whose service is ended may be entitled to, as applicable, including overtime compensation due to them or compensation for total or partial permanent disability or death in accordance with the provisions of these regulations and the laws and systems in force.
texts.text: Any additional compensation or benefits, which the employee whose service is ended may be entitled to, as applicable, including overtime compensation due to them or compensation for total or partial permanent disability or death in accordance with the provisions of these regulations and the laws and systems in force.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Citizen employees shall be subject to the provisions of the Retirement Pensions and Benefits Law in force in the Emirate at the end of their service with the government authority.
texts.text: Citizen employees shall be subject to the provisions of the Retirement Pensions and Benefits Law in force in the Emirate at the end of their service with the government authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. A non-citizen employee shall be entitled to an end-of-service gratuity at the end of their service for any of the reasons specified by the law, as follows:
texts.text: A non-citizen employee shall be entitled to an end-of-service gratuity at the end of their service for any of the reasons specified by the law, as follows:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. One month's salary for each of the first five years of service.
texts.text: One month's salary for each of the first five years of service.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. One and a half month's salary for each year of the second five years of service.
texts.text: One and a half month's salary for each year of the second five years of service.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. Two months' salary for each of the following years of service in excess of that.
texts.text: Two months' salary for each of the following years of service in excess of that.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. The provisions prescribed in the legislations and regulations issued in this regard by the competent authorities in the Emirate shall apply to the employee who is allocated housing by the government authority at the end of his service.
texts.text: The provisions prescribed in the legislations and regulations issued in this regard by the competent authorities in the Emirate shall apply to the employee who is allocated housing by the government authority at the end of his service.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. The government authority may deduct from the final settlement amount due to the employee whose service is ended all amounts owed to the government or that are required by law or that the employee has previously agreed to deduct from their salary, including the salary for the periodic leave days in excess of what they are entitled to, taking into account the provisions for death grant.
texts.text: The government authority may deduct from the final settlement amount due to the employee whose service is ended all amounts owed to the government or that are required by law or that the employee has previously agreed to deduct from their salary, including the salary for the periodic leave days in excess of what they are entitled to, taking into account the provisions for death grant.

texts.orig: Article ( 138 ) Approval of the Final Settlement

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The  employee  whose  service  is  ended  or  their  legal  heirs,  as  the  case  may  be,  shall  sign  an acknowledgement stating their  approval  of  the  full  final  settlement  of  their  entitlements.  Appropriate procedures in this regard shall be taken when the entitlements of the deceased employee are handed over.
